Tests were very difficult for someone who is not an anthropology major and taking for a GE, which i wouldnt recomend. He doesnt use Carmen & the tests are essentially 70% making lists and they are the only 3 grades. However, he's a really nice guy and interesting class. Just be prepared to study a lot for the exams. Especially do the readings.

Dr. McGraw is my favorite professor at OSU! I took this class just because I wanted to take another of his courses! You can tell he loves the subject and is clear on the information being presented! He is always willing to help when you don't understand and very approachable. All you have to do is show up and take notes and you should get an A

He's literally awesome. So passionate about his field, he makes you care too. But no Carmen so he have to go to the lectures. If you do, the three exams will be easy. Best professor I've had here yet.

Prof McGraw makes me want to be an Anthropology major.  He is clearly passionate about this subject, always makes class fun and interesting, and I genuinely wish this class was everyday.  The tests have a lot of material on them, but are really fair. Take it!!!!!!!!!!

He is very passionate about primates - but as a student who was looking for a generally easy GE this is definitely not the class to take. While we watched some videos and there are only THREE exams, it is a lot of time consuming memorization and attendance is mandatory to get the information. He does not post the slides. Very nice guy though.

Fantastic teacher. One of the best classes I have ever taken. I couldnt wait to go to his class everyday, it was so interesting! He is so passionate about what he does and it rubs off on you. Take this class!!!! You will LOVE it!

Dr. McGraw really loves the subject of Primatology.  His lectures are incredibly interesting.  He often shows videos that are very interesting and his personal stories are amazing and often times rather entertaining.
What can I say Dr. McGraw is the best.
he's a good guy

He is one of the best professors I've ever had. The tests can be difficult, but he goes over everything that you need to know in class, so attendance is very important. He is willing to answer any questions you have. Overall one of the best classes I've ever taken!

Loved this class. He was so passionate and knowledgeable about the subject. Make sure you read the book. Tests were more difficult than I thought they would be, but they were multiple choice. We had three midterms (one during finals week - not cumulative) and two novels we had to read and then write 6 pages on. TAKE THIS CLASS!! You won't regret it
Really interesting teacher. I never though about falling asleep in his class. Tests were harder than expected though. Take good notes, read the book, and study more than you think you need to.
The best professor I've ever had.
More work than I expected but he is so passionate about primates that it's contagious.
Very cool, interesting guy.  Always very eager to help and extremely personable.  Tests weren't hard as long as you studied the material, but attendance is really important.

He is so interested in what he is teaching you can't help but be interested as well.  He explains things thoroughly and engages the class.  He talks fast and it is sometimes hard to take notes, but still a GREAT professor!!!
Very engaging lecturer, interested in helping students, and honestly, hot as well.

classes are a lot of fun and always interesting--not one you'll wnat to sleep through.  he's always eager to give extra help if needed.  has all sorts of great primatology books in his office he lends out--take advantage of his library.
Great classes, a lot of fun, very nice to look at...
The class was tons of fun.  Take any classes that you can from him.  As an added bonus, he's not at all hard on the eyes.

Class is fairly difficult... you definitely have to pay attention and know your stuff. He makes class really fun though. Even stuff like dna that should be boring is more interesting when he talks about it. Plus he's hot.. always a plus.
Very animated and excited about anthropology. Only three tests and no other assignments. He's reallllly cute too!
He always acts out what he says...I wish he didn't cancel his primate sexuality class...I can only imagine!
The best primatologist out there!!
excellent teacher, excellent classes, a lot of fun.

Realy nice and helpful and like to have fun.  But he gives no study guides, so you better make sure you attend all the classes and make goood notes.  Also make sure your read all the articles, or else the class will be hard.

summary_comment: Professor Hubbe is highly regarded as one of the best teachers at Ohio State, known for his charisma and genuine interest in student success. His classes involve mandatory weekly labs and biweekly quizzes (which are open note and relatively low-stress), along with module posters and weekly reflections. Students praise his engaging and humorous teaching style, as well as his flexibility and willingness to help.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hubbe is highly regarded as one of the best teachers at Ohio State, known for his charisma, commitment to student success, and engaging lectures filled with humor. His classes involve weekly labs and biweekly quizzes, with no exams, and include manageable poster assignments and reflective writing, all supported by his availability and willingness to assist students.

Ratings.comment: Best Professor at Ohio State!

Super charismatic and really wants his students to do well. Have to pay for a $45ish lab manual and lecture/labs are mandatory but no exams, just biweekly quizzes, module posters and weekly reflections

quizzes were completely open note, no midterm or final. four module poster assignments, but those we're fairly easy and don't need a lot of detail. labs every week which can take two hours depending on topic. tends to talk a lot and very fast in lectures so it can be hard to keep up, but overall he was very funny and interesting to listen to!
super nice professor who really cares about his students and making sure that we have the best educational experience possible.

Professor Hubbe is EASILY one of my all-time favorite professors.  His lectures were always fun to follow along and he always found a way to put his witty sense of humor into class.  The weekly workload was very manageable.  This is a great class to fulfill GE credits!
Very accommodating

Amazing guy, easy as that. The course consists of weekly labs and quizzes, and every three weeks there will be a summary of the lectures. He doesn't grade them, but everything comes straight from the slides. He is always willing to help and super understanding of anything that pops up.
Professor Hubbe is fun to listen to, and is very lose with due dates. He offers extra credit if you ask questions in class, and is great at explaining things in depth.
Didnt go to one class all semester. Had him for two courses. Best teacher ever. Very understanding. No due dates for the class. Easy A
Took this as an easy GE. There are weekly assignments, open note quizzes and 3 easy essays.

Dr. Hubbe did the lectures for this online course, which were recordings to be watched at any point of the week. Very good lectures from a passionate professor that is very helpful and knowledgeable if you're interested. Great person to have teaching the course.
we had loose due dates, he would rather our work be something we are proud of instead of getting it done on time.

solid course for natural science GE with a lab, summer term consists of 26 lectures(and a small reflection after each)+12 online labs+6 quizzes+ 4 study guides, the professor seems very passionate about the subject, lectures can be long and each lab might take you some time to complete but overall still a fairly easy and interesting class

Great person, amazing teacher. Course consists of lecture epiphanies/reflections, TopHat assignments, quizzes every other week, and occasional film essays -- all super doable & easy. Lectures a lot, but is open to questions/discussion from students. Understands students really well & makes class stress-free!
I really liked this class, along with the very interesting labs as wells. Overall an easy and enjoyable class.

This class was entirely asynchronous, but it was very easy. The Labs were simple and so were the Visual Study Guides. As long as you put effort into those, you should always get full credit. In terms of the quizzes, some of the questions are worded weird, but they follow the lectures. My only problem was with lectures; they are so long.

Professor Hubb is a great person, but not a good instructor. His course is hard to understand sometimes as his thoughts are jumping and without a clear main point. Some lab and quiz problems can be tough and tricky for those who had no experience of Anthropology before. Take this course as a GPA booster, but don't expect to learn a lot by taking it
Professor Hubbe is very funny and he cares about his students. He is extremely passionate about what he teaches. You do not need to buy the textbook.

You learn so much from his class and he is always very happy to help. Grading is very straight forward as long as you do the work. No exams, just bi weekly quizzes. Labs are a big part of your grade. You dont really need the book, only the lab notebook.

Very easy class. Mark is very lecture heavy and sometimes his lectures can be a bit dry. There are no exams just biweekly quizzes that are super easy. You can still turn in assignments late without any penalties.
Really helpful and accomodating. Doesn't mind if things are late as long as you do them and learn from them. No exams but multiple online quizzes.

This is a very easy GE lab credit. The lectures are all posted online, and you don't really need the textbook for anything. There are no tests, just biweekly quizzes online. The labs are very straightforward and interesting. Mark is very knowledgable about anthropology, so he is very willing to help anyone who needs it.
Wonderful professor!! Just a cool person and easy to talk to and cares about his students!! Would really recommend!!

Mark is super laid back. He cares about students, hates grading, and would rather focus his attention on making sure you gain something from the class than tearing you down. Great guy, great teacher. He can be a bit vague and scattered at times, though.

Mark was tough to understand sometimes and if you misspell things on quizzes you'd get points off, but there were always opportunities to get extra credit on quizzes and exams.  If you go to class and draw well (ok if you can decipher your own drawings), you'll be fine.
Great class just better be good at spelling or your grade will suffer

SEI.Subject: ANTHROP
SEI.Class Name: Seminars in Physical Anthropology: Quantitative Methods

SEI.Subject: ANTHROP
SEI.Class Name: Seminars in Physical Anthropology: Evolutionary Theory

summary_comment: Professor McCorriston is known for creating a dynamic and challenging academic environment, with extensive reading and frequent presentations. However, students often find her lectures and assessments overly dense and difficult to follow, leading to confusion about the overarching themes of the course. Her grading is subjective and not always aligned with the material covered in class, resulting in mixed reviews despite the course's perceived value.
summary_comment_short: Professor McCorriston is known for creating dynamic and challenging lectures with a heavy emphasis on detailed information and high-level academic discourse, which can be overwhelming and difficult to follow for some students. Her teaching style and grading criteria are subjective and often perceived as rigorous, with a focus on performance rather than content mastery, leading to mixed reviews regarding the overall learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Prof. McCorriston created a very dynamic environment with a lot of information provided, but I had trouble understanding what the greater themes of her class were. There was a lot of specific info in lecture, reading, and tests, but the material addressed in essays and the class syllabus was very vague. Still an interesting, beneficial class.

McCorriston is a super tough teacher. She is a nice person, but she grades work on what she 'thinks your true performance level COULD be' rather than the content put in the work. Her class was supposed to be anthro and turned into archaeology, she writes her own 'textbok info'  w/ grad level language. GE class that was way too hard & involved.

She expects too much out of us. She teaches at at 4000 level when it is just a GE I'm trying to pass. Her grading is all her opinion. She speaks at a very high scholarly level. she uses terms no one would know.

I found Joy had a very high interest in her studies and she has great stories about the amazon.  Her class is Lecture Lecture Lecture and you need to write down everything you can and ask if you miss something because she will explain it again.  Overall she was a good professor I was just off my game in her class and got a C and I am a 3.3.

This course has an 18 page syllabus.She plays favorites,is very unhelpful,the course has a presentation,group discussions,2 midterms where the notes won't help,and a term paper.In addtion,her grading is not on a point scale.She gives whatever grade she feels matches your level of work.Tons of reading.It dominated my life.Wouldn't take it again

Like a TED that goes on for 45 minutes, her English never dips below a graduate level which I enjoy but it seems to throw some off.  I've taken three of her classes and the quality of the experience is really directly related to the quality of the students you group with and whether you're taking it for kicks or using it to build towards a dig.

You will read A LOT. She has endless amounts of articles on Carmen to go over, along with sizable chunks of the assigned textbooks that need to be read before the next class. Group discussion every meeting. You'll also have to do a presentation in front of class. Her power points can be really confusing. Show interest & go to class. This WILL help.

Worst prof I've had at OSU. I went to her office hours, asked questions, but nothing works. Exams have nothing to do with her lectures. You gain nothing from them. The pwrpnts are just a bunch of pictures from her past research sites, and don't cover what the class should. "Effort" grading is a load, meaning she gives whatever grade she feels like.

Very self centered,always talking about her research.Not really knowledgeable about things other than her specific research.If she makes a mistake with what she is talking about she won't acknowledge it and will just skip ahead quickly.Plays favorites like it's her job. But if you are good at sucking up and pretending you're interested go for it!

She is so intelligent and so reknowned in the field, I really respect her. I was so intimidated by her at first, but as long as you do the reading, participate in class discussion and put in some effort you will do well in her class.

I respect this woman. She wants to help, is encouraging. She is so intelligent, well spoken; it is intimidating. She grades on effort too. Readings were difficult and even after discussion it was hard to grasp anything concrete since material is so old. Pwrpnts didn't summarize main points. Tests pretty fair. Am more interested in this subject now.

Excellent. Challenging. Every day during lecture, I was reminded why I love this field. Ignore the nay-sayers, she's difficult only if you are lazy. And if you are lazy, you shouldn't be in college anyway.

She is an incredibly articulate and intelligent woman - I am absolutely amazed with her knowledge and I wish there were more female instructors at the university to serve as role models for possible future academics.

I had her for 401, and 457.  Lots of group work, but 401 tests are easy. She is horrible for 457.  Was suppose to talk about Ancient Egypt, which we spent the last day of class about, and just watched a movie.  She spends the entire qtr, talking about what she is intersted in, but you learn nothing. Avoid her at all cost.
Great teacher, hard classes, show up and do what she asks and it's great.  Always do the readings.  Easy tests if you go to class.

Easy class for anthro majors!  Gives out a lengthy but detailed study guide for the midterm and final.  If you follow it, you'll be fine.  Go to her office hours and talk to her at least once or twice, show an interest in the class and she'll love you forever. You'll be surprised at how much you'll learn from her. Very clear and easy to understand.

The class had a lot of concepts that were foreign to most of the students, even though most of us were anthro majors--and she makes no effort to elucidate anything. The exams were killer, and no effort was made to organize the material. And just to make things worse, you have to print out pages and pages of activities on your own paper.

Dr. McCorriston's archaeology class was very interesting and well covered in the 10 weeks.  She highly encourages students to visit her office hours.  Also shows really old film clips on reels which are kind of fun.  This was a great class with a great prof.

she is very cocky and into herself.  She went to Yale so she thinks that shes better than everyone.  The class wasn't that hard, however.  She really made me mad because she refused to let me take my final early even though my ride was leaving.  AVOID HER CLASSES AT ALL COST

SEI.Subject: ANTHROP
SEI.Class Name: Archaeology of the Ancient Near East

SEI.Subject: ANTHROP
SEI.Class Name: Archaeology of the Ancient Near East

summary_comment: Professor Clark is highly regarded for her caring and engaging teaching style, making her courses both enjoyable and valuable. Students appreciate her passion for the subject and her efforts to foster a supportive learning environment, often noting her willingness to help students grow personally and academically. Her classes focus on discussions and personal reflection rather than traditional assessments, leading to a low-stress yet intellectually stimulating experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Clark is known for her caring and engaging teaching style, making her classes enjoyable and conducive to personal growth. She fosters a relaxed yet intellectually stimulating environment with no tests or quizzes, focusing instead on discussions, group work, and personal development.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Clark is a caring and understanding professor. This class is a discussion style course. Attendance is not mandatory but you are expected to journal on the topics we discuss each week (basically your thoughts nothing too heavy). There are no tests, no homework, no quizzes, and no final. Overall it's a valuable course to take.

She is a wonderful teacher. She loves her field and loves when students are interested and ask questions. I have had her for all of my anthro courses and I look for classes she teaches just to have her again. She gets to know her students and takes the time to learn about them. She is funny and creates an environment that makes you want to show up

I never review on here but Melissa deserves it. I took this class as an easy GE and didnt expect to like it but she makes this class interesting an fun. She is funny and nice and truly cares about her students more than everything especially for teaching a gen ed class where most people arent doing it as their major. Take her class!!
Very caring professor and a very easy A course. Keep in mind that every class is a group work class. People will be in your face all. the. time.

I can't sing Melissa's praises enough. Took her class to fulfill a GE, and so glad I did. Her class really focuses on developing you as a person and personal growth- she wants you to succeed. I work in policy now, and her class has really helped me be more aware of the interactions of the world around me. Take this class!

Melissa's class was super easy but I just don't feel like I really learned anything. If you are looking for an easy A this is the class to take. If you do poorly on an assignment she lets you fix your mistakes to get a higher grade.

This course has truly challenged my worldview, and her teaching style is conducive to true learning- there are never quizzes/tests, so there is no pressure to learn the material for temporary use only. She truly cares about her students, and wants you to learn without anxiety. Every educator should be like Melissa.

I really really liked Melissa as my anthropology teacher and I would highly recommend her. I had 2 lectures (1 hour and 20 minutes each) and a lab and I never once didn't think the class didn't go fast. She is so funny and she keeps the lectures interesting. She really is passionate about anthropology and everyone should take her class!

Took this class as a GE (not my major), she presents the material in a fun and interesting way that made me enjoy lecture. Easiest 4 credit class I've taken here, everything is straightforward and interesting if you give it a chance.

Took her in Autumn 2017 and her teaching style is mediocre at best. She shows to many videos and complains about her students a lot and does not expect that students need to hold their Professors to certain standards as well. There is a reason most of us choose the traditional setting versus the online setting.
Overall the class experience was great but believes people learn by quizzes rather then applying the material.

summary_comment: Professor Young excels in his teaching, transforming students' understanding of complex subjects with his deep knowledge and empathetic approach, significantly altering their perspectives from the outset of the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Young excels in his teaching, transforming students' understanding of complex subjects and significantly impacting their perspectives. His profound knowledge and empathetic approach make his classes both enlightening and engaging.

Ratings.comment: Professor Young is amazing at what he does. I had known nothing about the subject at the beginning and the class changed my whole world view. He is incredibly knowledgeable and empathetic.

SEI.Subject: ANTHROP
SEI.Class Name: The Middle East Close-Up: People, Cultures, Societies

summary_comment: Professor Walz is a polarizing figure among students, with some praising her as an excellent, understanding, and supportive instructor who encourages open discussion, while others find her lectures and quizzes challenging and the workload demanding. Her teaching style is heavily influenced by politics, which some students appreciate but others find off-putting. Overall, her effectiveness as a teacher varies significantly depending on the student's perspective and engagement level.
summary_comment_short: Professor Walz is known for her rigorous grading and challenging assignments, including a demanding 10-15 page final project. Her teaching style includes political discussions and long, sometimes boring article-based lectures, leading to mixed reviews with many students preferring alternative instructors.

Ratings.comment: Tough grader, every time i believe that i did well on a written and fix what she asks of me too I still never get a 100% or even 90%. 10-15 page final that is a lot a work. She is a very political teacher who talks about presidential candidates and makes it obvious where she stands. over half of the class switched out.

She is is a decent teacher who has mediocre lecturing skills. All you do is sit around and discuss articles from class. The articles are very long and extremely boring. She gives very hard quizzes over the articles. I would not recommend. If you have to take this class, then I would recommend taking a different professor.

Awesome professor! She is so helpful and understanding! She allowed discussions to be uncensored so it could really go anywhere, and she encourage new refreshing outlooks to be represented during discussions. If she was teaching a different course I would definitely sign up!

Awesome professor! She is so helpful and understanding! She allowed discussions to be uncensored so it could really go anywhere, and she encourage new refreshing outlooks to be represented during discussions. If she was teaching a different course I would definitely sign up!
Ms. Walz is a very nice girl and her outfits are cute. Don't buy the textbook.
If you pay attention in class and read the class is easy. No surprises on her testes. Very informative! Excellent teacher!
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Field is highly knowledgeable and passionate about her subject, often making light of the material to keep students engaged. She assigns a significant amount of work, including quizzes, readings, and discussion posts, but generally does not grade harshly. However, her grading can be inconsistent, and some students find her mood swings and rigidness in certain grading criteria challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Field is highly knowledgeable and passionate about her subject, often making light of the material to keep students engaged. However, her grading can be inconsistent and her mood swings may affect the classroom atmosphere, leading to mixed feedback on her overall teaching quality.

Ratings.comment: A very nice person, obviously very passionate about her field. Very knowledgeable and not too strict with grading. A fair amount of work (quizzes, readings, discussion posts, project). Don't bother reading the book if you're going to lectures (however, she wrote the book and gives you access for free!) The only warning is the group project.

I don't understand the negative reviews Dr. Field has. I was so scared of taking this course with her because of the reviews but was surprised by how amazing she is. She is clear about what she wants and has been one of the most amazing professors during the pandemic. The workload is the usual and nothing insanely hard if you read the material.

Dr Field can be very moody either in a great mood or very spiteful. She also grades quite rigidly on some things but others she does not for instance, the second paper we had to write everyone in the whole class got a 100% the third paper I received a 60 because I misinterpreted instructions. Reading are from POORLY written online pdf textbook.

Dr. Field is very knowledgeable and wants students to participate in her class. However, when you do, she doesn't always seem to appreciate it. Also, when you go to office hours, she doesn't always seem to be grateful of your time and makes the appointment seem rushed and isn't always conducive to asking more questions that what you came in for.

Dr. Fields was a great professor to have. The class lectures can be a bit boring at times, but she is good for a joke every now and then, which kept me awake. The class did not have many assignments (most grades being tests). The test are not too bad as long as you study.

Dr. Field was a great professor.  The class could be a little dry, but she tried to make it interesting and do different sorts of activities.  The tests were easy and she didn't grade any of the assignments particularly hard.  Overall, I would take another class with her.

I personally found the lectures and reading very dry. Maybe because I took this as a GE, I don't know, but I didn't really like the class. I felt the class topics were sometimes a little scattered feeling.

Dr. Field is simply awesome. Not only is she smart, but she is also incredibly organized and overall a pleasant person. She assigns SO MUCH READING THOUGH! Still, I would take another class with her in a heartbeat.

summary_comment: Professor Sefczek is highly regarded for his passion and deep knowledge of the subject matter, making the course engaging even in an online format. Students appreciate his availability and responsiveness to queries, though some find the tests challenging and not always aligned with lecture content. Overall, the course is manageable with minimal effort required for a good grade, though additional study may be necessary for success on certain assessments.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sefczek is known for his passion and deep knowledge of the subject, making the class engaging despite some challenging tests that go beyond lecture content. Students find the course manageable, with minimal required effort for a good grade, although some struggle with the tests and benefit from extra help.

Ratings.comment: He is very passionate and knows what he's talking about, but I found the tests to be harder than people said. Only needed to put in about one hour of effort a week in the class though and it was all online. Pretty easy A for a GE but some test questions were nowhere to be found in the lectures and he doesn't post the slides so you have to take note

For the subject he made the online course pretty interesting. I struggled on the tests and when I reached out for help he was more than enthusiastic to help me and offer advise which did end up helping. He uses Prezi for notes and then does either a quiz or a discussion post usually once a week. The exams were not too bad just detail oriented.
Very easy. Barely put in any effort.

He's readily available outside class if you have any issues with course related material and also regularly sends out updates that are very useful. Since this is an online course, there wasn't much else to add but he did his job perfectly.

Tim was great. I don't expect a ton from GE's like Anthro2200 but Time made class enjoyable and easy. He is passionate about the material and the class requires very little effort to receive an A. Would absolutely take again.

Tim is basically Ross from Friends. That being said he can lose his train of thought sometimes but he always pulls it back to the class and what we will be tested on. Hilarious lectures (as funny as Anthro can be) Definitely recommend taking this class. He is also very good at addressing student concerns and questions. Would for sure take again!!

Tim is very quick with responding to emails. Also, provide clear details if you ask him a questions.  He seems very passionate about Anthropology. His lectures are helpful, but if you substitute with reading, you should be fine.  Make sure you pay attention to the discussion board, they are easy and he makes it fun. Pay attention to essay question

All work can be done one day a week. Lectures on Prezi vary in length from 20 slides to 60. There are 3 tests. A couple discussion boards. Lab quizzes and lab every week. Lecture and quiz do not align every week so you have to use the online lab companion to understand quizlab. But he grades easy and it is interesting.

The best online science GEC you could take. Quiz and Lab every week and an occasional discussion board every 2-3 weeks or so. 3 exams which come directly from the lectures. Great Professor and is easy to get in contact with. If you are a not a science major but need a physical science GEC this is the class you should take.
Wonderful class. Actually got me interested in anthropology, influenced my decision on majors.  Very easy, but a very capable teacher.

One of my favorite professor's. Tried to make boring topics fun, kept lecture interesting. No book use, very easy labs and tests. I highly encourage anyone to take this class that needs and easy science with a lab.

Amazing professor. Makes you genuinely interested in the material which might otherwise be dry. This was one of my favorite classes I've taken at OSU. If you go to class and the review days you will definitely get a good grade.
Very easy to understand.  Made the class fun and interesting.

summary_comment: Professor Lagan is highly regarded for her engaging and well-organized teaching style, making the course both enjoyable and accessible. She excels at fostering student engagement and understanding, often going above and beyond to support her students. Her passion for anthropology is evident, and she creates a dynamic learning environment that keeps students actively involved.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lagan is highly regarded for her engaging and well-organized teaching style, making the course both enjoyable and accessible. Students consistently praise her ability to foster a dynamic and interactive classroom environment, where they feel supported and encouraged to ask questions and engage deeply with the material.

Ratings.comment: She was great!! Labs are completion and reflections are 50-100 words (opinion/relatable) graphical summaries can be resubmitted for better score/ no specific due dates
Really well designed and organized course, lectures are really engaging and fun to learn. Also a relatively easy class.

Emma Lagan is a gifted instructor who clearly loves to teach and loves anthropology. She's very amiable and has an ability to get the gears turning in her students (including myself) in a way I've never seen. The entire classroom is constantly engaged and asking questions.; she always lays out what is expected and follows the syllabus.

Best teacher I have ever had! She truly made the class interesting. Went above and beyond to help students understand the material. Class wasnt too hard. Shes hilarious and truly cares about her students she learned each and every one of our names. Take her class you wont be disappointed!

summary_comment: Professor Margolis is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, with students praising her as the best professor they've had at OSU. Her classes are lecture-heavy but very organized and easy, with a strong emphasis on accommodating student needs. However, some students find her public speaking style challenging, making lectures difficult to follow, despite the class being generally easy and completion-based.
summary_comment_short: Professor Margolis is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, making her one of the best professors at OSU according to students. However, her lectures are heavy and sometimes difficult to follow due to her less effective public speaking skills, while her organization and accommodation of student needs are praised.

Ratings.comment: Julie is the best!!
Lecture heavy

Sweetest and most caring professor I’ve had at OSU. Extremely accommodating and changed deadlines for student needs. She will make your life extremely easy and you will absolutely not regret taking her class. You can also see her passion through interesting lectures and labs. Super nice and you would have to try extremely hard to not get an A.

Throughout the semester, the class was super unorganized where we were doing lab assignments 1 week before we had lecture about the information She is honestly not that good at public speaking which makes lecture really hard to pay attention to and actually understand the information. The class is super easy though everything is completion graded.

summary_comment: Professor Gremillion's teaching quality varies widely according to student feedback. Some students found her classes easy and fair, with a mix of lectures and assignments, while others described them as challenging and sometimes dry, with harsher grading on exams. Overall, opinions range from average to highly critical, with significant differences in perceived difficulty and grading standards.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gremillion's teaching style is perceived as mixed, with some students finding her class easy and others challenging. While some appreciate her knowledge, laid-back approach, and quick email responses, others criticize her grading as harsh and find her lectures and exams difficult.

Ratings.comment: very unfair

It was an easy GE class mainly because it was online. Like one discussion per week, one quiz per week (easy to look up questions online), and 3 workbooks in total (so like one per month). The workbooks are small projects. Good easy class and she responds to emails fast too!

Graded off 2 tests (fairly difficult but not too much so) and 4 papers (the last worth far more then previous ones). She doesn't post lectures online so either read the book or don't and come to class. (don't need book if go to class).  Lectures are ok. She is not harsh on grading earlier papers. Overall, she is average.

Gremillion is super knowledgable. Entire class was lecture so they can feel long and especially due to the topic be very dry. Can come off as intimidating at first but she's very nice. Easy grader on research papers/essays but the two midterms were pretty hard. Participation grade based on attendance. 3 essays, 2 midterms, research paper, final
Worst professor i ever had

Dr. Gremillion is a great professor.  It is mostly lecture, but if people start asking questions then class can quickly turn into a large discussion.  If you come to class and do her assignments you will do fine.  If you actually read that books/textbooks you'll do even better.

Very laid back class with interesting topics that can spark some intriguing discussion.  Three one page writing assignments that are easy, and a final project on a plant of your choice.  Very laid back class.
Worked harder than i have for any class before and didnt get an A for the first time. boring as hell and she grades hard on the exams, she also has no personality whatsoever

Literally one of the most boring classes I've taken. Two hours of her going over slides, without much participation from the class. She offered study guides for her exams, which helped, and told to study from those. But then some of her exam questions were different! Very frustrating.
Dr. Gremillion is super laid-back and class has an easy-going feel to it. Her lectures are more like conversations and class discussions are usually pretty interesting.

Class is very laid back, but somehow she makes the material interesting. Very kind woman. Homework assignments are very easy. Final project on a plant of your choosing. Highly recommend taking this as a GEC - it definitely beats taking actual biology courses.
enjoys teaching, cares about students and it shows
Class was enjoyable--Willing to help!

Dr. Gremillion is great. I took her class last fall and she is really enthusiastic about what she studies. Her tests are tough, all essay, but very fair. You have to study hard, and you'll do well. Exactly how an honors class should be taught. Great job Dr. G! :)

Kris has a great personality.  Even when we are working with really dry material, she is fun-loving, and the class gets into really meaningful discussions sometimes, even when they stray from the course some.  She is very nice and always willing to help you learn.  Plus, I think the course subject matter is very interesting to begin with.
a bit boring, but that is mainly due to the material itself. she is very nice and helpful; plus, her study guides are just about right on the money. i would take a class with her again.

Her exams are all essay pretty much; she gives you a list of terms and you have to give a short description; some require more though, and there is a big essay at the end. Her reviews helped a lot and she is very approachable. I would recommend her.
She def. expects than I thought initially. of course, it beats taking the class with mccort.!
Her lectures and exams/assignments are completely different worlds. She expects more than you first think!

For being an honors class, it was actually kinda easy. The lectures were pretty dull, though. Good luck staying awake in class, but the tests aren't too hard. All the material is straight from the powerpoints.

Worst class I've ever had. Every day I went I wanted to shoot myself just so I wouldn't be bored anymore. She teaches monotone and doesn't tell you anything you can't get off a PBS documentary about prehistoric cultures (and yes, she was in one). If you don't have any interest in old bones and pointless information, stay away. At least she's nice.

I found the material extremely boring, but can't blame that on the professor.  Dr. Gremillion was really a nice teacher and was helpful in teaching me.  Studying for the exams was mostly memorization.  She grades easy on exams and papers and gave a lot of good insight.
The class was interesting.  Not too hard, not too easy.  Pretty run of the mill.

I LOVED THIS CLASS! at first i thought it was boring, but dr.g's insight made it all really interesting. a very understanding and helpful prof. tests came directly from outlines she gave out, and we only had one big essay due at the end of the quarter.
First of all, it's Kris - she's a woman.  Second, she was great, engaging, and knowledgeable.  A fun class with the discussion.  A lot of memorization, but a lot of thinking exercises as well.

I did very well in this class considering the time I put into it. I attempted to take notes in the class until I would fall asleep. I found her very interesting though. She's a nice lady and her tests are easy. I learned some things from this class.
Awesome human being, with lectures and tests that are clear and well designed. If you have an opportunity to take any course from this professor do so!

summary_comment: Professor Liu is highly regarded for his passion and engagement with the subject matter, making the class interesting and discussion-oriented. Students appreciate his approachability and willingness to provide feedback, though they note that his feedback can be inconsistent and confusing. While the class requires significant reading, attending lectures is crucial as much of the material is covered there. Overall, Professor Liu is seen as an excellent teacher who effectively conveys complex concepts.
summary_comment_short: Professor Liu is highly passionate about his subject and known for making classes engaging and interesting. However, his teaching style is challenging, with significant reading loads and strict grading, particularly from TAs, which can be demanding for students.

Ratings.comment: Morgan's class was fun. However, fun does not always translate into good teaching skills. He does not give helpful feedback. His feedback was very inconsistent, and confusing.

He's amazing and passionate about the topic. Beware that the TA is a tough grader but as long as you talk to Prof. Liu he will give points back. Expect to read to get rich knowledge on the content for Student responses and make sure that you attend lectures (talks about readings).

Loved Professor Liu. Super passionate about the topic. Discussion posts every week and some group assignments. The exams are essay format. Very discussion orientated class, as long as you understand the concepts your fine. A lot of the work is opinion and perception based. I never read the assigned readings, theres a lot.

Made the class very interesting, I enjoyed the material. There is a fair amount of reading, but honestly you don't need to do most of it, you can get most of the material from just going to class and paying attention. He is a very approachable professor who seems to actually want the students to take something from the class.

Anthro 2241 was not a hard class, but Liu did assign a ridiculous amount of reading for a GE class. He's the kind of prof that thinks that their class is the only class on campus and that no one has anything other to do than read 50-70 pages of text between lectures. Don't miss class, he took 15% off my grade for just 3 unexcused absinces

This class is harder than any anthropology class should be.  Several times he assigned 70 page reading assignments on Tuesday that were due on Thursday. He also gives you less than 10 minutes to do quizzes that require written responses and if you don't nail exactly what he is looking for he will grade harshly. Take any other Anthro class.
Learned a ton from professor Liu. One of the best professors at OSU.

Prof. Liu is a great teacher, very passionate about the subject. He gives a midterm and final which are essay tests and consistently cover what he emphasizes in class. I recommend him very highly, I learned a great deal from Prof. Liu.

Good professor, he's leaving for central asia for a few quarters but look him up next year, all essay class but really easy to bs your way to a B and if you know what you're talking about you can do better

Prof. Liu was excellent in selecting content to cover, so as to give thorough views of complex subjects.  He sometimes allows class discussion to drift somewhat and may allow people to say incorrect things because he's very polite.  Otherwise, one should find his classes very enjoyable and presentation of information very down-to-earth.

Really smart guy who knows what he's talking about. The readings were alot but also intresting. Kind of strict on his quizes, if you don't answer what he's looking for in a question don't expect the best grade. Great guy though, and oh he takes particpation in class seriously, so expect yourself to particpate if you want an A.
if you do the readings its easy to get a good grade. hes is very intelligent and friendly. but lots and lots of reading. i highly recommend him.

summary_comment: Professor Peterson delivers a high-quality online general education class that is both engaging and easy to pass, with a focus on course material and personal interest. Students appreciate his enthusiasm and accessibility, though he is new to teaching. His lectures are interesting, and he occasionally shares insights from his research, making the class both enjoyable and informative.
summary_comment_short: Professor Peterson delivers a high-quality online general education class that is straightforward and relaxing, making it an excellent choice for students seeking a stress-free learning experience. He is a knowledgeable instructor who genuinely cares about his material and engages students with his research, though his course is described as relatively easy, especially for those who attend lectures and stay engaged.

Ratings.comment: Exactly what you want from an online gen ed class. Highly recommend if you just want a chill class on your schedule.
New teacher who cared about the course material. Very easy A for anyone who needs honors credits :)

I personally loved this class! Whenever I brought him up to other students, he was lovingly called the "monkey professor". He'll talk about his research during class and it's genuinely interesting. His course work is quite easy, as long as you show up and pay attention during lecture, you'll get a good grade. Quizzes are open-note and pretty easy.

summary_comment: Professor Sutton is known for her engaging and enjoyable lectures, which are both concise and informative. She is perceived as a caring and understanding instructor who wants her students to succeed, though some students find her grading policies, particularly for labs and reflections, to be repetitive and somewhat tedious. Overall, many students find the class to be an easy A, especially for fulfilling general education requirements.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sutton is highly regarded for her engaging lectures and supportive teaching style, making the class accessible even for non-science majors. Her approach is generally easy, with fair exams and open-note quizzes, though some students have noted that the labs and projects can be quite basic and tedious.

Ratings.comment: I enjoyed Dr. Sutton, her lectures were very engaging and I found a lot of the content to be very fun. Dr. Sutton is very understanding and it is very apparent that she wants her students to succeed and do well. Just be open with her and make an attempt to engage in class and she will appreciate it very much.
Dr. Sutton is concise and descriptive.

pretty uptight teacher, having a really high skill English comprehension/ using pretty big words seems to threaten her, and she will believe a faulty ai detector and threaten you with reporting when everything was 100% human written. so be sure to dumb your stuff down a bit otherwise you risk being flagged.

Definitely an easy A. Good lectures/slideshows with engaging content, but every assignment was essentially graded for completion with the exception of the labs/projects. Definitely a good class to get you into anthropology, or just to fill a GE requirement.

Easy A. Quizzes are open note. Projects are middle school science level. Prof is kind and lowkey funny. Labs are also middle school level. Only downside is lab reports and weekly reflections; they are both incredibly easy but so boring because they feel like elementary level. Best class to fulfill GE and honors requirements as non science major.

I'm here to make sure she has a 5 out of 5. Took her class in 21Spring, she's still one of my favorite instructors at OSU! You can feel she's super sweet, caring and passionate. Her exams are fair too.

Great professor and a genuinely easy A. Labs were worth small portion of your grade but you get full credit if a reasonable attempt was made. There were 3 exams worth most of your grade that weren't too bad so as long as you passed those you passed the class.

I took ANTHROP 2200 online for my bio credit (not a stem person) I thought the class was super boring but its pretty easy if you are just getting a GE credit. The online labs wernt supported on my laptop so i would fail everyone and I still got an a. If you enjoy learning about evolution you would love this class.

Really cares about the material. Very upbeat and interesting lectures. Makes you work for the grade but is reasonable. I really enjoyed the class. She did very well condensing 15 weeks of material into 6 week summer course. I am actually sad that classes are finished.

This was a great online course! She had a rubric for every assignment and as long as you follow that and put effort into your writing, you'll do fine. The subject was actually really interesting and surprisingly made me want to take more anthropology courses.

summary_comment: Professor Martinez's teaching style is criticized for being repetitive and time-consuming, with many students finding the lectures boring and unnecessary. His classes often exceed the necessary length, focusing on reading PowerPoint slides verbatim, which some students feel could be covered in much less time. While a few students appreciate his willingness to help and offer extra support, the majority find his approach ineffective and a waste of time.
summary_comment_short: Professor Martinez's teaching style is widely perceived as repetitive and time-wasting, with many students finding the lectures unnecessary and boring. The majority of feedback indicates that the material could be covered in far less time than the allotted hour, and some find the class difficult to engage with due to his tendency to read from PowerPoint slides without adding substantial value.

Ratings.comment: Respectfully, this guy's wasting my time. Can't wait to see how he's going to manage to yap for an entire hour each week the rest of the semester. The entirety of this course could be absorbed in one class period, but David seems to think we need to hear him repeat himself loudly ad nauseum. If you value your time, I recommend avoiding.

This class is incredibly easy but super boring. Attending lectures wasn't necessary at all and honestly was a waste of time. He didn't say anything of much substance during the hour-long class and I always regretted going whenever I did. The number of people attending class dropped dramatically after the first few weeks if that tells you anything.

This was for my mandatory freshman seminar- it was extremely easy but also extremely boring. While it could be taught in just one or two classes, he uses the entire hour every week. He also just reads off of power point slides which you could do by yourself.

He loves to hear himself speak and stand in front of a classroom. He makes the class extremely boring and takes it WAY to serious for basically a freshman seminar class. The informations helpful, but it can be don't within 20 minutes instead, he stretches the entire hour. Also all he does is read off the slides, thank you i can read!!!

HORRIBLE.  It has been three quarters now and I am still furious about this class.  I took it as a senior as one of my last GEC courses, I have a 3.8, and I got a B.  WHY?  Because I know more about him than I do about Anthropology.  He goes through about 100 P.P. slides a class...WORST class and teacher I have ever had.

He kinda cares and means well, but is incompetent. I don't remember a single time when he could answer a student's question with assurance.  Maybe its his lack of experience that is to blame. But he will go off the subject, talk about completely irrelavant things, and waste your time! Nice guy, but you'll have to self-teach to get good grade.

David is extremely helpful. He goes above and beyond to make sure you get an A in his class. Loves visitors during office hours and in genuine during and outside of class. Take Anthropology 202 it is extremely interesting!

summary_comment: Professor Weiss is highly regarded for her engaging lectures and approachable demeanor. Students appreciate her ability to foster a deep understanding of the subject matter, especially in anthropology. Her assessments are largely based on memorization and attendance, with regular quizzes, occasional tests, and no final exam, making the course manageable for those who stay engaged.
summary_comment_short: Professor Weiss is an engaging and kind lecturer who fosters a deep understanding of the subject matter through active participation and thorough engagement with the material. Her classes are structured with regular quizzes and online labs, though the final exam is optional, making the course accessible to students who prepare diligently.

Ratings.comment: Super interesting class and Professor Weiss is so kind. If you actually care and do the work like it is supposed to be done, she can tell and really get to know your work. If you just watch the lectures, which are super interesting if you like Anthropology, this class is an easy A. Quizzes every once in a while, easy weekly online labs, no final.
Great lecturer. She is super friendly and the test is mostly memorization. Go to class and lab because the test is mostly based on those. You will need to buy a lab manual but that is it.

summary_comment: Professor Mertus is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and approachable demeanor. Students find his courses manageable, with a mix of online labs, reflections, and module posters, and appreciate his understanding and support, especially during challenging times. His engaging lectures and supportive feedback make the coursework both interesting and accessible.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mertus is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and approachable demeanor, making the class accessible even for general education students. His clear explanations, understanding nature, and engaging lectures contribute to a positive learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Super easy professor for a gen ed. Most of the homework consists of online labs and weekly reflections, along with three module posters. No complaints. Plus the course content is actually pretty interesting.

Ben did an amazing job navigating this asynchronous class. He always explained things and left encouraging feedback on the module posters. He encouraged you to personalize the material to yourself in the reflections. Extremely understanding guy and the assignments are not too hard. I definetly recommend this class and professor.
Genuinely one of the nicest people I've had the opportunity of learning from. He's very forgiving when it comes to grading, and seems interested in the material he's presenting.

Ben is one of the best professors I've had here. I had a family emergency during the semester and he has been super understanding and helpful with my situation. The quizzes aren't exactly from the notes, they're more conceptual, but aren't bad. He makes the lectures entertaining and the labs are easy.

summary_comment: Professor Kawa is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which transforms potentially dull subjects into enjoyable learning experiences. Students appreciate his detailed feedback, quick responses to emails, and understanding approach, allowing for some flexibility in attendance while still maintaining high academic standards. Overall, he is praised for his passion, empathy, and ability to create a welcoming and fun classroom environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kawa is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which transforms potentially dull subjects into enjoyable learning experiences. Students consistently praise his responsiveness, detailed feedback, and understanding approach, noting that while attendance is mandatory, he offers flexibility with a limited number of allowed absences.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Kawa was absolutely amazing. He is great at making lectures engaging and interesting. He is very humorous and provides amazing feedback. Attendance is mandatory but he is very lenient and gives you a certain amount of absences. I always looked forward to going to his class.
Probably one of the best, most caring professors. His classes are great and he is very understanding of students needs. I would take this class again if I could!

Professor Kawa is the most down to earth teacher I've ever had. He is incredibly knowledgeable and empathetic. He takes a subject that is indescribably boring and makes it enjoyable. He may be may favorite Professor.
He responds to emails very quickly, and he always gives detailed feedback on students' assignments.
He's really dope, and the class is easy. Lectures are mandatory but you get 5 absences throughout the semester.

He was a very understanding teacher that knew college students needed a break every now and then. He made sure to get everyone involved in class in a comfortable welcoming way. The class felt like a fun group to be apart of

Every class/lecture/discussion was incredibly interesting. Hes respectful of each person in the class and is willing to be accommodating for whatever. Legitimately Ive gone out of class and other students will be talking about how much they love the prof and class.

Dr. Kawa is a lot of fun in class and obviously super passionate about his area of study. As long as you put a little bit of effort into the exam study guides and keep up with the readings, you won't have any problems. One of the best professors in the anthro department without a doubt.

Dr. Kawa is amazing. One of the top three professors I had at OSU and that's saying a lot because I had some great ones. He is really invested in helping students learn about what interests them and he is always smiling which makes coming to class much easier. Take his class if you can, you won't regret it.

Kawa is an AWESOME, caring professor who made this potentially boring class interesting and relevant. He has clear study guides for his exams and grades fairly easily. He does take regular attendance for a grade but is flexible about due dates if need be. Worst part was the group project because group projects. Take a class with him!

Dr. Kawa is an awesome professor. His class is very interesting and he really likes hearing  students' opinions and discussing in class. He is very funny and friendly and I highly recommend taking his class. The assignments aren't too difficult and they are usually fun. There are a few "pop" quizzes, but tells you when to expect them.

Great professor! He keeps lectures entertaining and interesting, and does a great job of relating to students. He is hilarious and keeps up to date with the times. His lectures are easy to understand. We had 2 online exams, 7 reading responses, and a couple group assignments. Very understanding and flexible with deadlines. Take him if you can!

summary_comment: Professor Betz is highly regarded for her insightful teaching style and genuine interest in her students' success. Her courses are known for their flexibility, with open note quizzes, optional lectures, and a lenient late work policy. Students appreciate the opportunity to explore various perspectives and find her classes both engaging and manageable, with tests and labs being generally straightforward.
summary_comment_short: Professor Betz is highly regarded for her insightful teaching and ability to foster a broad perspective among students. Her courses are praised for their flexibility, with open note quizzes, a generous late work policy, and easy assessments both in labs and on tests.

Ratings.comment: I greatly appreciate how much I was able to learn about people and our world. This course was very open-ended, and the professor was very insightful. If you enjoy sharing your thoughts, or simply wish to broaden your perspective, don't miss out on this course.

Professor Betz has a huge interest in the subject that she teaches and genuinely wants her students to succeed. Open note quizzes, optional lectures, and a very flexible late work policy. If you have the chance to take her - please do. She's really an awesome person.

Barbara was a great professor and she made this class interesting. The notes were posted online and the online lab quizzes were easy. There were 3 tests which make up the majority of your grade. The labs were easy and you got 100% for showing up and doing the work. I would definitely recommend her as a professor for this course.
3 tests total very easy class. Test's are not hard, notes are posted online. Labs are basically automatic 100%. Easiest lab classes at osu.

summary_comment: Professor Kane is an enthusiastic and understanding instructor who delivers engaging lectures and maintains a manageable workload. Students find her approachable and effective, though they note that her exams can be challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kane is an enthusiastic and understanding teacher who delivers engaging lectures and maintains a manageable workload. Students find her approachable and effective in helping them succeed, though her exams can be challenging.

Ratings.comment: I did not think I would enjoy this class as much as I did. The lectures were interesting, the workload was fairly light in my opinion, and Dr. Kane was a really great and understanding professor.
Erin is great. She is super clear and knows what she is doing. If you show up, you will pass. It's really not that difficult and she is nerdy and fantastic.
She is a kind teacher, but her class and exams are not easy.
Very good and enthusiastic teacher.

summary_comment: Professor Biwer is highly knowledgeable and passionate about archaeology, which he effectively communicates in his lectures. However, his teaching methods can be confusing due to constant changes in assignment due dates and a lack of detailed feedback on papers. Despite these issues, students find his classes accessible and manageable, with minimal required effort leading to potentially significant GPA boosts.
summary_comment_short: Professor Biwer is an knowledgeable and passionate instructor, though his teaching style can be somewhat dry at times. Students appreciate his efforts to clarify assignments and make the material accessible, but note issues with inconsistent due dates and occasional lack of feedback on graded work.

Ratings.comment: He gave me a zero on a paper with no explanation. He would also change due dates on assignments constantly, making it confusing for everyone.

Good guy and obviously very informed and passionate about archaeology. Sometimes lectures can get a little dry but can supplement the material with readings. Easy for GE credit but put in the average amount of work because there are 1-2 assignments a week. For somebody who wasnt interested in archaeology this class wasnt bad.

Great guy and obviously passionate about archaeology. Tries his best to make every assignment clear for you to get all of the points. Most everything is effort based. I have absolutely no interest in archaeology but he has made it pretty accessible. One to two assignments per week but they take very little time. This class should be a GPA boost.

summary_comment: Professor Brzezinski is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, making the class accessible and straightforward. Exams primarily consist of material directly from the slides, ensuring students can perform well with thorough preparation. Her class is widely recommended by students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Brzezinski is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, making the class accessible and straightforward, with exams closely aligned to the material presented in slides. Students strongly recommend her class for its clarity and ease of understanding.

Ratings.comment: One of my favorite lecturer. The class is easy and exams are just things directly from the slides. Definitely recommend this class with her.

summary_comment: Professor Piperata is known for her rigorous and intellectually stimulating approach to teaching, which challenges students to engage deeply with the material. However, her lectures can be dense and sometimes leave students feeling overwhelmed, particularly regarding the biological aspects of anthropology. Students appreciate her clear structure and high expectations, which lead to significant learning gains but also demanding assessments.
summary_comment_short: Professor Piperata is known for her rigorous and structured approach to teaching, which challenges students to engage deeply with the material and participate actively in discussions. However, her lectures are sometimes criticized for being tedious and lacking adequate explanation, particularly regarding the biological aspects of anthropology.

Ratings.comment: This class made me question being an anthropology major. The content was interesting, but she managed to make the learning tedious and surface level. She does not adequately explain the biological side of what she teaches, leaving students to try to decipher what she meant. Lectures were hastily thrown together with typos and poor formatting.

I have also taken ANTH3302 with her. She can be very straight-forward and a little intimidating, but her lectures are great and they spark awesome conversation in class. She expects participation and will call on you if you are not talking. Her exams definitely require work, but I was able to get an A+ in both of her classes.

Here's the deal about this professor: if you don't think like her, you will lose points. She does not have a grading rubric and her grading logic is statistically messed up. The course is quite interesting, but I wish they had a graduate student or even other professors teach it.

There are a lot of readings and videos that are you are required to watch outside of class, but they all have a purpose. She loves having discussions with the class because she genuinely cares about what you think! She is a little intimidating at first, but she is extremely caring and wants what is best for her students and her tests reflect this.

Dr. Piperata is awesome. She knows the material very well, and if you mention something she doesn't know, she'll look it up and get back to you in the next class or two. I never read any of the readings except right before the tests, but they were interesting when we had discussions on them. I'm excited to take another class of her's in the fall.

Amazing professor and intellectually stimulating class. However, a lot of reading as I took it for a GE - very participation heavy as the class is seminar style. Exams are based on a lot of material. Had to put in a lot of work for the class but generally did not mind because I enjoyed Dr. Piperata and the subject matter was so interesting

Dr. Piperata is no-nonsense. This reflects in a clearly structured class and difficult grading. She really makes you work if you want an A. You will come away from her classes with a wealth of new knowledge and skills.

I really enjoyed this class. If you're good at memorizing test answers, you'll be fine. I found her power points really useful, so while she doesn't take attendance, I recommend going for the notes. If you're a good listener and test taker, this is the class for you. I'm not an anthro major, but I was interested in the topic for a GE.

I liked the class. I thought she was a good teacher and very interesting to listen to. I did find her exams to be very difficult. I felt like she asked  slightly obscure questions and many of the answers I could easily have talked myself into. I hate tests with "D.All of the Above...E.None of the Above..." answer choices for all the questions

Amazing. She is not going to spoonfeed you info just to spew back - if that's the kind of prof you want, move along. She will challenge you to think for yourself (wow, what a concept in an academic environment!) and to analyze things on your own. She expects you to have read your assignments and to actively participate in class. Loved every minute!

Terrible Professor-avoid at all costs! Doesn't list assignments on syllabus, must check class site. Not helpful in class or outside. Tests on trivial things that she says. Does not explain what she actually wants. Sincerely interested in this topic wish I would have taken ANYONE else.

The worst professor I've had at OSU.She made an otherwise interesting class dreadful.Readings are extensive but more useful than her lectures which are so fast and sporatic your head will spin.Her exams are impossible,and in no way represent your knowledge of the subject.Very unhelpful I have a 3.8 in my Anth major and got a C in her class AVOID!

Barbara is the most wonderful professor I have had at OSU so far. If I had taken her class earlier on in my undergrad years I may have changed my major. Barbara challenges you and pushes you to think for yourself. There is a lot of reading, but I really enjoyed her choices. I am a science major and got an A. Everyone should have to take this class.

Dreadful...she is the worst teacher in the anthro department hands down. you will never write all of her notes since she goes so fast, but you'll be tested over every tiny detail. If you don't care about making an A or B, then she's the prof for you, otherwise wait for someone else to teach your course.

Not a good professor at all. A TON of reading, and no textbook to clarify what we did in class. She spoke so fast that you can't write it all down AND copy all the notes from her slides, but she expects you to get both magically. She was useless in office hours and ignored emails about when help was needed. AVOID!!!!!

If you aren't interested/don't really care about the topic then I would avoid taking her class.  That said, if you are an ANT major or you are legitimately interested then she is one of the best professors out there. Always pushing you to think for yourself and very approachable, not to mention attractive.
Not my fav prof.. can be interesting but relatively boring. Mainly about discussion, alot of reading, and some debate. Tests not really off the lectures, and must be very detailed during test.

The class was interesting but there is a TON of reading. Liked the class discussions but they got a little repetitive after a while. Weekly reading quizzes asked for the most abstract details and prof. didn't care that almost the whole class failed almost all of them. If your not an anthro major avoid this class! Not helpful at all in office hrs.

This class involved a lot of reading, and was taught purely as a discussion class. It was interesting to hear everyone's comments, although lectures may have been helpful. She gave almost weekly quizzes, which contained questions purely about what points she thought were interesting, so being good at mind reading professors thought processes might
one of my favorite instructors at osu. fun AND funny AND cute, i would recommend her to everyone i know

She is a horrible teacher, in addition to being a horrible person. She is nasty to the students she doesn't like and will tell you up front that she rolls her eyes at students she has problems with. She will talk about you behind your back and give you an unfair grade. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

I really enjoyed Barabara's teaching method. She was extremely helpful and friendly outside of class. The material she presented was interested, and everything on her exams comes straight from her lectures. I would definitely take another one of her classes.

One of the worst proferssors I've had at OSU. Not willing to help students outside of class. Always complaining about how busy she is. She used to teach at a semester school so she rushed through material to shove it into a quarter. Midterms were not based off lectures like she claimed. Avoid this class! Unless you have a strong bio background..

SEI.Subject: ANTHROP
SEI.Class Name: Seminars in Physical Anthropology: Biocultural Medical Anthropology

summary_comment: Professor OHara is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to teaching, making complex subjects accessible and engaging. Students find her approachable and supportive, with many noting her willingness to extend deadlines and provide extensions. While the workload is manageable and spread out, some find the material challenging and technical, though generally agreeable with her teaching style.
summary_comment_short: Professor O'Hara is highly regarded for her passion and understanding, making the subject engaging even for non-science majors. Her classes are challenging but manageable, with a focus on consistent effort rather than cramming, and she offers flexibility and support to her students.

Ratings.comment: Mackie is super caring. Class is a definitely has work but very manageable. Everything due at the end of semester including the easy quizzes that are not bad as long as you study. Labs are completion. I procrastinated till the last two weeks and still got done with an A. She is very understanding and passionate about the subject which makes it fun

Mackie is the sweetest. Class is a decent amount of work, but not hard at all. She did not have a certain due date for anything, you could work at your own pace. However, I highly recommend working throughout the semester because it will be a lot if you let everything pile up. She gave the whole class a two-day extension at the end of the semester.

Mackie is incredibly passionate about teeth and makes a scientific subject interesting to non-science majors. Her voice is really calming, so I enjoy watching her lecture videos, and all of the assigned work for the week is broken up nicely. Shes a really understanding, genuine person who just wants to help students dip their toes into Anthro.
Difficult language. Super technical. GE Online Class but is taken way to seriously. Way more difficult than need be.

Mackie is a super super good instructor! Her passion on studying teeth engages me lot on learning anthropology! All the answers on the exams can be reviewed through lecture PowerPoints, and she is really patient if you have any simple question! Her office hour will indicate some of significant points that MIGHT appear on the exams!

summary_comment: Professor Downey excels at fostering a supportive learning environment where students actively engage in hands-on experiences and group discussions, genuinely aiming for their success. His approach enhances understanding and retention, making his classes highly recommended.
summary_comment_short: Professor Downey excels in fostering an engaging and supportive learning environment where students actively participate and learn through collaborative experiences. His commitment to student success is evident, making his classes highly recommended.

Ratings.comment: Professor Downey genuinely wants his students to succeed. A lot of the class is learning through experience and discussing in groups. Definitely recommend taking the class with him.

SEI.Subject: ANTHROP
SEI.Class Name: Seminars in Physical Anthropology: Quantitative Methods II: Advanced

SEI.Subject: ANTHROP
SEI.Class Name: Seminars in Physical Anthropology: Quantitative Methods

SEI.Subject: ANTHROP
SEI.Class Name: Seminars in Physical Anthropology: Quantitative Methods

summary_comment: Professor McGuire generally receives positive feedback for her organization and understanding of her subject matter. Students appreciate her leniency with late assignments and her care for students' well-being. However, some find the course content somewhat boring and wish for clearer expectations and more thorough reviews of course materials before posting. Overall, she is viewed as a supportive and effective instructor, particularly for asynchronous online courses.
summary_comment_short: Professor McGuire offers a relatively easy course with clear, well-organized content and a user-friendly Carmen page. While some find her understanding and supportive, others feel her expectations could be more clearly communicated, and the lectures can be quite boring.

Ratings.comment: Overall, this was a relatively easy course and Dr. McGuire did a pretty good job of instruction. As others have said, she grades but does not present in the video lectures. I do wish she was clearer with her expectations and reviewed the course content before posting it. Some of her expectations contradicted what the assignments said.

Dr. McGuire was very understanding when it came to late assignments and even gave us up to 10 assignments to have regarded throughout the semester. The lectures themselves are not recorded by Dr. McGuire. Lecturer seems to really know what he's talking about, but if you're just taking this as a GE like I am, it's very easy to fall asleep.

Her carmen page is well-made and is easy to navigate, the course is clearly outlined, assignments are easy, and the weekly labs are mostly completion. No exams, just biweekly quizzes that are not hard if you paid attention. The lectures were recorded by someone else, and were also very good and enjoyable. Very good as a asynchronous online course.

She was awesome as a professor. Her carmen page was easy to navigate through weekly modules. So understanding of COVID and lenient when given reasoning. Weekly discussion posts and intriguing challenges. Open note quiz almost weekly. Highly suggest taking this course!

Dr. McGuire is hands down the best. She is so caring about her students and especially genuine. She was a student not too long ago so she definitely understands mental health issues and is very understanding about things that may pop up. 10000/10 would recommend as a interesting elective that youll get something out of. Love Dr. McGuire!
-Content was very boring but a course easy to pass if you complete all assignments. Professor was organized but wasn't the most helpful.

Fair class. If you read the syllabus and chapters in the book, review the lectures, and do the homework on time, it's an easy A. Exam questions come right from the course (textbook/lectures/online resources she posts), and she gives study guides ahead of time so you know exactly what's on them.
Awful. Group projects for online classes. Insanely long online lectures and very specific, very useless questions on tests.

This is not an easy online class.  I was told it was, it's not.  It's the most boring class/lecture I've ever participated in.  It honestly probably isn't that hard, but lectures are so boring that you literally cannot make it through them.  There is WAY too much content and is WAY tto in depth for an intro class.
