I took this class as an online course. As long as you post to the weekly discussion and make sure to keep up with the labs, its an easy A. The exams are all online and straight outta the book.

summary_comment: Professor Hinkelman is an effective and supportive instructor who ensures that all students can succeed, making the class both interesting and easy due to her accommodating approach and willingness to help through email and Canvas. Students describe her as knowledgeable and engaging, contributing to a positive learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hinkelman is an effective instructor who ensures that all students pass the class with minimal effort required, making the course content both accessible and engaging. Students describe her as knowledgeable, supportive, and enthusiastic, contributing to a fun and interesting learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Completely asynchronous class, so I didn't interact with her a lot, but over email and Canvas she was very helpful. She wants every student to pass the class and if you put in any amount of effort, you'll do well. She made the class more interesting than I thought it would be.
Wonderful Professor very helpful, this class was lots of fun and very interesting.
Dr. Hinkleman knows what she is doing and wants all of her students to pass the class. Overall the class is very easy because she is a very easy grader.

summary_comment: Professor Zaccardelli is highly regarded for his kindness and extensive knowledge, though his classes are perceived as quite easy, potentially requiring more effort for deeper understanding. Students find his courses eye-opening and valuable for changing perspectives, though the workload is minimal.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zaccardelli is highly regarded for his kindness and extensive knowledge, though his classes are perceived as quite easy, potentially requiring more effort from students to fully benefit. His teaching approach offers valuable insights that can significantly alter one's perspective.

Ratings.comment: I had him for an online course. He is very kind. He seems well educated. The class is insanely easy and barely took me any time to complete the work. But I would recommend putting in more effort than I did so you can get the most out of the class. It is very eye-opening and can change how you think.

summary_comment: Professor Turner-Byfield, known as Evonne, is highly regarded for her flexibility with due dates and prompt responsiveness to emails. Students appreciate her friendliness and the usefulness of labs in preparing for quizzes, though some find the workload demanding, especially during shorter courses like summer sessions. Overall, her teaching quality is praised despite mixed feedback on lecture coverage and occasional rudeness.
summary_comment_short: Professor Turner-Byfield is highly regarded for her flexibility with due dates and her responsiveness to student emails. While some students found the labs demanding, many appreciated her teaching style and found her to be a supportive and friendly instructor.

Ratings.comment: I love Evonne! Super sweet and flexible with due dates if you're really busy at times. Labs went well with quizzes/lecture content. They say quizzes don't test you over lab content but I thought labs were good material to study for them.

Evonne is a great teacher, and she is always quick to answer emails with any questions. She is also super lenient about deadlines. The only bad thing about the class is that lectures don't always cover information on quizzes, but you can still easily get a good grade if you do the labs and epiphanies.
Evonne was cool but the labs are a lot of work
The lab requires a lot of work, her 2200 is not an easy GE class!
There was a lot of stuff for a 6 week course but Evonne was great.

The content was all pretty easy and would be very manageable if you take it during a normal semester (wouldnt recommend taking this over the summer as theres a lot of content and very little time). I didnt really like Evonne though, she was just rude whenever I emailed her and not very accommodating for me.
Evonne was super friendly and flexible. Great teacher.
Evonne is great, answers emails quicky. The labs don't always work though.
Really like intro to Anthropology last semester. Professor Turner-byfield is super cool.

summary_comment: Professor Wolfe is highly regarded for her engaging and caring approach, with many students noting her genuine interest in their understanding of the material. Her classes are described as very interesting with valuable readings, though the primary assignment is a term paper. Students appreciate her kindness and humor, and many find the exams to be manageable if they attend lectures regularly.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wolfe is highly regarded for her engaging and caring approach, with many students praising her kindness and dedication to ensuring understanding. Her classes are noted for their challenging yet rewarding content, though some assignments, like the term paper, require significant effort.

Ratings.comment: She's really funny and kind, but the only real assignment is a term paper. It's broken up into parts so you get multiple grades but beware if papers aren't your thing. Weekly discussion boards and one class discussion that you have to lead but could get an A on those in your sleep. Very interesting class/readings

Best teacher at OSU Clearly loves her students and would do anything to make them feel more comfortable in the class You can skip lecture but then you'll have to read the book If you go to lecture the exams are really easy Im talking over 97 on every exam I actually learned a lot from this class, probably my favorite class at OSU

Emily is a gift. She genuinely cares if you understand the material or not. I came from a Christian school, so I had no base knowledge of anything relating to the course, yet she went out of her way to make sure I genuinely understood everything. She's also just absolutely adorable.

summary_comment: Professor Cole is generally regarded as an effective instructor who engages students with enthusiastic lectures and well-prepared PowerPoint presentations. While some find the subject matter boring, many appreciate her clear explanations and interest in the material, leading to good learning outcomes even without the textbook. Students note her fairness in grading and the class's difficulty level, with some describing it as challenging yet rewarding.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cole is known for engaging lectures and a clear interest in the subject matter, making even potentially boring topics interesting. Students appreciate her well-done powerpoints and her approachable teaching style, though some find the class challenging.

Ratings.comment: I honestly thought the subject matter would bore me, but when you have an instructor that is very interested in what they're teaching, and gets excited at little facts, you know  it's going to be a good class. A few tests and a short lab quiz once a week.  Even though attendance wasn't required, I found myself going to almost every class.
Good lectures.  Easy grader.  Interesting subject matter.  Good prof overall.
Boring but easy

Not the most exciting subject matter, but she posts really well done powerpoints for every lecture, and she is very interested in what she teaches, and that shows. No need for the book, though. Good, easy choice for a GE if you have her as a teacher.

A super funny a smart teacher! The class was fairly difficult, but I learned a lot. It was probably my favorite class this semester! I didn't buy the book and still did well. She does excellent powerpoints which she puts online for you to use.

summary_comment: Professor Tyree is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which keeps students entertained and motivated to attend classes. His PowerPoint presentations are comprehensive and serve as the primary resource for exams, making attending lectures crucial for success. While his exams can be challenging, he is described as a fair and approachable instructor who effectively conveys complex material in an enjoyable manner.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tyree is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which keeps students entertained and motivated. His well-organized PowerPoint presentations serve as comprehensive study materials, and attendance and note-taking are key to success in his classes.

Ratings.comment: He is the BEST teacher! I seriously got cramps from laughing so much in class. Just go to  class and take all of the notes and you'll get an A. I looked forward to going to school just for this class. You don't need the book. He's hilarious, I can't emphasis that enough.
excellent teacher, horribly confusing exams, study notes in detail, DO NOT UNDERESTIMATE his tests,and buckle-up its gonna be a bumpy ride.
He's a great teacher, really funny and his power points are well organized.  Just go to class and take notes because EVERYTHING on his tests comes from his notes.
like everyone said his power points are everything you have to know.  he's a great professor and is killer cute! almost always sat in the front row :)

Dr. Tyree is entertaining and educational. He makes you want to attend every class. Besides teaching interesting cultural anthro, he frequently goes off on tangents and anecdotes that are often hilarious, informative and entertaining. Truly one of the best teachers I have had in college. Too bad he is leaving OSU next year. Pay these teachers more!
You do not need the book all the tests are based on the powerpoints. If you want to get a good grade, go to class.

Very nice, approachable guy, but goes off on a lot of bunny trails that can put a twice-weekly class WAY behind. Gives out good study guides for exams, pretty easy grader, very fair. I did learn a lot from him.

Enjoys the material and his enthusiasm is contagious. Classes are productive but also lighthearted and entertaining. Exams require very detailed understanding of the material, so continuous studying is recommended. It would be nice if lectures were posted on Carmen so students could participate more in discussion, rather than writing frantically.

First of all, Tyree's teaching is completely off his powerpoints. Everything you will ever need to know for an exam (which is the ONLY things your graded on) are on his slides. So make sure you go to class. Also, he recommends his students dont buy the textbook for his class, but I found some use in it from the lectures I skipped.

Dan's a nice guy, but this class is hard. Granted, I didn't go every day and I also didn't buy the book, so you may have better luck if you actually try. however, the tests are kind of tricky, so if you're looking for straightforward, Dan is not your guy. He goes on a LOT of tangents, but they are interesting. He also will cut you a lot of slack.

His enthusiasm is contagious - even if you're not into this stuff, you'll enjoy the class and learn a lot. Very amusing. Great examples and tangents. Incredible energy and passion for teaching. Seriously, other OSU professors should be required to take his classes to learn how to effectively inspire and teach students. A+ in my book.

Very interesting class. He teaches in a very exciting way, makes the subject matter interesting, I didn't miss a class all quarter because it was pretty fun. Exams are pretty tough though, make sure you study all the details he goes over in lecture and take good notes and you should do pretty well.
pathetic hard exams...

He teaches in an exciting manner that gets students thinking and talking. His style for lecture, including his passion, is such a way that you remember instead of memorizing facts. Intelligent, hilarious and professional. TAKE HIS CLASSES!
One of those teachers you remember. Entirely powerpoint lectures and doesn't post notes online, but makes class really really interesting and you learn a lot of cool random info. Take him.

He talks extremely fast at times, but only because he's so excited the material. He's a fun guy and it's an easy class if you take notes and study a little bit every night. My only complaint would be that some of the wording on the exams were rather confusing/tricky. I recommend him though.
Mr. Tyree is a good teacher and is hilarious.

There is no way anyone could even think about falling asleep in one of his classes.  He is so excited about the subject matter and teaching in general, that he gets you all excited too.  We took notes every day, but it was still exciting.

I'm practically changing my major because of this guy.  He was incredibly interesting, caring, and amusing.  I actually looked forward to coming to his class.  What a guy, seriously.  Take the class!!  A+

A really stand up guy!  He makes learning about pre-history so much fun.  Like others have said, he loves what he does...and it makes you love the class.  If i have time, I would love to take more of his classes.  A+
Very enthusiastic about material.  Knows what he is talking about.  Kinda goofy but enjoyable.

This is the only time I have rated someone because I felt it was deserving. The class was amazing, fun to go to, very fair, and he enjoyed it so it makes you enjoy it. First time I have ever thoroughly enjoyed a class. It was a pleasure
He is amazing i am takin more anthropology because he is an awesome teacher, he is really passionate

He makes this class really interesting and is very into the material.. you can tell! He is also willing to help and explain things if you don't understand. However, there was a lot of gray area on his exams.. his wording was very confusing!
He is so into what he is instructing and I find that those are the best teachers. His tests were the only thing I found reasonably challenging. Very entertaining.

Tyree is by far the best GTA I've had yet. You save money, because you don't need the book. His lectures are interesting and easy to understand. Midterms and the final were easy as well. He even gave a chance for extra credit, so everyone in the class had no reason not to do well. Take his class!
No Comments

Tyree is the best professor I have had at OSU so far.  Anthro has a high potential to be very boring, but he makes every class funny, and interesting. It's so great to see someone really try and enjoy what they do.  He once ran around the room like a lemur....he's amazing!

Tyree is great, one of the best TA's I've ever had. He loves what he teaches and that makes you more interested in the class. GO TO CLASS! Dont even buy the book, everything you need comes directly from his notes in lecture. He's very funny and enthusiastic, he keeps your attention and he's helpful.

summary_comment: Professor Critcher's teaching quality is generally poor according to student feedback, characterized by confusion over course requirements, lack of clear communication, and a negative classroom environment. Students also report issues with pacing, lack of rubrics and guidelines, and a focus on personal anecdotes rather than course content. Despite some positive comments from male students who found the class engaging, the overall consensus is that the class is difficult to follow and not well-organized.
summary_comment_short: Professor Critcher's teaching quality is widely regarded as poor, with students citing confusion over course expectations, lack of clear communication, and a negative learning environment. Many found the class to be disorganized, with insufficient guidance and resources, and some even questioned whether an instructor was present.

Ratings.comment: Lori was very unclear about what to do all semester. It took me several weeks to even figure out which textbook I needed to get for her class. I thought this was gonna be a breeze when I signed up for it but that quickly changed. Anthropology was an interest of mine before taking this class.

I don't know what to say about Lori. I thought for an online class it would be better then what it was but at one point I was wondering if we did have an instructor, because we never heard from her very much. She didn't promote learning or positive environment. She was negative and like yelling in her emails. The worst instructor I ever had.

Meh. Took this thinking it would be a GPA booster. Definitely not. Every professor in the anthropology department assumes students are an anthropology major. She is one of them. Rambles in her online powerpoints and says redundant phrases which prolong these already horrendous slides of death

Seems very distracted and spontaneous, takes forever to grade. She is very passionate about anthropology, but it doesn't really seem like she cares that much about teaching it. She's a very nice person, but this class was awful. Hardly any rubrics or guidelines for assignments

I went into this class considering becoming an Anthro major, but Lori changed that. The material she teaches is very interesting but she's not very good at teaching it. She flys through powerpoint slides, and they aren't posted on Carmen. She constantly side tracks from the lesson and talks about her life. Don't recommend taking her class.

The readings in this class were great, but the discussion was horrendous. A very, very easy class that is 100% surface level. Make sure to do the readings because they are the only thing that will help you get anything out of the class.

The class is not easy, but she can clarify the materials. 6 pop quizs and no slides posted on carmen. Exams cover the lectures, the textbook and something you never know but she thinks they are common sense. You can absolutely find another easier GEC.
I'm male, took her course with only 3 guys in the class, it was fantastic. Very helpful and funny. Taking her again in another class!

A great professor! She tries to keep her expectation high, but at the same time is understanding of life and situations occurring.A lot of reading, with detailed quizzes but at the end of the quarter the grade is very fair. I'm using her as a reference from now on!

Really nice and understanding. I had some trouble with the material at first but she met me outside of class a lot to guide me through everything. The class was a tad bit difficult, but she gave us a pizza party at the end so that was awesome!  I liked that she actually had a lot of experience in what she teaches (archeology)and gave us real-life e

summary_comment: Professor Padgett is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and responsiveness. Students appreciate his clarity in lectures, willingness to provide feedback, and use of real-world experiences to engage the material. While some find the quizzes and projects challenging, most agree that his guidance and support make the course manageable and rewarding.
summary_comment_short: Professor Padgett is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and accessibility, making students feel connected despite the online format. He is praised for his engaging lectures, willingness to provide feedback, and commitment to helping students understand the material, even when it requires significant effort.

Ratings.comment: He is always on top of things, willing to listen to feedback, and understands we have harder classes to worry about. He is a wonderful prof. even though it was an online class you feel like you know him because you email so much! Great guy

I thought Professor Padgett did a great job at teaching my ANTHRO 2201 course. His lectures are easy to listen to and if you take notes then there's no reason to do poorly. Quizzes aren't too hard and he provides you with a study guide for larger tests. Gives good feedback and is very prompt at replying to emails.

He makes the quizzes way more difficult than necessary. You'll need to listen to the online lectures a couple times and I recommend doing closed captioning- to get every single word he says. A lot on quizzes is what he says, not what is written. He is also pretty strict on the projects- they're a lot of work. Workbooks are also very time consuming.

Without a doubt the greatest professor I have ever had.  He takes material that some would be considered boring and makes it interesting and is hilarious with how he explains things.  He served our country and has traveled the world and uses those experiences to tie them into the material.  Tests are a little tough but doable.

The class is fairly easy if you go to lecture and lab and if there's something you still don't understand Brian helps work it out with you. For exams he gives you possible essay topics and there was one topic I was struggling with and he really helped me through it and it was the one on the exam so he cares that you understand.
Do the study guides. When it comes to the exams, they list pretty much everything you'll need to know. Got a 100 on my first midterm.

I enjoyed Brian's class. It isnt "easy" but if you go to lecture and aren't an idiot you'll do just fine. There is a lot to memorize but you are tested on harder stuff. You never use the textbook at all and labs are very easy.

Brian was very helpful and clear, as long as you made it to class.  His notes are very disordered, like another rater said, but he is interesting, overall.  He's traveled a lot and brings real-world experiences into the classroom.  He also tells a lot of jokes and is just an interesting guy.  It wasn't super easy, but it was interesting.
Exams are pretty hard. No curve and no extra credits. Class average of exam is almost C-

Brian is willing to help every student and answer every question quickly and entirely by email. He goes the lecture very well. BUT all of the notes he put online are disordered. If you don't attend the class, you will never learn what he teaches in class just from the notes. The exams are difficult and strict grade on LAB!!!NO extra credits!!!
Brian is super nice and a fair instructor. Three tests - not too difficult if you attend lectures. Labs are the easiest possible. Not necessary to purchase textbook.

summary_comment: Professor Peart is known for his lenient grading and approachable demeanor, with assignments primarily consisting of four short papers and in-class quizzes. Tests are described as relatively easy, and while online readings are optional, the required videos are considered engaging. Overall, his teaching style emphasizes manageable workload and straightforward assessment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Peart is known for his lenient grading and approachable demeanor, with assignments consisting mainly of short papers and quizzes. His tests are described as fairly easy, and while some students find the online readings optional, the supplementary videos are considered engaging.

Ratings.comment: Daniel was a good instructor who didn't grade too hard, a nice guy too. For the class we had 4 papers we had to do, but they were only 1-1.5 pages, and 4 quizzes in class. The tests were pretty easy, and the online readings, to me at least, were optional and I didn't read any of them and I got an A. The videos you need to watch were cool though.

summary_comment: Professor Wilkins is highly regarded for her passionate and engaging teaching style, making complex subjects clear and accessible. She fosters an inclusive classroom environment that encourages student participation and feedback. Her enthusiasm for anthropology and primatology is evident in her lectures, which are both informative and entertaining.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wilkins is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to teaching, creating an engaging and inclusive classroom environment. Her enthusiasm for anthropology and primatology is evident in her clear explanations and interesting lectures, making her one of the most recommended professors.

Ratings.comment: Professor Wilkins was one of my first professors as a transfer student at OSU. She truly poured her heart into teaching and loved the subject material. She made the material clear and was very accessible outside of class. She created a classroom environment that invited questions and often asked for our feedback. She is one of my favorite profs!

One of the most enthusiastic lecturers I've ever had. She is truly passionate about anthropology, primatology and the material she teaches. Interesting lectures, great patience and unique sense of humor, the easiest lab ever. Overall highly recommended! BTW she is super hot!

summary_comment: Professor Downey is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and supportive approach. She successfully breaks down complex scientific concepts into manageable parts, making the material accessible even to those who may not be strong in the subject. Additionally, she demonstrates a strong commitment to her students' success through personalized attention, fair and predictable exam formats, and generous extra credit opportunities.
summary_comment_short: Professor Downey is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and supportive approach, making complex scientific concepts accessible to all students. She consistently remembers students' names, offers extensive assistance to those who need it, and creates fair exams with clear indications of what to expect, often including extra credit opportunities.

Ratings.comment: Katie is such a sweetheart. I was nervous about taking a more science-focused class (not my strongest area), but she made all of the curriculum easily digestible. If you want to succeed in this class, all you have to do is show up to the lecture, do your lab quizzes (which are online and EASY), and pace yourself while studying for the exams.

Katie was a really good professor. For an 80 person lecture and lab, she made sure to remember every person's name and really wants her students to succeed & goes out of her way to help students struggling. Also, she makes her own exams & makes them really fair and hints towards what will and won't be on them, as well as always puts extra credit

summary_comment: Professor Syvertsen offers high-quality instruction with clear expectations and flexible approaches to meet student needs. Her courses include 10 discussion posts, a final paper, and a brief PowerPoint presentation, all designed to be manageable general education credits. While she occasionally takes time to grade and respond to emails, students appreciate her thorough feedback and willingness to discuss course material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Syvertsen offers high-quality instruction with clear expectations and flexible support for students. Her courses include 10 discussion posts, a final paper, and a PowerPoint presentation, all designed to be manageable general education credits.

Ratings.comment: 10 Discussion Posts with 500 words max worth 5 points each, readings from the textbook before each class to engage in discussions, one final paper and 5 slide/ 10 min max PowerPoint presention. Easy GE!!

I like Dr. Syvertsen's courses. She's clear on her expectations, and she is also flexible to the needs of students. She gives good feedback. She can take a while to grade assignments or respond to emails sometimes, but she means well and is always willing to meet and discuss things.

summary_comment: Professor McGraw is highly regarded for his clear and effective teaching style, particularly in his ability to explain complex material succinctly. His lectures are valuable for retention, and while his tests can be challenging, especially in format, they are generally fair and straightforward. Students find attending lectures essential for success, as the material covered in class often directly relates to exam questions.
summary_comment_short: Professor McGraw is known for his clear and effective lectures, making the material easy to understand and remember. However, his tests, particularly for his 3409 class, are challenging, consisting mainly of short-answer questions, and he does not provide online lectures.

Ratings.comment: I don't know how he is for other classes but for 3409 his tests are hard. They are mostly short answer, make a list, & the like. For the type of material in this class this is difficult (the spelling alone) He did give a give me test at the end and there it a paper (total of 5 things grade based on). Go to class he does not post lectures online.

William is extremely good at speaking and explaining things, his lectures are crystal clear, which is extremely helpful with remembering the information! Only had 3 tests, but they were very fair and straightforward (multiple choice). A very knowledgeable and friendly person, would definitely take another class with him.

If you go to lecture it's pretty easy to get an A. The tests aren't difficult as long as you study a little. We watch a lot of videos on primates which really helps to remember the differences between species. There are two books but the more important one is the anthology essays because he doesn't talk about them in class but they are on tests.

summary_comment: Professor Edes is highly regarded for her engaging and entertaining lectures, which, while detailed, are made accessible through her passion and clear explanations. However, her courses can be challenging, particularly for international students, due to the depth of the material. Students appreciate her supportive approach, including review sessions and online resources, though some find the workload demanding without consistent effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Edes is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate teaching style, which transforms even uninterested students into enthusiastic learners. However, her lectures are noted for being quite detailed, which can pose challenges for some international students despite her efforts to make the material accessible.

Ratings.comment: Her lecs are heavy and too detailed for international students to follow and i couldn't  get a good grade with hard work.

Ashley was an amazing instructor. I had no interest in this course, but it became one of my favorite classes by the end of the semester. She makes the material fun and easy to understand. Her tests aren't too bad, just study what she tells you to. Labs are graded on completion so easy points there. Definitely recommend taking this class with her.

I never use this website, but I felt compelled to give her a good review simply because I enjoyed her class so much. The lectures were informational but very entertaining. She only called on those who raised hands. The midterms were challenging, but fair. She rewards those who go to class, but it's not mandatory. She was the perfect professor.

Ashley has to be one of my favorite professors here at OSU. She makes all of her lectures super interesting and you can tell how passionate she is about the class. She has review days before every exam that basically tells you what she is asking. You definitely have to show up to class to take notes and study but overall I loved the class.

If you have the opportunity to take class from Ashley, do it. She has been one of my all time favorite professors. She's super intelligent & has great insights, but is also halarious and makes class enjoyable. One hard paper, but she herself literally reviews it and tells you exactly what to change, if you do poorly it is entirely your fault.

I really adored this instructor & even found myself looking forward to the class at times! She made the class very clear and fun. She was extremely helpful and accommodating. Kind of slacked on studying, could have easily done better in the class if I took more time to study; lot of memorization, but content was not difficult. She also loves memes
BEST PROFESSOR I'VE HAD SO FAR. Get teacher with tons of energy and love for the topic

Wasn't interested in this class to begin with and I was just taking it for an easy lab credit. I actually learned to love this class and it has become my favorite class this semester. She does take attendance but she also post guided notes online which make the class much easier. I recommend this class! :)

summary_comment: Professor Dzubak's teaching quality is mixed, with some students finding her lectures monotone and difficult to follow, while others appreciate her dedication and care for student learning. She provides helpful guidelines for exams and offers useful feedback, but her grading process is often slow and her workload is perceived as excessive, particularly for an introductory course. Overall, her teaching style and effectiveness vary significantly according to student perspectives.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dzubak's teaching style is polarizing; while some students find her passionate and dedicated, others criticize her monotone lectures and heavy workload. Overall, her exams require significant preparation, and she is described as either an exceptional professor who cares deeply about her students or a poor instructor who neglects timely grading and fails to adequately cover course material.

Ratings.comment: I took this class because Anthrop 2200 was said to be an easy science elective. The lectures were very monotone and she moved through the slides very quickly, making it hard to keep up. In order to do well on her exams you had to study very hard and attend her office hours. If you're taking this because you heard it's easy, do not take it with her.

I took ANTHROP 2200 w/ Prof. Dzubak for the AU18 term, and she was absolutely incredible. While her lectures were a bit monotone, it was clear she was going above and beyond to make the content as interesting as possible. She gives great feedback, and she truly cares about her students. One of my favorite professors so far, would def. recommend.

she is a really good professor and she really loves what she is doing. She always has so many energy during the class. She will give you the guideline before the exam which is really really helpful. And if you follow the guideline and do some exercise on the quiz let you will be fine.

I would not recommend her to anybody. She takes forever to post grades.  The amount of work and assignments she gives is ridiculous for an intro class. She also does not have any compassion for your life outside of her class. She is a terrible professor and if you're considering taking her, don't.

Would never in a million years recommend her. Our last class was over a week ago and she has yet to post a single grade. 2-3 long articles to read before each and every class. has the class lead discussions. i think she only taught us maybe 5 times.
I do not recommend Alexis. She does not do her job and makes the students teach the class.

summary_comment: Professor Herrera is known for delivering challenging exams that do not allow the use of notes or outside materials, making them particularly demanding even for well-prepared students. Given the comprehensive coverage of material in his 4-unit class, the difficulty level is considered appropriate, though still notably rigorous.
summary_comment_short: Professor Herrera is known for delivering challenging and comprehensive lectures and assignments, reflecting the rigorous nature of the 4-unit course. Students find his exams particularly demanding, even when prepared with notes, indicating a high standard for academic performance.

Ratings.comment: Brianne's exams were extremely difficult, especially given that you cannot use any notes/outside materials. Even with notes, the exams would not be easy by any means. There was a lot of content to this class (lecture material, labs, etc.) but it is a 4 unit class, so I guess that is expected. However, I was surprised with the level of difficulty.

summary_comment: Professor Cheverko is known for her thorough and detailed lectures, emphasizing the importance of taking extensive notes as she does not provide posted slides. Her exams, while challenging and based on specific content, are manageable with the use of provided study guides. Students find her approachable and informative, though the class requires consistent engagement and diligent note-taking to succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cheverko is known for her thorough and informative lectures, emphasizing the importance of note-taking as she does not provide slide decks. Her exams, while challenging and conducted online with strict timing, are manageable with proper preparation using the study guides she provides.

Ratings.comment: 3 exams, all online using lockdown browser. All one attempt, timed, and pretty specific questions. Often was unsure but able to do well on exams. Discussions, lab, lab quizzes are weekly assignments but ez points. Textbook not needed. Multiple dry video lectures a week, take notes. Use provided study guides. This class is not a joke, but doable.

Very informative on the topic, ask a dumb question and she will know it or get back to you the next day.  Some lectures are long, make sure to take notes no slides will be posted.  Pay attention and come to class and you'll get a solid grade.
Attendance isn't required and she doesn't post slides, but if you go to class and pay attention the exams are fairly easy. The lab portion is an easy A. I enjoyed most topics!

She's very thorough in her lectures, she also gives out good study guides for the exams. I wouldn't focus on the study guide for the exam though, notes take up a good part of the exam. You take notes basically every lecture so have a nice sized notebook and come with writing materials. She's very understandable and willing to answer any question.

Colleen is a clear cut teacher, her lectures are basic and note taking is essential to passing her class b/c she doesn't post her slides. The lab attached to this course is an easy A, all you have to do is show up. She provides a study guide before each test  which are super helpful to doing well. Never knew anthropology could be so interesting!

summary_comment: Professor Weiss is highly regarded for her dedication and approachability, with students praising her for being a supportive and knowledgeable instructor who goes above and beyond to help students understand the material. Her classes are challenging, particularly through difficult multiple-choice exams, but she offers extensive support and ensures students grasp the concepts. While her classes require active engagement, such as completing quizzes and participating in labs, the overall experience is positive due to her engaging teaching style and commitment to her students' success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Weiss is highly regarded for her engaging and supportive teaching style, with students praising her patience and willingness to help. Her classes are challenging, particularly the exams, but also offer manageable lab work and accessible course materials.

Ratings.comment: Took Nikki's online class and I'm glad I did. Do the weekly quiz/discussion post and lab or it'll come back to hurt your grade. Tests were pretty difficult but it was nice that the labs were only graded on participation.

I loved Nicole! She was so nice and genuinely wants to answer any and all questions you have! I would highly suggest her. She is definitely the nicest professor I have encountered in my college career.

Nikki is an awesome professor! Anthropology was my favorite class this semester, and I am confident that I would not have liked it so much if Nikki weren't my professor. There is no homework except for online quizzes before lab. Attendance isn't mandatory, but lectures aren't posted online, so it's highly recommended you attend class
NOT an Easy A. Good notes, hard multiple choice only exams. Amazing person and teacher though, she will sit with you until you get it. You actually have to try in this class
Amazing teacher! So sweet and knows A LOT. Easy labs. As long as you study for exams, you'll be fine! Interesting class material too. Would definitely take again

summary_comment: Professor Riordan is known for being relaxed and genuine, which students appreciate despite the occasionally long and monotonous lectures. His classes are generally easy with minimal homework, relying primarily on exams and labs for grading. While some find the class boring, they acknowledge his approachable nature and the availability of pre-lab question answers online.
summary_comment_short: Professor Riordan is known for being relaxed and genuine, which students appreciate despite the class sometimes feeling monotonous. His exams and labs require significant attention, as he does not provide lecture recordings, making attendance crucial for success.

Ratings.comment: Overall pretty chill dude. He is really laid back and very genuine. I would take him again. The class definitely took studying around exam time but was pretty easy. All of the pre-lab question answers are online.

The class itself is boring so it doesnt help that his lectures are so long and monotonous BUT if you can get past that, his class is super easy and interesting. Hes a grad student so hes super chill and easy to talk to. NO extra credit, no homework or projects. Your only grades are exams + labs so SHOW up bc he doesnt post lectures on Carmen.

summary_comment: Professor Grimstead is known for her unorganized teaching style and lack of clear structure in her course, leading to confusion among students. While some appreciate her care and knowledge, many find her lectures hard to follow and the grading process unfair, particularly for the research paper. Overall, her classes are described as disorganized and difficult to navigate.
summary_comment_short: Professor Grimstead is known for her unorganized teaching style and lack of clear structure in her course, leading to frequent delays and a grading system that often results in As despite poor organization. Students find her lectures difficult to follow and the content confusing, though many appreciate her care and accessibility outside of class.

Ratings.comment: We had to do weekly reading notes and had 2 quizzes a week but since they were open book they weren't too bad. There were 2 exams with 2 parts, multiple choice & essay questions. I honestly think she got behind and just gave everyone As on the essay questions and reading notes. I probs wouldn't take this class again just because it wasn't organized

Dr. Grimstead's lectures are sometimes hard to follow, but she makes up for it by being a genuinely good person and fun personality. I was never quite sure what I would be learning when I came into class, but I always knew it would be worthwhile. She cares a lot about her students and will absolutely help you with anything you need.

The content itself is easy. However, it was completely unorganized. The syllabus didn't match what we did. We were supposed to have 2 exams but she got so behind that she just gave As on it. The research paper is graded very hard. Also, don't email her to ask questions because she doesn't answer the questions & is incredibly rude.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS! She is unorganized and does not make herself clear. Half the lectures were spent on topics other than archaeology. After an entire semester of pushing back the midterm we ended up not having a midterm or final which would have been great except for our 15 page research paper that was then our only grade.

She is very caring, incredibly knowledgeable on a variety of topics, accessible outside of class, and gives good feedback. Don't expect to get grades through the whole semester. We often got so behind schedule that we didn't do the planned mid-term. There was alot of confusion because no one was sure what was going on when we went to class.

Posts her lectures online, they are detail heavy and somewhat all over the place. They are definitely easier to understand if you go to class but it's possible to do well without going. The tests are easy but the paper is very difficult. I would see her in her office as much as possible for help and she is easy to get ahold of.

Grade is based off of 2 tests and 1 paper but she broke the paper down in to smaller pieces (almost all the points still in final draft still). Tests are fairly easy. Attendance not mandatory, but she randomly does extra credit but only applies if in class that day. You want them! Her paper is rough for a 3000 class and she grades it harshly!
Lectures are really unorganized does not clarify anything at all and extremely hard grader.

She is very personable and friendly to every student. Though I didn't get to know her at all, I wish I could take another class from her because she is a good lecturer. Exams are about average difficulty but completely straightforward. The term paper is difficult but not unreasonable.

She's really cool. Approachable and goes above and beyond to help you out if you come to her. Can be intimidating but it was a really interesting class that wasn't difficult. She has high expectations for the term paper but SEE HER and she will give you direction,ideas,help! She cares about teaching and is super friendly. Would take her again!

I like her. She is personable and funny. She may talk fast but she puts the lectures on Carmen. But the paper...Nothing at Ohio State has stressed me more. However, if you have plans to continue in Anthropology, you have to be able to write well. Its important to learn where need to improve before you try to get published.

Grimstead is awesome. Yes she does go fast in lecture, but she puts every lecture on carmen. The two tests were over very broad subjects, no little details at all. Excluding the paper I have a 87 out of 80 points! I can bomb the paper and still get an A. She does take the paper very seriously, but this is college so you gotta suck it up and do it.

Least favorite Anthropology class I have taken..she takes herself so seriously, but she seems to be all talk. She blows through lectures with tons of material (which that could be narrowed down for the purpose of clarity). Her class was graded on 2 exams (that were very easy) and 1 term paper (that she takes way too seriously for an intro class).

summary_comment: Professor Webber frequently changes the syllabus and reading schedule weekly, which can be disruptive. While some students found her class interesting and enjoyable, particularly due to movie screenings and engaging discussions, others were disappointed by the lack of organization and relevance in the material covered. Overall, her teaching style varies widely, with some students appreciating her approachability and support, while others found her lectures disorganized and off-topic.
summary_comment_short: Professor Webber frequently changes the syllabus and reading schedule weekly, which can be disorienting for students. Her teaching style is varied, ranging from engaging movie screenings to critiquing unpublished work, which some find disjointed and unorganized, while others find it interesting and enjoyable.

Ratings.comment: She changed the syllabus and reading schedule. Every Week.

Would you enjoy having to pay for and read a professor's unpublished work? Would you like to hear information that, in no way, pertains to the class subject? Would you like to sit through 80 minutes of boredom? Does teaching an upper level course sound fun to you? Do you like when professors "phone it in" on the courses you take? Take this course.

The main reason for my low score is the utter pointlessness of this class. I was anticipating that signing up for a 4597 would increase my knowledge, but all we did for homework was read chapters of her unpublished work and then in class, we would critique it. Severely disappointed.

She's a little spacey and gets distracted but she knows a lot about the subject. I found the class interesting but was frustrated by the lack of organization. We had a food day and watched some interesting films. The papers weren't too bad to write.

I was surprised by the subject material- I thought it was going to be about something else.  So, that's my fault. I wasn't that interested in the course, but I found that Sabra's lecturing style was interesting enough that I could tolerate it.  Also, she welcomed any questions and met with people regularly with questions.  I like her.

Webber was one the the best teachers I have had in so long! She was always ready to help you before and after classes. You learn by how much interest you have on that certain topic. We did a class video for our final project and it was a ton of fun! Its also a pretty small class unlike alot of classes at O State there4 you really get to know people
She is very flaky, she will start to explain a topic then drift into something else. She is a very nice person so I was disapointed by the lack of instrucing from her.

She's a wonderful teacher.  I really enjoyed her class because it was really interesting. All we did is watch movies.  The papers are not too difficult and she grades reasonably easy. Definitely take this class!!!!

this was one of the worst classes ive taken she didnt really seem to know what she was talking about, and i dont think we ever talked about most of the stuff that was on the exams, nothing we discussed in class had anything to do with what we had to know and she never answered your questions

Horrible.  Horrible.  Horrible.  I think I could of lectured on the material better.  The movies sucked and she expected us to take midterms with no quality notes to study.  Good idea for a class, but she is an ineffective teacher.

I was in Sabra's Arabic 241A class.  It was interesting, and she is genuinely nice & tries to help, and the class made me think, but her lectures are incredibly difficult to follow.  I don't know that ANYTHING she ever lectured about had any relevance to the class...

Sabra never taught class, she just rambled on various topics. So by the the time the midterm you came you were screwed if you didn't read the readings. She's very nice and helpful. The class was easy but boring because you never learned anything.

Sabra is one of the nicest professors imaginable. If you get a chance to take her honors arabic 241 class, take it; there are no tests, quizzes, or anything. All you have to do is show up and discuss what you read. GREAT TEACHER!!

This teacher did not teach a day in class. Her idea of teaching was to write random words on the board (often times she made up) and never describe how they tie into the topic. Off the wall, hard to understand, and by far the worst class I ever took.
her lectures are very hard to follow because she jumps around a lot.  However, she is very genuine about helping and a nice person.  Easy course material.

summary_comment: Professor Geherty is known for his clear and fair grading system and his ability to make complex scientific topics engaging and accessible. Students appreciate his passion for the subject matter and his dedication to helping them understand and enjoy the material. His supportive and caring approach has earned him high praise and strong recommendations from his students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Geherty is known for his clear and fair grading system and his ability to make complex scientific topics engaging and accessible. Students consistently praise his care and dedication, highlighting his kindness and willingness to assist, making his classes highly recommended.

Ratings.comment: Very straightforward grading and great direction. You can tell he is passionate about what he is teaching and finds a way to make the material which would at first seem boring into something to take from the course. Im not much of a science person and I still enjoyed this class.

Joe is the best!!! He is better than any other professor/teacher at Ohio State University. Hes so caring, kind, understanding, and he goes out of his way to help students. 10/10 would recommend, this grade booster class is perfect for learning really interesting things and Joe makes it all the better.

summary_comment: Professor Weinrich is highly regarded for his engaging teaching style and clear content delivery, which closely follows the course syllabus. He is known for his lenient grading and thoughtful responses to assignments and discussions, fostering a supportive learning environment that encourages student success. Students consistently recommend his courses due to his dedication to helping them achieve their goals.
summary_comment_short: Professor Weinrich is highly regarded for his engaging teaching style and clear content, which closely follows the course syllabus. Students appreciate his lenient grading, thoughtful responses to assignments and discussions, and his genuine desire for students' success, leading many to strongly recommend his courses.

Ratings.comment: Engaging and easy to follow content, lenient grading, directly follows course syllabus, thoughtful responses to assignments/discussions, and many more reasons why to take the course. Professor Weinrich WANTS you to succeed. 10/10 would recommend.

Kendra was my lab TA, and she was very helpful. If you showed up to the lab, you would pass. She thoroughly explained each lab, and answered any questions we had. She even gave us extra time if we needed it.

Kendra is a good instructor and explains things really well. She gives you a study guide at least a week before each exam and as long as you use it and know everything on there and use the material given in lectures the exams are a breeze. Easy to memorize everything the day before and get an A.

summary_comment: Professor Oldershaw is highly regarded for her engaging and energetic lectures, evident from her clear passion for anthropology. Students consistently praise her kindness, understanding, and willingness to help, making her approachable and supportive. Her teaching methods are effective, with clear communication and a focus on student success, leading to high exam scores and positive student feedback.
summary_comment_short: Professor Oldershaw is highly regarded for her energetic and engaging lectures, clearly demonstrating her passion for anthropology. Students consistently praise her kindness, understanding, and willingness to help, making her a supportive and approachable instructor who genuinely cares about her students' success.

Ratings.comment: Great lectures with plenty of energy. You can tell she loves Anth and

Shes amazing. Great professor who really cares about her students. Shes hella understanding too so if you need to retake a test or assignment, shell be willing to help you out. Super enthusiastic into what shes teaching and easily approachable, she always makes it clear that she appreciates any questions.
She was so awesome! Super accommodating and very kind - she made you feel like the students matter and made us care about what she was teaching. I have nothing but great things to say about her!

She is so kind and always willing to help. Even in her big lectures she tries as much as she can to get to know every person, you can tell she really cares about her students and their success. She is very approachable and if you stay on top of lectures and study the study guides you'll be right on track. She was one of the best professors.

Leigh is super helpful and her exams aren't hard at all if you study the right way. She posts study guides before each exams and the material on there is EXACTLY what you need to know for the tests- the average for both of our midterms was in the mid-90's. You can easily tell that Leigh truly cares about anthropology and is enthusiastic to teach.
She's an overall great instruction and a lot of fun to talk to. Tests are fairly straight forward and pretty easy if you show up to lecture.

Leigh is a great lecturer!  She makes class fun and interesting.  She comes up with projects to help engage us in the subject matter.  She really cares about teaching and the success of her students.  Very kind in and out of class.  Easy to talk to.  Willing and available to talk outside of class if you have questions.  10/10 would recommend.

summary_comment: Professor Guatelli-Steinberg is highly regarded for her enthusiasm and dedication to teaching, often described as a friendly and supportive instructor who goes out of her way to help students. Her lectures are noted for being engaging and easier to understand than the textbook, though they can be extensive and require careful note-taking to capture key information. Students appreciate her passion for the subject matter and her efforts to foster a learning environment, although some find her classes challenging due to the volume of material covered and the need
summary_comment_short: Professor Guatelli-Steinberg is highly regarded for her enthusiasm and dedication to teaching, making her lectures engaging and helpful for learning. However, her lectures can be extensive, making it challenging to discern key information, and some students find her classes dry and difficult to stay engaged with.

Ratings.comment: Super awesome and nice lady, she definitely does try to help you learn. Her lectures were easier to understand than the book, so I would definitely recommend those but she also gives WAY too much information during them, so it is sometimes hard to know what exactly is important to take note of.

It's work, but you learn a lot. Make sure you pay attention in lectures, it's much easier to understand those than the book, and everything you'll need for the exams is in there (but she only posts the graphics from the lectures, not the notes, so go to class!) Also she's just a super friendly person and makes an effort to talk to everyone.

Dr. GS is really wonderful. She helped me so much out side of class and it genuinely interested in helping students who want to learn more and are putting effort into her class. She brings great energy to every lecture, and she tests all of her content-no surprises. The hardest thing is organization of your notes and context of some events.

Debbie is a very helpful + fun lady, but I would NOT recommend this course if you're looking for an honors GE! I'm a non-major, and this class was the hardest GE I've taken, with huge amounts of material covered + tough tests. If you're willing to put in TONS of work, and do a lot of reading/review, a good grade is possible, but it's exhausting!

She has a lot of knowledge and will follow up on any questions you have that she doesn't know. She likes it when people answer, and will wait for someone to take the bullet. She wants you to buy her own book, but I never did and you only need to have someone who has it help a bit with the quizzes, and the tests are a bit challenging, but not crazy.

Super passionate about what she teaches, which for me, is a great sign of a great teacher. She's very helpful and is more than happy to help you on any topics you aren't sure of. Lectures are long and not the best organized, but if you make an effort to take notes and study, you'll be fine. MAKE FLASHCARDS for the various ancestral primates!

She's one of the best teachers I've had at OSU. She is enthusiastic about teaching, and she makes lectures interesting. There was a group project, but she gave a good amount of feedback during the whole process. She also makes an effort to learn everyone's names (in a big lecture class). Also there wasn't any textbook...

Here slides are useless. They are not very organized and skips information. She skips over important topics. Hard to pay attention because she makes the material so dry. I enjoy this topic when taught by Scott McGraw, but not with her. I can barely stay awake during this class and if attendance wasn't taken I would probably never go.

Great professor. She makes decently dry material fun to learn. Her tests are very clear-cut and she gives a study guide. As long as you come to class, you should pass. The group project is set up really well and gives an equal workload to everyone. One of the best professors I've had thus far. 1010 would recommend.

One of the best professors I have ever had. Breaks complicated concepts down so they are easy to understand. She is extremely passionate about anthropology and fun to listen to. Also offered tons of help and advice outside of class. TAKE HER CLASS. You will not regret it.

A great professor! Very interested in her material, but also a genuinely sweet lady! Really enjoys helping students, and always looks forward to questions. Definitely the favorite of any professor I've had.
Lots of stuff to study but she is a cool teacher. Study and its pretty easy

Dr. G-S is one of the best professors I've ever had. She loves dental anthropology and it really shows in her teaching.  She can be a tough grader, but if you like the material it is not hard at all. She will give you letters of recommendation and extensions if you ask and she knows you. Small class, easy to get to know her and everyone else.

she gives slides after slides after slides of every fossil. You don't learn about human origins, you memorize bones. Doesn't curve, even when the average is low. Seems nice, but her exams and grading are absurd.

She's a really nice teacher and obviously cares about what she teaches.  She makes lecture pretty interesting. But honestly, if you want an easy A, don't take this class.  There is so much to memorize, its kind of ridiculous--if its just a GEC and you don't care anyway.  Everything looks and sounds the same--gets super confusing; tests challenging

She is a great professor. She's so passionate about the subject, she makes the boring slideshows entertaining. Take the time to study the notes you take in class, and you should be fine. She gives detailed study guides for the midterms. The final was pretty difficult, but I still ended up with an A. Highly recommended!

really nice woman, very interested in anthropology. this class is potentially boring but the professor has a lot of energy and keeps it interesting. nice variation of lecture, videos, and lab activities. always willing to give extra help and explanations. not much homework, only one short paper.

Go to lecture or you'll miss an entire class of taking notes.  Attendance is mandatory, but prof kept the subject matter interesting to keep students engaged.  Besides showing up for participation there's minimal work: 2 short papers, one midterm, and the final.  Overall the class is worth taking
Incredibly nice woman!  Loved her.  Makes what could be a very dry subject pretty interesting.

Really great proffessor and also a really nice person. class wasnt easy, but far from being hard and if you study you'll get an A. might not enjoy the class as a GEC though if youre not a "science" type person

I really enjoyed this class, Dr. Guatelli-Steinberg is a very fair grader and cares that students learn the material. Tests were straightforward and based on notes taken in class. Overall, an interesting class and if you study, an easy A. Definitely recommended.

very smart woman, fair grader, attendance is mandatory, though i didn't go which really affected my grade. she was very willing to help further explain concepts. if i cared at all about science, i would take another class from her if it didn't have an attendance requirement.

Really nice professor, she tried to make the lectures as fun as possible, but it's hard to make some Anthro topics exciting (boring ppt presentations every class).  Not too much work for this class, but the final, I felt was a challenge given how much information there was to memorize.  Not an intellectually stimulating class, but fair enough.
wonderful!

Any questions that a student had for her she was able to answer quickly. Her knowledge of human origins is pretty extensive. The only problem I have with this class is the repetetiveness of the lectures, slide after slide after slide. Labs are grade boosters and the midterm and final were 70 and 90 multiple choice and true and false questions.

Really great professor, you can tell she loves the subject and wants you to love it as well. She just receieved an award from the Alumni Association, and she definitely deserves it. Extremely helpful, great class discussions. Would recommend her to everyone.
Good teacher, am taking her class again this quarter. Great exam prep, sometimes even gives essay q's in advance. Explains difficult concepts really clearly, a++!!

Made difficult concepts easy. Interactive activities helped to apply the information and made the class fun. Very humanistic scientist and super nice too :-) Learned lots and enjoyed the class lots. A++

summary_comment: Professor Adams is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and passion for biological anthropology. She clearly sets expectations and ensures active engagement through various mediums like readings, videos, and discussions. Her enthusiasm for the subject matter makes the course accessible and engaging, even for those new to the field.
summary_comment_short: Professor Adams is an excellent instructor known for her passionate and engaging lectures, which bring the subject matter to life. She clearly outlines expectations and requirements, such as attendance and participation, and assigns short, informative readings that enhance the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Adams designed this course in Biological Anthropology wonderfully. The coursework was largely reading based but also included videos and podcasts, was quite helpful. Expectations from students were clear. Attendance and participation in discussion is essential to pass class.

Dara is a great professor who is very passionate about the subject; that always makes the class more interesting. Whether you have previous knowledge or an interest in Anthropology, it is a simple class that serves as an introduction to the field.

Great professor! I just finished her online class for cultural anthropology.  I loved it so much that I have decided to major in it. Even if you are not a huge anth. fan please take her class, it opens your mind to so many different human aspects and issues around the world! It really helps you grow as a person!

Dara is a fantastic teacher with a passion for the subject. She talks about her own experience in Anthropology and allows her stories to fit the information being learned. You will be doing reading for pop quizzes, but all of the readings assigned are short and mostly entertaining or enlightening.

Great teacher! She is passionate and an engaging lecturer. She is willing to meet with students and will go the extra mile to help you out if you put forth the effort. I highly recommend her. She made me fall in love with the material.

summary_comment: Professor Buffington at William & Mary is well-structured and genuinely interested in anthropology, providing clear powerpoints and assigning significant projects, but her lectures often focus on her research rather than course assignments, leading to some students finding the class boring and difficult to engage with. Students also note that she can be shy and avoids eye contact during lectures, which may affect her ability to connect with students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Buffington at William & Mary is well-structured and genuinely interested in anthropology, but her lectures often fail to connect with the course assignments, making the class feel disjointed and boring to many students. Students also note that while she is approachable and nice, her communication can be unclear, especially in online settings, and she may struggle to adapt to students' needs.

Ratings.comment: took her class at William & Mary- it was so boring. most boring class ever. she talked a lot about her research which is cool but the lectures had nothing to do with the assignments. she's a nice person and it was a well-structured class but I couldn't stay awake

Seems to be genuinely interested in anthropology. Gives decent powerpoints that are available on Carmen. She assigns a large paper and a group projectpresentation. Participation is important to her. Small class - we would arrange our desks in a circle for daily discussion. She's nice, but seems a bit shy and avoids eye contact during lecture.

Abby is not a good professor at all. I took Anthropology 2201 online and she is not clear on anything. She does not give any clear information or make it easy to understand. I asked for a lot of help and she started to become rude to me. She asked me to come to office hours but I could never make it and she could not adapt. Stay away from her!

summary_comment: Professor Stout is known for his unconventional testing methods, including two take-home essays, and his lectures can be somewhat boring due to his tendency to ramble. Despite this, he is highly respected in the field of forensic anthropology and is praised for his willingness to help students and his approachable nature. However, his teaching style is criticized for being lecture-heavy and sometimes disconnected from the exams, leading to frustration among some students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Stout is known for his unconventional testing methods, including two take-home essays, and is highly regarded for his knowledge and passion in forensic anthropology. While his lectures can be dry and focused on storytelling rather than structured teaching, students appreciate his helpfulness, leniency, and willingness to assist with grades.

Ratings.comment: The way he tests students is unconventional. There were 2 take home essays where you try to show everything you knew. They weren't hard to do well on, but I was confused on what he expected from students at first. Lectures were a little boring since he just rambles. One time we had a forensic art demo though. That was the only interesting lecture.

Great professor and really knows and loves forensic anthropology.  Very well respected in the field and he really just wants his students to learn.  Only three midterms, no final, and for my class he is going to drop the lowest of the three midterms.  Take notes in class on the slides he gives you because things he says in class is on the exam.

Dr. Stout is great. He post lecture slides online, there are only 3 tests, and 1 term paper (over anything). and we were able to retake part of our first exam to help the grade. He's extremely helpful and funny. He goes off on tangents in lecture sometimes though. Overall great. I'm even taking another class with him next semester.

Dr. Stout is great. His lectures are pretty tough to pay attention to, but if you're looking to get into forensic anthropology, he has some really great stories. He's really helpful and willing to work with you to improve your grade. As long as you study the power points really well, you should ace his tests. Favorite class.

Hands out an attendance sheet everyday. He is very lenient, super nice and makes jokes often. He tries to make you laugh. I didn't learn much and he doesn't make up good tests. They turned out tricky, but he didn't mean for it. Boring lectures, reads directly from them. Didn't touch the book which is expensive.

He is a very nice guy and has lots of interesting stories to tell, however, he is a horrible teacher. He reads straight from his powerpoints which are in most cases taken directly from the textbooks. The tests do not reflect the lecture or reading material and focus more on arbitrary facts than knowledge.A very Frustrating class.

Super boring lecture. I didn't understand why attendance was mandatory. Powerpoints are disorganized and full of mis-info. Pointless questions on the exam. Focused more on facts and people than actual anthropology. Thought it would be easy, but seems to have gotten harder from other comment? Wouldnt recommend. Book was expensive too.

I agree with everyone that Dr. Stout is cool and laid back but he doesn't teach! His powerpoints are all over the place and he likes to tell stories. I learned almost everything on my own outside of class and I don't understand why we even had to go to class in the first place. He's a nice guy but I wanted to learn something not hang out

Who doesn't love Dr. Stout? He speaks softly, so try to sit up close to hear him clearly. He can ramble from time to time, but that's just part of his charm. Go over his pwrpoints thoroughly and you will ace the class, as everything you need to know is in there. Only 2 exams, a mix of multiple choice and fill in the blank. Showing up = A.

Stout is a great. He tells all sorts of interesting stories about really cases he has worked on, which was cool.   Just go to class, take notes, and you'll do fine.  The things he outlines in red on his notes are things you have to know and will be on the test.

Stout's really nice and very smart. No tests, just assigned us a group project presenting a chapter out of the book to the class. Then we had to write a paper and present that to the class. That's it.  That's all we did all quarter.  Honestly it got pretty boring and I wish we would have had a test to encourage us to learn the material.

Pretty easy class, we just had to present on a group of articles with other people.  Mostly discussion.  We ended up not having a midterm or final and if we showed up and participated he gave us an A.  Only homework was writing a short book review.  Super easy class, I'd recommend it
Really nice, helpful professor.  He won't got easy on you, but he'll do everything he can to help you out.  He's also really funny if you pay attention.
Dr. Stout is an awesome professor. He is a very interesting person and does a wonderful job of conveying information to his students.

summary_comment: Professor Ritchie-Ewing is highly regarded for her effective online class setup and clear lecturing style, though her classes can be demanding, particularly during exam periods. Students find her knowledgeable and passionate about anthropology, recommending the course for those interested in the subject, while suggesting alternatives for those uninterested. Her classes emphasize attendance and participation, with mandatory group work and readings, and while the material can be challenging, consistent effort leads to success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ritchie-Ewing is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and clear explanations, making the class accessible and engaging. Her lectures are thorough, and while the material can be challenging, particularly during exams, students find the class manageable with consistent effort and engagement.

Ratings.comment: I really liked how this online class was setup. I learned a lot and was very successful in the class, if you do your work and don't fall behind you will be just fine.
Solid lecturer. Clearly cares about her field. Exams weren't difficult; they consisted mostly of vocabulary. There was one paper assignment and one group work project. Overall a good professor.

She is a clear lecturer and knows what she's talking about, even if not the most exciting. The class was fairly interesting and I'd recommend it to others if they are interested in anthropology. If you're not interested in anthropology you might want to take a different class.

Genevieve is amazing! We don't have quiz, homework and textbook, just pay attention to class and you will be fine. The lecture is pretty long but she is interesting so it's fine for me. However the exams are a bit tough you will have to put some hard work on it. May take attendance in some lectures.
Book was not required. Attendance taken some days.

Attendance and participation are mandatory and a huge part of your grade. There is group work daily and you have to do the readings online. For the most part the class is very interesting. There is one project that you work on all semester and as long as you do the work it is easy enough to get an A. I recommend taking as a GEC!

summary_comment: Professor Duran is highly regarded for his teaching quality, described as a great lecturer and a kind, supportive instructor who genuinely cares about his students' success. The class workload is minimal, focusing primarily on labs and three multiple-choice exams, making it one of the easier general education courses available.
summary_comment_short: Professor Duran is known for his excellent lecturing skills and caring demeanor, making the class approachable and supportive. The course workload is relatively light, focusing primarily on three multiple-choice exams and labs, though the exams can be challenging due to their vague nature.

Ratings.comment: Great lecturer, and super nice man. He cares about your success and is very kind if you come to him with anything at all. Very easy class work-wise; no homework, you are graded solely on labs and exams. 80% of your grade is determined by 3 50 question multiple choice exams, and the questions were vague in my opinion which made them challenging.

One of the easiest GE's I've ever taken. Weekly grades are a discussion post, pre lab quiz (the questions come from the book weekly so you get 100 if you know the answers beforehand), and a lab. Labs are very easy and he's an easy grader! Interesting class, 3 tests in the year. Good science GE and it was an asynchronous class so uploaded lectures

summary_comment: Professor Thampy's lectures are known for their extreme detail and length, which some students find monotonous and boring, though the class can be mastered with thorough self-study using provided study guides and exam-related films. Many students strongly discourage taking her class, citing its dullness and difficulty.
summary_comment_short: Professor Thampy's lectures are known for their extensive detail and length, which can be tedious and difficult to stay engaged with throughout. Students find the class challenging and generally uninteresting, recommending only to take it if absolutely necessary and if one can manage to study effectively outside of class.

Ratings.comment: The lectures seem very long and are extremely detailed, you basically take notes the entire class...almost unbearably boring. However, if you know the study guides for the exams it's not hard to do well in the class.  She shows a lot of movies that appear on the exams, too so if you miss class be prepared to watch the films on your own time
I hated this class! It is sooo boring..if you don't have to take it don't!

Her lectures were in monotone and often bored the student by the time 30 minutes had passed.   You had to learn all the material for yourself--as long as you memorized concepts in your own time you would do okay on the midterms.  I would not recommend this class to anyone.

summary_comment: Professor Rios is highly regarded for his engaging and thought-provoking approach, with a focus on critical thinking through numerous small writing assignments and clear, comprehensive readings. His classes are recommended for students who value learning and are prepared to put in the necessary effort, as exams closely follow the material in the book. While some students found the class challenging and stressful due to last-minute changes and strict attendance policies, many praised his enthusiasm and ability to make the subject matter interesting.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rios is highly regarded for his effective online teaching methods, emphasizing critical thinking through numerous small writing assignments and clear, comprehensive readings. His classes are described as engaging and supportive, though some students found the workload demanding and the final requirements challenging.

Ratings.comment: Great online class.  Rios really wants students to think critically so there are a lot of small writing assignments.  Also, lots of reading, but very clear and easy to understand.  If you do the reading you'll get an A. Highlight important parts because exams are word-for-word from the book.  Overall, good class with interesting topics.
