This class was excellent, not hard at all to be an online class. But if you are used to winning every time you don't get your way, please don't take it. The professor was very helpfull and the assignments were very clear and to the poin. I would recommend the class and this professor to any student who come to college to learn and work.

This course was interesting. Lots of reading but it's college so I expect it. The class assignments were a little confusing and some other students got really annoyed (probably because they didnt take time to read anything) but I didn't find it that big of a deal. Overall he responded to all my questions and to each their own. Recommended.

At the beginning of the quarter it seemed like a very upfront course.  A week before the final he changed the syllabus and required students to write a 4-6 page paper as well as multiple choice questions.  He will not respond to emails either.  Worst professor I've had thus far at OSU.
Bernardo was awesome! He was a lot of fun and kept class interesting... Take this class!!!

Attendance is a must in this class! You get 1 excused & 1 unexcused absence. This class was pretty laid back but definitely not a no-effort class. Bernardo is a pretty cool teacher. He brought us chili crickets to try 1 day lol. You get to watch a lot of youtube videos during lecture, which is really nice.

Bernardo is amazing! he was always coming up with ways to keep info relevant and interesting for us! we watched youtube videos for a majority of class. I didn't read the book at all which made the online tests a little hard since there isn't much time to complete them. Overall its a fairly easy class if you go and take notes but not an effortless A

Awesome teacher, really good looking too so that always helps for a long class! Actually read the book and get ready to takes a lot of notes. Most exams are online but that doesn't mean they were easy, study and go to class and you should get a B at least.
Fairly easy, good GEC if you have alot of other heavy courses. For me its boring material, but Rios makes it interesting.

Well first off, Bernardo is hilarious. He's naturally funny and I don't even know if he tries to be sometimes, but I laughed pretty much the whole class. The book is NECESSARY. A lot of his exams are online but you still HAVE to read the book and study notes to get a good grade. A LOT of notes and a few projects. Overall, great class. I recommend

Bernardo is laid back and is interested in teaching. He relates to the students and he is available to help. His test are hard and the material is a lot to cover. When you read the book, you really have to pay attention and comprehend it otherwise you will bomb the tests. He gives a lot of notes, and they are helpful, but read the book. Not easy A.
Good teacher. Overall, if you pay attention and do your assignments you should do okay. Sometimes the tests are a little tough though.

Bernardo was one of the worst TAs I've had at OSU. He was extremely narcissistic, and never taught anything of value in the class. Your grade is pretty much based on whether or not he likes you. He gives out surprise essays and basically just likes to trip you up so you don't get a good grade. Avoid having him as your teacher at all costs.

Bernardo is very interested in teaching, and he makes lectures enjoyable.He often shows videos and uses powerpoint notes from the book.Make certain to read the book because exam questions are right from it.The exams are often online or you can use notes.If you go to class and read the book, you will get at least a B.  It was an interesting GEC.

Bernardo is a great teacher, enthusiastic about his subject but do not schedule his last if you're looking for an easy A. Tests are HARD.  Read the textbook for the first two midterms, got a C.  Didn't read for the last, still got a C.  Don't miss class and do all the work and you'll make it out with a B.  His exams are often online.
The class was fun and interesting and relaxed. He's not a super hard grader, just do your work and come to class. And read the little story things in the chapters.
No comment read read read and make it to class or else you ain't gonna pass...

Really fun class! not too hard but i'm sure most people were taking it for a gec anyways, so that was ok. even though it wasn't hard the material was interesting, and the exams were pretty tough too. as long as you do your journals and get a somewhat decent grade on the exams you should do fine

Bernardo is a pretty good teacher. He literally teaches straight from the book, but he does take attendance so attendance is mandatory. His midterms were simple, but the final was ridiculously hard. Make sure to take notes and pay attention and you'll for sure get an A. Lots of YouTube videos kept the class interesting too!

The class was a breeze. If you do your homework and use some effort, you'll more than likely get an A. Attendance is a must because he docks points if you miss more than once.  He likes to be "random," too, giving you an option for what you want to do for your 2nd midterm and 1st one was a paper. If he likes you, you'll definitely get an A.

Funny & Gets along well with students.Does little suprises: let us use notes on the 2nd midterm; but had us take out 1st midterm on CARMEN?! with a writing portion in class!! His notes seem rushed. I do not think he balances his time very well.  Only take this class if you are genuinely interested in it, otherwise its a long 108 minutes.:(

summary_comment: Professor Casado is known for her straightforward and informative teaching style, making complex topics accessible. Her classes are generally easy to follow, with clear lectures and reasonable assignments. Students appreciate her friendliness, sense of humor, and the opportunity to earn high grades through studying and attending lectures.
summary_comment_short: Professor Casado is known for delivering clear and informative lectures that are engaging and often supplemented with interesting materials like videos and guided notes. Her classes are generally easy to follow and pass with reasonable effort, though attendance is mandatory and can significantly aid understanding.

Ratings.comment: This class was very straight-forward. Very informative, I learned how to make a professional poster. Discussion was always interesting. MUST attend lectures to pass the class, but work load outside of class was almost nonexistent. The projects & papers that were assigned were very reasonable. I learned a lot from this class - recommended!!
she didnt care talked about tv a lot kinda mean she told us she cared more about her OSU class more

Ana is an amazing teacher.  I highly recommend her Intro to Cultural Anthropology class.  She always teaches using power points that can be downloaded partially as guided notes off of Carmen.  She is very friendly and makes funny comments.  Tests are extremely easy.  Very easy grader.  Also shows interesting videos.

Ana is great. Her lectures are interesting and easy to follow. Her guided notes are online. Exams are very simple and straight from lecture material. She is pretty funny and very casual. I finished this class with a 100%.

Ana is the BEST!  She's pretty funny which makes the lectures (which you pretty much have to go to in order to get the full notes) so much more enjoyable.  Easy homeworks, easy exams, and opportunities for extra credit. I ended up with >100% in the class. Take her! You'll be extremely glad you did.

I really enjoyed this class! Ana is a great teacher and genuinely interested in helping you do well. The assignments are all fairly easy and so are the tests, as long as you study. She does count attendance, but the lectures are all really interesting.

I usually hate class that makes attendance mandatory, but she made this class fun and interesting. The grading is fair, if you study you will get an A, tests are straight forward from the study guide. Don't buy the book it's a waste of money. 3 homework assignments are pretty easy too. Take it!!

This class is ridiculously easy, definitely take it if you want an easy GEC credit. You don't have to buy the book, the exams come from the notes and she's pretty funny. She made a science class interesting and I learned a lot from it.
You have to take her class,she makes ANT very interesting. Attendance is mandatory but her class is very fun anyways. Don't buy the book, cause she doesn't care about it at all.
She's hilarious and makes wat could be a boring class fun. Tests weren't too bad as long as you study.
she's great! funny and very helpful. lots of information, but follow the study guide and you'll do fine :)

SEI.Subject: ESEPSY
SEI.Class Name: Learning and Motivation Strategies for College Success

SEI.Subject: ESEPSY
SEI.Class Name: Learning and Motivation Strategies for College Success

SEI.Subject: ESEPSY
SEI.Class Name: Learning and Motivation Strategies for College Success

summary_comment: Professor Kimiaie is generally regarded as a helpful and friendly instructor who encourages student engagement and provides useful resources like study guides and interactive class activities. However, her teaching style is perceived as formulaic and sometimes unclear, leading to difficulties in understanding course material and performing well on exams. Students appreciate her availability for office hours but find her lectures and tests to be somewhat monotonous and lacking in depth.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kimiaie is highly regarded for her helpfulness and availability, with many students praising her support and engaging teaching methods. However, some find her teaching style formulaic and boring, with criticism regarding clarity and the effectiveness of her resource distribution.

Ratings.comment: I took Ms. Masi's class at Wright State. She's a great instructor, very helpful, and always made herself as available as possible.

Pretty unclear. Never had resources available online when she said she would. Wasn't great at giving directions and didn't engage the class well. Half the class failed her first midterm because she wasn't clear on what all would be on it. She's very nice and encourages office visits, but overall I didn't particularly enjoy her class or teaching
Amazing instructor, very helpful. She's always there to help students. Short clips and movies shown in class were interesting. She's so dressy and sexy as well:)

Nice person. Horrible teacher. Teaching style incredibly formulaic and boring. Nothing is gained by attending class except mandatory attendance grade. PowerPoint all day every day, maybe a movie here and there. Material is easy (and maybe fun) but it comes off as dull during lecture. Tests are uninspired too. Nice person though.
Recommended
helpful, nice, and friendly instructor. I liked the way she combined lectures with movies, discussions, and jeopardy games.

She gives study guides that are very helpful for review.  Unfortunately she is the slowest grader in the school.  Don't expect to know what you got on a paper or test until at least 3 weeks after you did it.

Study her slides and read through the book. Make sure you complete her review sheets because the test will pull a lot of questions directly from it. Tests are almost all short answer, so be prepared to know details about a lot of the subjects in the review.

Masi is such a sweet, kind hearted woman. I really enjoyed her class. You can get away with not buying the book. All of the information needed for the tests are on the powerpoint. Attendance is mandatory. A lot of information to remember but it's not bad because the material is interesting.

Masi is a great teacher.  Anyone who talks bad about her teaching is probably someone that put zero effort in and expected an A, but got a C and is mad.  Participate in class, study her notes and enjoy your A.  Lectures are a bit dry, but she is very helpful if you have questions.  Participate, participate, participate! Can't stress that enough.
all tests were short answer questions. all information in class was in powerpoint form and she just read it aloud. couldve been learned from home

Professor Masi is friendly and hardworking. Although some of the lectures were boring and difficult, she was able to involve us in a group discussion to make it easier and understandable. She invites her students to go to her office if they have a problem. Recommended:)

Ms. Kimiaie was a nice and friendly teacher. Both serious and with a smiling-face. Although she is not an english speaker, she tries her best in teaching and her accent is clear. I liked her course alot.
Mrs. Kimiaie is a very good professor and will answer any questions that you have. Great teacher easy GEC!!!

summary_comment: Professor Nolan is widely regarded as an ineffective instructor, consistently receiving negative feedback for his teaching methods, grading practices, and personality. Students found his assessments challenging and often misleading, his lectures unengaging, and his interactions with them dismissive and unhelpful. Overall, his approach to teaching appears to significantly detract from the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Nolan is widely regarded as an ineffective and unpleasant instructor, consistently receiving harsh criticism for his grading practices, difficult assignments, and unstimulating lectures. Students describe him as an unfriendly, hard grader who writes misleading test questions and fails to make learning enjoyable.

Ratings.comment: AWFUL. A million issues with his "teaching", readings, assignments, grading, and personality. If you value your happiness, or your education, you won't take anything with him. Especially not an online course.

Nolan was probably one of the worst teachers I've ever had. Seemed nice in class, but required an absurd amount of reading and three in-class presentations. He is a hard grader and not flexible with students. Does not make learning enjoyable.
Very nit picky grader.  Asks specific date questions which greatly lowered the class average on midterm 1.  Arrogant

Awful instructor. Writes trick questions on tests and assigns extensive but useless chapter outlines. Lectures were not stimulating at all; I could have learned more from going on Wikipedia. As a person he is unfriendly and unhelpful. The book was very poorly written and not helpful at all but mandatory to buy and quite expensive. TAKE SOMEONE ELSE

The worst TA I've ever had. His tests were HORRIBLY written with very misleading questions and his lectures were extremely dry. Book was mandatory (and a painful 95$) due to pointless chapter outlines required for course. Tended to be argumentative and brusque with students.
TA for course. really nice; interaction was limited but he seems like a great guy.
He's just an all-around terrible teacher who could care less about his students.

so repetative, boring, writes trick questions on the tests, gets really defensive and annoyed when you ask a question, is really unclear about things, TRYS to confuse you (beware of true and false because he'll put true first on some answers and false first on others...so you circle the wrong one even if you knew the answer)  PICK ANOTHER PROF.
Not a very good lecturer, he seems like he'd rather be somewhere else.. BUT he makes this class sooo easy (lots of bonus pts!).

This class is very boring to begin with and having 2 hour lectures doesn't help. He talks forever about nothing making a 10 minute lecture last at least an hour. He also have us the wrong info and then tested us on it. He's really young and seems to think a lot of himself and thinks his class is important when it's just a GEC.

summary_comment: Professor Soltz is known for being demanding and expects a high level of engagement and effort from his students, which can be challenging but rewarding. While some students appreciate his clear enthusiasm and deep knowledge of the subject, others find him arrogant and unhelpful, with inconsistent clarity in his teaching methods.
summary_comment_short: Professor Soltz is a knowledgeable and enthusiastic educator who challenges his students to excel, but his teaching style and expectations can be demanding and sometimes confusing. Some students find him arrogant and unprofessional, while others appreciate his high standards and genuine interest in their learning.

Ratings.comment: REQUIRES WAY TOO MUCH OF HIS STUDENTS. and doesnt always seem to know what hes doing. horrible teacher. i DO NOT advise taking a class from this professor!!!!!!!

A great professor!  Fair to the bone; no one gets special treatment and his students know exactly what he expects from him.  He wants you to do well, but he also won?t hand you an A?you'll have to earn it.

He might be a little bit of a smart ass. As well as a professional instructor and knowledgeable about the subject (that's always nice). Will NOT post up slides online to save your life. According to him it does "nothing in teaching the art of note taking". So long as you show up, pay attention, and keep up with readings it's a breeze.

Prior to starting the class, I really had no interest in Anthropology.However, Micha was one hell of a teacher. His personal interest in the field showed in how he taught his class. He knew what the hell he was talking about, and if you show interest and effort in his class, then you will do fine.He will respect you, if you return show respect.

If you're looking for a babysitter or someone to praise mediocracy, he is not for you!He expects college students to produce college level work,he is arrogant but I expect nothing less from someone who is supposed to know more than me!ASK him for help!Challenging but worth it, you'll learn a lot and have fun in his class!

Arrogant and rude. Expects too much of students without providing any grading rubrics. Spent the whole last day of the quarter to basically tell my whole class how horrible writers we all were. Should be fired

Pompous and unprofessional.  If taking a class to simply fulfill requirements, he is okay. Would recommend taking someone else if you are sincerely interested in anthropology because he is not clear at conveying what he is trying to teach.

A very smart,intelligent, and enthusiastic guy who loves teaching and genuinely wants to help students learn. I was surprised that his speech is so amazingly clear! The readings may be a little hard but the professor himself is excellent! He's not as arrogant as you think he could be. Go to talk to him with any questions and you'll find he's nice!

He teaches the information well, however it is alot of information. He is smart but arrogant.  Makes it uncomfortable in class sometimes by calling students out for not knowing the answers...we are not in high school anymore.  He can be rude and unprofessional. I personally had no problem with him, but i can see how many others would!
Micah is very interested and sincere about what he does. But he is very arrogant. I didn't enjoy his attitude at all.

good at prodding discussion,quizzes over readings=hard/impossible & seem to be his main way of limiting final grades. I failed 2/3 on avg and got a 34 on the reading section of my ACT,ha. with that said he's funny and seems to enjoy teaching. Disappointingly, I found him slightly lacking in some basic knowledge about current affairs.
really funny, interesting, and has a very real outlook.

He's a really good teacher. I did not think his class was really hard, you just have to make sure you do the reading and show up to class for the weekly quizzes. I'm really not sure what is so difficult about that. He's also intelligent and funny and makes class interesting.
Micah is a lovable jerk. He is clearly intelligent, knows what he is talking about, and will help however he can.
Micah is an all around hateful person. He is rude and unprofessional and looks down on undergrad students. He is bitter about life and takes it out on students. But he has a decent sense of humor.

One of the best instructors at Ohio State, bar none. Intelligent, forward-thinking and very interesting. However, alot of reading is involved and in-class participation is required to do well. Highly recommended!
He was a fun professor, but was very easily upset.  Often would stare at us for several minutes waiting for us to say exactly the answer he wanted.  That part was sort of awful :)

Great Professor!  I can see how some students wouldn't like him, but those students are probably looking for a babysitter not a teacher.  If you really want to learn the material then take one of his classes.

Micah is a really funny professor. He is straight forward and to the point. I really like his style of teaching. It is a hard class if you don't do the readings and come to class but if you keep up on it it's all good :)

Micah is a very entertaining and nice professor but be prepared to work hard! You must read the text weekly for quizes. Exams are from lecture. Wants participation in discussion or gets mad at the class! PPoints online aren't helpful unless you print & bring to class for notes.  Hint: Come to every class after midterm for a possible bonus! : )

Micah is great; he is really entertaining and keeps the class interesting.  He is very straight forward.  He doesn't usually take attendance, but there are quizzes once a week that make up a large part of your grade.  Really helpful and willing to talk to you after class or in office hours.  Probably not the easiest, but it's worth it.
he's full of himself...and doesn't explain things well.  he's a fun guy, but not as a teacher.

Micah is a great teacher. He's passionate about anthropology, and is very helpful.  He's more than happy to talk to students after class, and keeps the class interesting.  His comments are amusing and he's very entertaining.

i think micah was a good teacher. cultural anthropology was not his field but as for willingness to help he was excellent. he has a passion for what he teaches and is stern. he is a great TA to help prepare you for grad school!

This guy sucked. He was rude and really unprofessional. You had to read everything in the book and he read off of a power point to teach that didn't even help in class... so i dropped the class. I said it once and i'll say it again... he sucked!

tended to insult certain religions, countries, and people in general.  I did not find him to be professional in his interaction with students.  created many enemies.  class content was fair and resonable but quizzes were way hard even with 2 days of extensive preparation
This guy sucks! Don't take his class.
Super teacher, very intreesting content and well presented. Micah is more than willing to help students, cares about their success.
No Comments

Outlines extremely erratic and topics presented did not flow very well. Lots of opportunity for extra credit. Extremely understanding of my personal problem and extended my paper even past the end of the quarter. Nice guy. Enthusiastic & opinionated.
Run. Far & Fast.
He is very pompous but if you study at all you should get an A. He is also willing to help you so long as you have questions. Overall I didn't like him as a teacher.

micah is a great guy. he does mean well. his tests are hard and a little too detailed. it is hard to remember the amount of material that he covers in class and all of the stuff from the book. but he tries very hard and he can make class interesting. you just have to study a lot.

summary_comment: Professor Weston is a passionate instructor who prepares thoroughly for her lectures but has received criticism for her teaching style, which some find preachy and catering to atheists. While some students appreciate her help and dedication, others find her classes difficult, particularly the tests and final exams, and consider her teaching methods and assignments to be challenging and sometimes vague.
summary_comment_short: Professor Weston is a passionate lecturer who prepares extensively for her classes but faces criticism for her teaching style, which some find authoritarian and unapproachable. She is generally regarded as helpful and dedicated, though her tests and final exams are noted for being challenging.

Ratings.comment: Passionate about what she teaches, but doesn't necessarily know what she's talking about. Pushes beliefs down everyones throats-the only students that really like this class are the atheists that this class is catered to.

completely useless. reads off the power point. assignments are vague. has a superiority complex when talking to students. looks like the love child of lisa loeb and velma from scooby doo. avoid if you can.
Great teacher!
Difficult tests but if u force urself to memorize EVERYTHING you will be fine lol
Tests and quizez are somewhat hard to get an A on, the papers are a fairly easy, and she teaches rather well, if you don't like a class with movies, you may not like this one.

extremely helpful. just make sure you go to all the classes and pay attention. see her in office hours if you dont understand something. she will explain it to you as many times as it takes for u to understand it.

My only problem with her is that her final exam this quarter was ridiculously difficult. We had to memorize over 30 archaeological site codes and traits of the primates found there. Made the final very difficult.

The subject matter was boring but Theresia did her best to make it interesting and obviously puts a great deal of preparation into her lectures.  I thought it was weird that homework assignments seemed to be exclusively distributed online though.

Theresia really knows her stuff, and makes herself available to help students whenever they need it. I didnt think the class was that hard. You just have to come to every class, and def. read the textbook. She has 3 midterms (not cumulative) and 4 hw's and 4 quizzzes which are chances for easy points. It was a really interesting! class- Take It!

She may not be your best choice if you are not already interested in anthro.  She really knows her stuff, thats clear, but she doesn't do a whole lot to make the subject interesting (not theres much you could do).  Tests are mostly multiple choice though, so just take notes and memorize and you'll be alright.

This class rocked. Theresia knows her stuff and is very easy to talk to. I actually wanted to attend every class. It's not easy, but definately the most interesting GEC. Take this class - you won't regret it.

Theresia is a very nice person. As far as being a professor, not so nice. Makes you memorize endless amounts of notes that she does not test you on. She is a grad-student going after her PHD and she teaches her class like you are too.
No Comments
Great TA, very helpful and sweet. I really learned a lot and as long as you go to class it's not too hard. She posts the lecture notes online so it's easy to follow along.

Horrible teacher-made what should have been an easy and interesting GEC into a nightmare.  Expects you to memorize the most unuseful information and then doesn't test you on it.  Try to get another teacher.

summary_comment: Professor Temple is known for his engaging and humorous teaching style, often making his classes enjoyable despite the challenging exams. Students appreciate his approachability and the advance notice of test questions, though some find his teaching methods overly detailed and his demeanor sometimes arrogant or pompous. Overall, his classes are described as both entertaining and informative, though with varying levels of difficulty depending on the student's preparation and tolerance for his political views.
summary_comment_short: Professor Temple is known for his humor and engaging teaching style, though some find his classes challenging due to detailed exams. He is generally approachable and fair in his grading, but his teaching methods and political views can be divisive among students.

Ratings.comment: I enjoyed Dr. Temple's class.  He is hilarious and his jokes are definitely politically incorrect which makes his class interesting.  You have to study really hard to get a good grade on his tests but he gives you the possible essay questions like a week before.  He is very approachable if you go to him with questions during his office hours.

If you can't take a joke, don't take this class.  Temple's a younger guy, and likes to mess with students a bit.  Expect's a high level of preparedness for his exams (there are two).  This means you have to know a lot of material down to a high level of detail.  Fair (even generous) grading makes up for this.  Study hard, get an A.

Dr. Temple is very arrogant and pompous. He is intelligent and knows what he is talking about, however he is terrible at explaining things and acts as if his students should already know everything he is teaching. He is funny, and his class is mildly interesting, but his horrible teaching skills and his detail obsessed tests made this class a pain.
Casual, made class fun, but was very informative as well. Encouraged discussion and gave insight to his own opinions often, which wasn't a bad thing. Also very cute!
funny
No Comments

Dan is super LIBERAL but he does it in a very non-threatning way. Someone needs to tell him that he is not God and that his view's aren't the final word on everything that goes on in the world. Take him if you can though because he is a very entertaining guy.
Class discussion is a lot of fun.  Temple is very far left and often states his opinions in class.  Easy grader don't get on his bad side.
this guy is cool! his class is great and you'll really enjoy attending his class. i just wish he didn't give so many notes. give us a break dan. Overall, dan and his class get's an A++++

Really fun class to take, even though when you go in to his exams thinking "I got this" you almost invariably come out knowing "that test got *me*".  If you like a relaxed and interesting class, Dan's got it.
his classes are really good and he really cares about how well his students understand the material. i highly recommend taking him as a prof. you will enjoy his classes, i guarantee it.
He's fair and kind of funny and pretty hot.

Dan is Awesome and he really cares about his students. Yes, his test's can be "dirty" at times as he says but he does curve the class even if he doesn't admit it.  Very Funny guy and made a class that I don't even believe in "evolution" interesting enough for me to not only attend every class but actually enjoyed going to it. He is the Best!
worst instructor at ohio state.
Dan is the man. I took his first class ever Fall of 2003. He is Awesome. Take his class if you can.

The course was interesting, and Dan knows quite a bit.  However, his version of the course is really geared more toward students who plan to go into some sort of biological studies/career.  The level of anatomy and biology required to pass this course is quite overwhelming for a GEC introductory course.

Dan was awesome. He was younger so he was easy to relate to and really can hold your attention. He's also very smart, and always encouraged us to talk about other stuff besides anthropology, like polotics and stuff. VERy cool.

Dan is very intelligent, but it gets him in trouble (he's a little cocky). He raises valid questions to prevalent theories (which have not really withstood the test of time) and presents differing viewpoints.  He does not spoonfeed.  Anyone with half a brain (and a little bit of their own political integrity) can not only pass, but enjoy his class.

I had him last year and thought he was awesome.  He made the class really interesting.  There were a lot of notes but I thought they were organized.  I don't think I could stand the class with another teacher b/c it would be too boring.  We also had a couple of hw's and quizzes but most of the points were from the tests.
No Comments

Well the grades are based on tests.  You will use more notes than books. Too disorganized, not enough structure, and a whole lotta notes.  There are no homeworks so for those who need to apply their learning there is no chance.  And he bashes conservatives and basically insinuates that they are stupid.

He doesn't teach facts or potential theories, but instead makes u learn his opinions. It's annoying and he discredits the other theories and who is he to make the call on theories written by people a lot smarter and more important than him. He bashes Catholics and Conservatives daily. He blabs on about how much work he does and how important it is.

such an assenine teacher. thinks he's god's gift to science and thinks we care about his opinions (like he cares about us anyway). really egotistical and arrogant, but for what? avoid a class with him if necessary!
The worst teacher I have ever had!!!
No Comments
aweful!

One of the worst instructors I have ever had.  Very condescending when questions are asked.  Very disorganized and some difficulty with some of the biology involved in anthro.  He does curse, but that is not a big deal.

horribly useless class.  he loves what he does though, and is very clear in what he wants.  not a bad professor, but boring.  well, maybe he wasn't boring, just the topic.  who knows, all i know is that i hated the class, but it wasn't too difficult
I thought he was a great teacher.  I wasn't really that interested in the class before I took it but I ended up liking it a lot because he made the class fun.

great instructor. passionate. funny. great discussions. he curses, but that adds to the hottness factor, on top of his tattoos that are creeping out from under his sleeves making you wonder where else they go during boring moments of lecture.

I enjoyed his class.  Sure he uses profane language a bit, but why should that bother me?  He makes the classroom environment much more relaxed.  His tests are easy; take notes and you will do just fine.
Very cocky attitude, curses a lot during lectures and makes students feel somewhat small and stupid when they ask questions that challenge him.
No Comments
No Comments
Dr. Temple is a great teacher. He is also really hot and I love his hair and tattoos.
interesting person, a little cocky at times but id rather have that then a pointdexter. GO to class, take the notes and you will get a good grade. Its not hard unless u make it hard.

summary_comment: Professor Ullinger is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and engaging approach to the subject matter. She provides comprehensive study guides and makes even potentially dull topics interesting, leading to strong retention of information. Students find her class manageable with minimal homework and relatively easy exams, but emphasize the importance of attending lectures and taking notes to succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ullinger is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, making complex topics engaging and easy to understand. Students consistently recommend her class, praising her friendly demeanor, interesting lectures, and the availability of comprehensive study guides that significantly aid in exam preparation.

Ratings.comment: Of course this class takes work; every class requires at least some. However, showing up and taking notes is 90% of the battle. She gives study guides a week before the exams with basically everything you need to know, and she's really really nice. It's also an interesting GEC (we learned about cannibalism at one point) Definitely would recommend.

I will disagree with the assessment that this class is an easy A...it's not. You need to show up, take notes, and study. Slides are not posted. That being said, she makes what could be a very boring topic into something fascinating. She is an awesome teacher. I still remember everything I learned in this class.
Jaime was amazing, I would recommend her and the class to everyone. Practice her study guides and you aer guaranteed an A.

Couldn't be more emphatic in my recommendation of this class. Ullinger is likable and keeps things interesting. Almost zero homework. Extremely easy to get an A. The class average on the first exam was 96%. The search for a natural sciences GEC should unequivocally end here.

Prof. Ullinger is really friendly and she tries to make the class interesting even though the material is actually really boring. She doesn't give an unreasonable amount of homework and the exams are fairly easy if you study for them.

Boring lectures. Very easy. Just look over the study guide and tests are no problem. Very easy homework assignments. A very good GEC, especially if you're just trying to keep your GPA up. Recommended (esp. b/c you don't need to go to class for the most part)
Decent teacher, I guess. Nice, funny, laid back.

Very good teacher, easy class, as long as you take notes and do the reviews you'll pass. Kind-of strict on attendance, don't expect her to tell you what you missed if you're not going to attend classes.

Really nice, clear lady. Most of the material comes from lecture. Kind of a boring class but she has a good attitude so it's not miserable. Exams are easy if you go to class and look over the review she gives out.

This class is great for a biology GEC credit.  She makes the subject as fun and interesting as possible, and also gives a very manageable workload.  Borrow the textbook or check it out at the library (Don't buy!).  Midterms/Final are a little challenging, just be sure to go over class notes and the study guide!  highly recommend Jaime.

Jamie was gr8t the material was very current and interesting.. there are no exams just writing assignmentsh.  A good 2 or 3 essays and I paper, she was very helpful as far as choosing a topic and narrowing it down. She made class fun it was discussion based so if no 1 asks questions or gives their opinion the class will pretty much be boring

Jaime gets and keeps you interested in the class.  She's extrememly helpful and the material used was relevant and interesting. I loved this class because of her.  I would highly recommend taking any class with Jaime as an instructor.
Jaime was EXTREMELY nice as far as attendance goes. The class was boring but it wasn't her fault, this class is almost all discussion. No book, very minimal work outside of class, good GEC.

This class was mostly boring but she does an above average job at bringing the subject matter to life.  Dont bother buying the book much less reading it...she mentions it twice and asks the class a question to which no one responds.  By the end ofthe quarter she just brings printed notes to class so just study them and maps and its an easy A!
No Comments
Nice lady, laid back. Sometimes doesn't have much control over the class, but other than that she does a really good job.

she makes the info seem halfway interesting.  you don't need to buy the book if you attend lectures, bc she gives you all the info for the exams.  if you  need a science GEC i would recommend this class with  her as the instructor
She was awesome! Truely cared about helping students! Really funny! You will love her.

If you have to take this course take it with her. She's hilarious (& has great stories)& VERY helpful. She goes the extra mile 4 you if you need it! She posts the notes so you only have to GO to class and PAY attention. If you do that + put effort into studying for each test you can get an A easily!

summary_comment: Professor Fuhrman's online classes are known for their comprehensive and engaging content, including fun videos and articles, though students find the reading load substantial, especially towards the end of the week. While the class structure is designed to be manageable, with multiple opportunities to complete quizzes and exams, some students struggle with the pace and Professor Fuhrman's responsiveness to emails and assignment issues. Overall, the class is considered easy in terms of grading but demanding in terms of workload and expectations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fuhrman's online classes are known for their comprehensive and engaging content, including fun videos and articles, but students find the workload substantial, particularly the amount of reading required each week. While the course material can be challenging, the exams tend to be straightforward, often consisting of verbatim questions from previous quizzes, and the homework is relatively easy. However, Professor Fuhrman's response time to emails and issues with assignments on Carmen is frequently criticized for being slow.

Ratings.comment: I took the online class, and I enjoyed it immensely - he posted interesting material for us to read (fun videos, neat articles, etc.). I would say the main drawback is how much we have to read in one week; toward the end it's two chapters, which really begins to wear you down. Overall, though, I liked him!

I took the online class. Never had enough time to complete quizzes (8 questions in only 8 minutes) - not sometime you would see in a real time class. Exams were ok, if you did good on quizzes. It was a lot to get done during the week - often two or three chapters/readings in addition to videos.

I took the online version of this as well. The subject matter is challenging, you have weekly discussion posts 2x/week,which he'll defend or critize,doesn't respond to e-mail very quickly, and exams are difficult. good luck!

This was an online course and it was easy overall, but he was horribly slow at responding to emails/questions and fixing assignments on Carmen that were messed up.  He made excuses (valid or not) for these situations, but it was still really frustrating and put a sour mood on the class.

Online version of this class is very easy.  Homework is an easy 100 and quizzes you can take 3 times (your score is the average of the 3 attempts).  The exams are verbatim questions from prior quizzes.  Although he is really slow at responding to questions/emails.

NITPICKER!! He's so hard to please. Does not give out study guides for exams. There are three exams total. Reading and "Discussion Questions" before every class. (Readings include whole chapters from the book and one atricle or more. Not easy.) The discussion questions are, on average, three questions long and only worth three points, but he expect

summary_comment: Professor Rodrigues is known for his excellent teaching quality, delivering clear and engaging lectures that effectively convey complex concepts. His thorough preparation and ability to make the subject matter accessible to students contribute significantly to a positive learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rodrigues is known for his excellent teaching quality, delivering clear and engaging lectures that effectively convey complex concepts. His ability to make the subject matter accessible and interesting has earned him high regard among students.

Ratings.comment: No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Roos is widely regarded as unorganized and difficult, with students finding his PowerPoint slides lacking in detail and his lectures hard to follow. Despite some positive aspects such as providing study guides and being knowledgeable about the subject matter, his teaching style and grading policies are often criticized for being overly demanding and inconsistent.
summary_comment_short: Professor Roos is widely regarded as unorganized, with lectures and PowerPoint slides that are difficult to follow, especially for students who miss class. Students find his exams challenging and overly demanding, with strict grading criteria and a heavy emphasis on memorization.

Ratings.comment: This is one of the most unorganized classes I have ever taken.  If you miss the notes from class it's nearly impossible to decipher the powerpoint slides later - most only contain images or key words.  He lectures quickly and flies through the slides saying "this will be on carmen" but the slides are so obscure you can't make sense of them later
The worst teacher I have ever had.

This class is difficult because it covers all of human history, from the first bipeds to the civilizations of the 1500s, though it is interesting. His exams are by no means a piece of cake, but he does provide study guides to assist in studying. Reading the textbook is crucial for success. Written assignments do not demand much, are graded fairly.

He does not teach this class like an Honors 200-level class. I have done less reading and writing for some 400 or 500 level classes. He also takes points off assignments and tests for asinine reasons. I learned a good amount, but overall the class was an inappropriate amount of work. He's a nice guy and loves what he's doing though.

Granted it was his first year.  However, he asks way too much on the tests.  If you leave out the slightest detail you get a tremendous amount of points off.  He'll ask you for a one page paper and demand information that should be in a 10 page paper.  Way to in depth/difficult for a GEC class.

summary_comment: Professor Zaharlick is perceived as a nice person but is criticized for her teaching approach, which heavily relies on student presentations and minimal lecturing. Students found the class structure unsatisfactory, particularly the lack of consistent lectures and the focus on papers over traditional assessments. While some appreciated the class as easy and enjoyable, many felt they did not receive adequate guidance or substantive learning opportunities.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zaharlick is perceived as a very nice person but an ineffective lecturer, with many students feeling that the class structure was poor and the material was not adequately covered at the appropriate level. The majority of class time was spent on student presentations and watching movies, leading to dissatisfaction with the depth of learning and the lack of traditional lectures or comprehensive assessments.

Ratings.comment: Loved her!

Very nice woman, but awful professor.  She "lectured" twice and the remainder of the classes were filled with student presentations.  Lucky if Zaharlick even showed up and it wasn't the TA leading the class.  I felt like I was in an intro level course, not a 600 level.
This was a theory class and she covered the material very well.  I found the class very useful and interesting.  Papers rather than a test, which I liked.
Didn't learn anything new, but easy and enjoyable class.

Professor only lectured two of the classes, skipped two of them for "prior commitments" and cut out after starting a movie once.  Had TA do all of the grading and didn't learn our names.  VERY disappointing.

Dr. Zaharlick is very nice, but her class is set up very poorly.  She lectures on a topic the day the papers are due, and there are no final tests, so most people just drop off their papers and leave.  Your papers must be exactly 4.5 pages.  I turned in one that was 4 1/3 pages long and was penalized, with no critique other than "needs to be longer
No Comments

We watched ALOT of movies, which weren't really helpful, rather than discussing each chapter. But Dr. Zaharlick is very nice and will answer any questions you have about the subject. There are three tests and one presentation, but everything is fairly easy.

summary_comment: Professor Watson is highly regarded for her engaging and knowledgeable approach to teaching, despite the class sometimes lacking inherent interest. She is consistently available to help students and excels at making complex material interactive and accessible, often using diverse resources such as YouTube. Students strongly recommend her for both her expertise and supportive teaching style.
summary_comment_short: Professor Watson is highly regarded for her engaging and knowledgeable approach to teaching, despite the class sometimes lacking in inherent interest. She is consistently praised for her willingness to help students and her deep understanding of the subject matter, making her a strong recommendation for anyone seeking a quality science class.

Ratings.comment: Anna is awesome and very into what she does. Great professor, extremely laid back. Class itself is not the most interesting but she does her best to liven it up. If you need a GEC science class, this is a good one.

This was an awesome teacher. She was /always/ willing to help, loved my questions, and really knew her subject matter. For a grad student, I was impressed. I would definitely recommend taking her. Using a variety of resources (including youtube), she made learning interactive and made the class one of the most interesting I've ever taken. Take her!

summary_comment: Professor Blatt is highly regarded for her expertise and engaging teaching style, often described as both humorous and caring. Students appreciate her fairness and reasonableness, noting that active participation and respect contribute to a positive learning environment. Her comprehensive knowledge of anthropology is evident, though she emphasizes the importance of attending classes to fully grasp the material, as key information is not always included in posted slides.
summary_comment_short: Professor Blatt is highly regarded for her expertise and engaging teaching style, making complex concepts accessible and entertaining. She is known for her fairness, helpfulness, and commitment to both her subject matter and her students' learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Best teacher EVER! I took 4 classes with her. She knows her stuff, she is hilarious, and she cares about anthropology and her students. She also wears green converse to class...awesome!
Great professor. Participate in class, be honest with her, and show respect. Do that and you will have a nice time and will do well. She is very reasonable and fair.

Book is not needed. She posts slides prior to each class, but you have to go to class, since there are some information missing in them. 3 non-cumulative tests ( multiple choice, t/f, and essay questions). Overall, very helpful and knowledgeable.

summary_comment: Professor Huffman receives overwhelmingly positive feedback for her teaching quality, with students praising her exceptional ability to explain concepts clearly and her fair grading. Her classes are described as engaging and worthwhile, even for those initially uninterested in the subject matter. While some note that she does not easily bend grades in favor of students, her overall teaching approach is highly regarded.
summary_comment_short: Professor Huffman is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, making complex topics accessible and engaging. Students appreciate her fairness in grading and her supportive approach, even during her first semester teaching.

Ratings.comment: Only wonderful things to say about her. I'd recommend her to anyone. I didn't even like anthro and LOVED this class! She is awesome at explaining things and grades fairly. She's not at OSU anymore for a dig in Brazil, but if she ever comes back I encourage you to take this class with her or anything else she teaches!

I loved this class. I only had to take this class because it was required, but she made it worth while. I was in her first class the had ever taught, so she was very understanding and fun. I got an A in the class, no problem. She gave lots of extra credit opprotunities as well

Straightforward class. As long as you go to class you'll do well but don't expect her to bump up your grade. Ended the quarter with an 89.75% and e-mailed her begging for just one point extra credit and she didn't give it to me. Salty.

summary_comment: Professor Martin is highly regarded for her comprehensive approach to teaching, clarity in expectations, and passion for her subject, which she effectively communicates through frequent discussions and detailed study guides. Her approach is generally appreciated, though some students find her class can be repetitive and less engaging, particularly without prior knowledge in the field.
summary_comment_short: Professor Martin is highly regarded for her comprehensive approach to teaching, clear expectations, and organized study materials, making her classes effective for those who attend regularly. Her passion for anthropology and willingness to help students create a supportive learning environment are also notable aspects of her teaching style.

Ratings.comment: Sarah is obviously passionate about anthropology and her interest shines through in this class. Comprehensive study guides for tests that make you very aware of what to be prepared for. She is organized and very clear about what she expects of you. Lots of discussion to keep things interesting. GO TO CLASS and you will do well.

Even as an outsider to the field of molecular genetics, she was able to communicate the material clearly, efficiently, and in an interesting way. Yes, she does have problems with retroflex consonants, but I had no problems understanding her. She is VERY understanding, and is generally interested in helping her students. Per grading, she's VERY fair

She was very nice and always willing to meet with people during office hours. She really cared about her students. If you have any questions, miss a quiz, or whatever, don't hesitate to go to her class. She's a great person and truly cares about Anthropology, even if you don't.
This teacher definitely knew her material. Referring to the post below, I think she is from New York or New Jersey, so that's where the accent comes from.
Is it just me or does she have a speech impediment? Why is no one mentioning this? I can't even understand what she's saying half the time

this class is NOT hard.  the person below me probably never went to class.  yes it is a boring class because it is discussion based but it's really not hard.  just do the work assigned.  it's a capstone course and there's always a lot of work in the 597 classes.

I don't know what these two people below me are talking about because I hated Sarah Martin!! She's so boring and the class isn't much better. Every class is super repetitive and you dread going every morning...at least I did.

This review is for the 597.04 class - if you are any kind of biosci major, you're at a huge advantage in regards to terminology and genetic concepts.  Not a difficult class! Just read the articles and participate in class discussions.  Term paper required and 4 online quizzes (short answer - lowest grade dropped).  Attendance mandatory, no book.

If you do the work, and pay attention in class, it's not hard at all. While the issues presented in the course don't directly relate to students at OSU, the issues at hand are important to look at. The course format is typical of all 597 classes (not just women's and development). She's actually very nice!
Prof is young but not very friendly. She doesn't really teach since class is all discussion and participation is mandatory. Course itself is not what I thought it'd be. Lots of writing!!
It is very hard to stay awake in this two hour class. Subject matter is very boring if anthropology doesn't interest you. Don't need a book-- all readings are on Carmen.
Professor doesn't even seem interested in the course when she teaches. She's also a tough grader. FYI: lots of reading and writing in the course!!
Not a fan of the course. Prof is a hard grader when it comes to papers!

Class is pretty much a reading/writing course. You have an online quiz once a week but they are short answer/essay questions. Course is pretty boring if you're not an anthro major. Professor is helpful but a bit snooty as well.
She sucks!! Don't take her class. Not what I expected at all, even after reading the course description.

It's painful enough trying to stay awake at 8:30 in the morning, but trying to stay awake in this class is literally a challenge. If you like anthropology and love reading 30-50 pages of online documents for every class, this is the course for you!!!

Prof Martin is one of the worst professors I've had at Ohio State and I'm graduating this quarter. She doesn't really teach except for the first discussion day and she expects the rest of the class to do the work for her. She is very arrogant and favors certain students. Class is mostly about women issues in less developed countries. Good luck!! :)

Class all based on tests...no hw and online quizzes every other week which are based off power points. Gives powerpoints in pdf document with certain info missing that you fill in during class. Never used book...tests are what count and she gives the most intensive, descriptive study guide ive seen. If you do the study guide tests are easy.

summary_comment: Professor Sciulli is highly regarded by some students for his dedication and willingness to help, though he can be challenging due to heavy memorization requirements. Conversely, other students find his teaching style unengaging and overly intensive, with some classes described as among the worst they have taken. Overall, his effectiveness as a teacher varies significantly depending on the course and student perspective.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sciulli is highly regarded by some students as a knowledgeable and supportive educator, particularly in Anthro 603.01, where his willingness to help and the class's value to anthropology majors are noted. However, other students find him challenging and less effective as a lecturer, especially in courses like Anthro 402.01, which they describe as boring and overly demanding.

Ratings.comment: This man is my hero

Anthro 603.01 is a really good class for anthro majors! Sciulli is a bit of an odd ball so as long as you know that going in it's okay. He's a really nice and great guy who is totally willing to help. Lot's of memorization. I suggest making note cards and drawing all the bones.
402.01 is the worst class I've ever taken, completely avoid it if possible.  He was incredibly boring, and read straight from his slides which didn't really make sense
No Comments

Not exaggerating, this is one of the worst/ most work intensive classes I've taken at OSU. He doesn't write things down, so he just lectures for 2 hours and it's difficult to pay attention. As a person, he is very nice/personable. He just isn't a very good teacher. I thought this would be an easier GEC...
Brilliant professor!

summary_comment: Professor Senn is widely regarded as having extremely poor teaching quality. Students find his lectures monotonous and unengaging, with some reporting that he reads slides verbatim without adding value or context. The exams are challenging, consisting mainly of short answers and essays rather than multiple-choice questions, and the grading criteria for weekly summaries are overly strict. Overall, his classes are considered difficult and frustrating.
summary_comment_short: Professor Senn's teaching is widely regarded as poor, with students finding his lectures difficult to follow and the material challenging to pass. The class structure and grading system are seen as unfair and ineffective, with minimal correlation between study materials and exams.

Ratings.comment: Terrible

I'm an A student and I earned a D+ in this class. Class was impossible to pass, and he was frustrating to communicate with. I had emergency surgery and I had to beg to take the quiz I missed from that week. I would have taken any other class besides this one. Beyond any of the other terrible classes I've had.

Read slides verbatim, had no interest in material what so ever.  Weekly article summaries are required and he grades it like a thesis. Study guide given for tests but might as well not even look at it because has nothing to do with exam.  Exams = few mutiple choice, few T/F, many short answers and essays.

summary_comment: Professor Kolatorowicz is known for his rigorous grading and high standards, which challenge students to improve their anthropological writing skills. While some students find his classes engaging and rewarding, others describe him as inconsistent and overly harsh, with a focus on maintaining low average grades rather than effective teaching. Overall, his effectiveness as a teacher appears to depend significantly on the student's ability to engage actively and communicate effectively.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kolatorowicz is known for his challenging yet effective teaching style, particularly in anthropology. While some students find his classes demanding and his grading strict, many appreciate his deep knowledge of the subject matter and his ability to engage students with passion and relevant content.

Ratings.comment: At the beginning of the class, I had no idea what to expect. Adam grades tough, but allowed us to correct our work throughout the semester for a higher grade. I can honestly say that he helped me develop a better sense of anthropological writing, which is invaluable as an anthro major. The key to getting a good grade in his class is communicating!

One of the worst instructors I have ever had. Could not teach a class to save his life. Focused more on keeping average grades around 70% than teaching. Would recommend he stay out of academia, because he does not put the student/material first. Also  very harsh/cross at times. Can be narcissistic, rude, and arrogant to the point of near delusion.

He assigns papers without giving guidelines and only after grading the paper does he give you what he was looking for so you can almost never get an A on a paper. I completely regret taking this class, he was extremely boring and I dreaded every day I had to go to his class
Inconsistent grading. Not willing to budge even when he contradicts the textbook and his lecture.
Nice guy, I recommend e-mailing him if you have questions about anything. The class is pretty boring though

Knows his material very well, but doesn't care about the students standing or grades at all. If you do not do exactly what he wants, you will not do well in the class, even if you have correct information. Way too hard of a grader for an introductory course.

Adam was a really good teacher.  He knew and liked what we was talking about, which made class interesting.  Lots of videos, but they were all good to watch.  If you go to class and take notes, you'll do well.
I love this class, even though it is hard.  He is really passionate about what he teaches and is up front about what you need to do to pass the class.  You cant fool around and do half ass work.
The material is difficult and the tests are hard, but he is always willing to explain stuff to you before/after class if you have questions. Besides, he's so HOT who cares what he's talking about??

He was a great teacher.  Posted powerpoints online so we could fill in the blanks in class.  Made great study guides and the tests were based off them.  Really fun and interesting class.  Just show up, take notes, study a little, and you will get a good grade.  Highly recommend him!!
Don't take his class. The tests are hard and the study guides are supposed to help, but instead are just a waste of time. Its an incredibly boring class and all he does is babble about fossils.
He's a passionate teacher and knows a lot, but the material is dry and hard to understand. The tests are pretty hard but he does seem to want the class to do well and he grades on a curve.

Awful teacher!  His study guides are worthless and he talks way too fast.  It is frustrating studying so much information that isn't even on the test.  He is not a full professor yet so don't call him a professor because he is clearly not one. He has done the impossible by turning what should have been an easy introductory course into a hard class.

Highly reccommend him for Anthro 202. Classes are fun, and he gives you exactly what you need to study for exams. You must attend classes to get the notes. Easy class, he's an easy grader as long as you follow the format. Fast to answer questions by e-mail or in his office. He's very good looking, too.

Great professor. Easy to understand, interesting conversations in class, good videos. Make sure to attend lecture, his notes are precise and cuts down on reading the book.  His tests are multiple choice and essay, but he gives you a heads up so you know what you should study.  Definitely recommend him.

summary_comment: Professor Smith has received mixed reviews, with some students praising her passion for the subject and clear expectations, while others find her lectures boring and her teaching methods ineffective. Many students highlight her strict attendance policies and unexpected test questions as significant issues. Overall, her teaching style and effectiveness vary widely among students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Smith is perceived as having clear expectations and being passionate about her field, though her teaching style and class structure are divisive, with some finding her lectures boring and her methods of testing and attendance policies harsh. Many students feel they did not learn much from her and would avoid taking another class with her if possible.

Ratings.comment: Good teacher with clear expectations.  I'm not sure why there are so many negative comments about her.  She's very passionate about the field and a great professor for the course.  I really like this class.

Had this woman for 2 classes this past semester. Read and memorize her syllabus (even the irrelevant parts to her class) because she will not go over it. Lectures are an absolute bore and you will learn nothing at all. Make sure to do her study guides because they are the exact questions that show up on exams. Not really sure how she got a PhD...

Worst professor I've ever had.  She is completely insane as far as her expectations of attendance and participation go.  She expects everyone to attend lecture but makes them so boring that going to class is unbearable.  I didn't learn anything. If you must take this class, wait until Trask teaches it.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Has no respect for students' time and does not give relevant lectures or make her expectations clear at all. If you stop going to class, she will purposely add questions to tests that were only covered in class as a "punishment." Love the subject matter, but didn't learn a thing from this professor. Avoid.

She stops class to yell at students for talking (even if they aren't) and deducts off your final grade for it. If she thinks people aren't attending she'll make half the test questions about an inclass video (without telling anyone that she's going to test on it). She deducts points for typos but her tests and her syllabus are riddled with them.

It was the worst news of my academic career when I found out I was going to have to take a second anthropology course with Cynthia Smith to complete GenEd requirements. Unbelievably boring, not willing to schedule appointments outside of office hours, condescending and unhelpful. Lectures in no way prepare you for exams.

Worst professor I've ever had. I'm an anthrop major, and I was taking a class required for my major and one I was interested in, so I should have enjoyed it. it was horrible. She goes off on tangents so you have no idea what you're actually supposed to take notes on, and there's no textbook to fall back on. I will never take a class with her again

Horrible. Made me question major and point of life. Went off on tangents, mostly on her views on completely unrelated matters. Made us buy the book and then stopped using it a few weeks into the course. Taught nothing in the lectures but gave points for attendance. Good point- gave study guides for the exams with all of the necessary information

Possibly the worst 2 hours of my life and a class that made me question my major choice. She goes off on tangents, rants about technology, and is incredibly unhelpful. Always says to look at the syllabus, which is vague on content and what she expects outside of in-class behaviour. Just a horrible class.

Basically, Dr. Smith was not that interesting and didn't teach me a lot.  But, if you're looking for an easy honors class (which I was) it was perfect.  Getting an A is totally attainable if you have the discipline to show up (she  takes attendance) and study for the tests (she gives you a study guide though which has the EXACT material you need).

She is genuinely passionate about her work and a very interesting person to listen to.  She can go off on tangents and push her views a bit, but overall that is a minority of the time. Word of caution, a 95% is an A in this course, don't let a single point slip away.

I took Smith's class AU '10, and I'm glad I have no interest in anthropology because I probably would have lost it after this class. She was extremely boring; screened videos that had nothing to do with our topics; went on confusing and pointless tangents; was so unaware of the class that she didn't notice when people were absent. Easy A but boring

She is a terrible teacher who tries her hardest to impose her views on her students. Her lectures are boring and painful to sit through. She falls way behind on what she is supposed to be teaching in order to teach about the inner workings of the business world that she used to be in. Terrible, terrible teacher.
Very dry class. Little discussion. Mostly lectures and readings. I don't recommend it.
Really easy class. Just memorize what's on the study guide for an A.

Mind-numbing two hour lecture class with little class discussion. A few easy short homework assignments. Exams are incredibly easy as they are multiple-choice and she provides a study guide that has all of the potential questions listed. Would recommend if you're looking for an easy Honors class.

The class was easy (a few short papers, but make sure you proofread them thoroughly and have good knowledge of how to punctuate; the tests had study guides with all the answers on them). She was a little bit wacky and would often go on her own tangents during lectures. Focus on the book and you'll be fine.

You will learn nothing relevant or useful in this course. She grades papers solely based upon grammatical mistakes and cares little for student input. This is a ridiculously easy class but the mind-numbing boredom of hearing her spout her opinions for two hours is NOT worth it. Avoid this class at all costs; it was the worst part of my week.

Easy class. Attendance not mandatory but some questions on tests are from lecture. 5 homework assignments, book report, two midterms, final. All of the questions on her tests are on the study guide she prepares so it's difficult not to get an A on them.

This class was an easy A.  She gives study guides for the exams, and the questions are straight out of the book. She is an easy grader when it comes to papers, just don't make any grammatical errors.  The class wasn't particularly interesting, and she didn't really teach much in lectures, but if you get the book you'll get an A.

Dr. Smith is friendly and approachable and makes getting an A quite easy. Just know the study guide she gives you, all you need to know is right there. Be careful with your papers though, she likes to take off points for minor errors. I took 200H and 202H with her and I think she's better for cultural, you don't learn enough in 202.

I had Dr. Smith for two classes: Anthropology H200 and H202. I enjoyed her classes very much. She stuck to the course objectives but also added in her own flare. Her lectures are interesting but she can be somewhat dull at times. Her grading and assignments were all very fair.

This is a very easy class, but a lot of the information discussed is not relevant to anthropology. I didn't read the textbook and managed to receive an A-, showing how easy of an honors class this is. I would recommend this class for an honors GEC course due to its ease. Proofread your papers because she takes off lots of points for small mistakes.

This is a very easy class, but not a whole lot is taught or learned. She lectures about her opinions on things not relevant to anthropology. She is very nice and there are few assignments, but she takes off lots of points on papers due to small grammar mistakes and formatting errors.

Why is this woman allowed to teach? I wish I would have read all these negative comments before taking the class, they are 100% true! I will be re-taking the class again with a different professor. Hopefully I will learn something this time!

She was awful. She didn't teach ANYTHING about cultural anthropology. It was more like a class on her life. I felt like the only reason she became a teacher is so that she has an hour and fourty eight minutes where people are required to listen to her brag and impose her political views.

I fought off sleep during every lecture, except when she showed 1970s movies, which were sometimes interesting. The class is easy seeing that the midterms and final are exactly like the study guide. But she throws in some curveballs and you need a 95 to get an A. Proofread everything because small gramatical errors cost me a ton of points and an A.

Her lectures-boring!  It didnt seem like she was teaching what we needed ot know, she was teaching her beleifs and her interests.  She told students who emailed her w/ questions that they were nuesances, which find appalling b/c i have never heard of a teacher not welcoming students emails asking for help.  She was a very rude, standoffish person!

A nice woman, but one of the worst classes I've taken.  Each lecture was a tangent where she preached her dislike of things like computers.  Didn't really care about or invite student opinions, and I don't believe she knew our names though it was a small class.  Good class if you want an easy grade, bad class if you want to learn or be valued.

Dr. Smith is one of the best teachers I've ever had. She is extremely helpful and kind. Her enthusiasm is geniune and I enjoy every class. She is great and she gives out the study guides the first day of class!

This class was so easy for an honors level course; the tests are multiple choice and she tells you exactly what is on them.  Yet she makes the class very interesting and she is such a nice person.  She made anthropology interesting and fun.

Dr.Smith is the NICEST KINDEST prof here at OSU. She doesnt want to make things overly hard or difficult and it shows. The class on women's health is sooooo interesting and fun. I looked forward to going to class EVERY SINGLE DAY. It was relaxing. Tests are great b/c of study guides. Do all assignments, homeoworks, mjr paper, and tests= A+

I took this class a few quarters ago, and all of the work was especially easy. The tests were directly based on her review sheets. That said, the class itself was soo boring. I could not have been more bored, especially since basically nothing discussed in lecture is on the exams. Easy and nice prof. though.
Very easy class. Would recommend it to anyone. Hardly ever went to class, she doesn't take attendance and your mid term and final is all vocab. Make flashcards for both and you'll get an A.

I had Dr. Smith for hunters and gatherers and loved the class. She does not rely on books; we watched a lot of movies, but they were very interesting and informative. Plus, she is so nice and kind, I hated to miss her class.

Very straightforward assignments and tests.  Great class for a GEC - she tries to get students interested in the material, but doesn't assume everyone in her class is majoring in her subject (like many GEC instructors)

Great prof! Interesting, but has a tendency to go off the subject. Lecture is more for discussion than actual notetaking. Most of the exam is from the book, especially the definitions. Shows lots of films. Nice, classy lady, easy to talk to. Seems to sincerely like her students and teaching in general. Highly recommend her!
Very laid back, clear, interesting. Not too much work and easy exams. Definitely recommend, especially for an honors class.

An enormous amount of material in the reading that was not touched on in class-  Perhaps a change in class structure/time would allow for detailed analyses of reading and the history of some of the theories presented.  I do enjoy her classes and she's a very sweet, warm woman with real-world experience to bring to the class.
I also think that this class was kinda dull... she was very nice though, and you hated not to come because she was so sweet!  but its very easy! basically a vocab class :)
dull class.  fair grader.  its nice to have a prof that is excited about what they do and exude that in the classroom.

dr. smith is an amazing professor and an amazing woman. i love the fact that she has outside experience she's able to tie into the theories we've learned. our discussions never fail to be less than interesting and informative despite their occasional undulating and tangential qualities.

Really nice, and really into the cultural anthropology, which is great.  The class was laid back, and I learned a lot, but, at the same time, it was kind of a joke.  The tests were too easy.  Maybe it just proves that she was good at teaching the material, but I didn't feel challenged by the class.

Awesome teacher.  Class is very laid back.  Material is interesting.  She is very knowledgable and nice.  There isn't a ton of work, and exams are very easy. Not many notes or busywork. Very organized and straight forward. HIGHLY RECCOMEND!!SHE IS GREAT.

Excellent teacher.  Enjoyed every moment of class.  Got sidetracked sometimes in lecture, but expectations for exams were easy to meet.  Great book and article selections.  I recommend this class to everyone.

summary_comment: Professor Robbins is highly regarded for his clear and simple teaching style, making the course accessible and easy to follow, especially for those fulfilling general education credits. Students appreciate his passion for the subject matter and his helpfulness in answering questions. However, some find his lectures less engaging due to occasional hesitations and soft speaking, and note that the course can be less challenging than expected.
summary_comment_short: Professor Robbins is highly regarded for his teaching quality, described as easy to follow with clear study guides and a passion for the subject matter that engages students. His helpfulness and approachability are consistently noted, though some find his lectures could be more engaging.

Ratings.comment: It was a very easy course and the lab manual was the only thing you needed to read if you didnt want to get the book. Most of the answers were in there. He is passionate about the subject which made me interested in it too. He was helpful when asked questions too.
If you need to fulfill a GEC with this class, I fully recommend Brian.  Keeps things simple, answers questions, and is a very nice guy. Also, his study guides are awesome. Very easy to do well.

Really nice and helpful dude. My only criticism was that we wasn't the most engaging speaker, said "umm" a lot and spoke kind of quite. Also I did not find the class to be very challenging, which I was personally disappointed about. The material was interesting though.

Really nice lecturer! Sometimes he speaks a bit too softly but most of the time he's audible. Never used the textbook and the most important thing is to write down the notes from the slides as you will never see them again. Study guides from him are super helpful! He is also very forgiving :).

summary_comment: Professor Byars is consistently rated poorly by students, who find her lectures confusing and unhelpful, with material on tests not aligning with in-class content. Students also report mandatory attendance and participation policies, unfair grading practices, and overly difficult exams, particularly for introductory courses. Overall, her teaching quality is considered very poor, and students strongly advise against taking her classes.
