summary_comment_short: Professor Byars is widely regarded as a poor instructor, with students consistently reporting her inability to effectively teach the course material, unclear notes, and unfair grading practices. Students strongly advise avoiding her classes due to her unhelpful approach and the difficulty of her exams, which do not align with in-class content.

Ratings.comment: Do NOT take a class with her. Worst professor I have had at the college or even high school level. It was evident she did not grasp the material she was trying to teach or give notes on, often could not pronounce key words (tried to play that off as being cute), and could not answer questions in class. Material on test did not correlate to in class

I had her at OU and I'm not trying to be harsh, just honest, but she was awful. It is evident that she is teaching outside of her sub-discipline of Anthropology and has no idea what in the hell she is teaching. Tests were not at all what she said they would be. I would avoid her class at all costs.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER! Her notes don't make any sense and are all over the place. Exams are harder than what you would expect based on material and covers things you don't even learn.

Horrible. Initially comes off as pretty cool & then the crap sets in.  Attendance = mandatory. Sitting in circle = mandatory. This is the first 597 class that I have not enjoyed. Will pick apart essays incorrectly - I had my mom double-check that I was right and she has a Master's in English and taught in that field for many years. Grrr. Avoid!
Very bad teacher. She always took attendance and picked favorite students. Way to many essays! Lectured all the time, so student participation. She would never explain why she took of points.

She was awful. Classes were painstakingly boring, and tests were way too hard for an intro class. She also grades papers unfairly, and takes off points for no reason and then can't explain why when you ask her about it.

summary_comment: Professor Kelley is widely regarded as a sweet and engaging lecturer who makes the class enjoyable and interesting. However, her grading can be challenging, particularly for papers, which require additional effort and revisions. While some students appreciate the generous exam times and find the content manageable, others find the workload intense and the professor less supportive outside of class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kelley is known for her engaging lectures and approachable demeanor, though her grading can be challenging, particularly for papers. Students note a heavy workload and the necessity of extensive preparation for exams, but many still find the class enjoyable and recommend her teaching style.

Ratings.comment: She's so sweet and very interesting! Super easy A if you just go to class and know the notes; papers are graded a little harder than I expected, but just go to her for revisions and those are easy As as well. Overall, great lady and great lecturer. I would highly recommend.

Will give you unreasonable amounts of time to take essay exams- like 20 minutes (NO JOKE!), then when you approach her about it she will suggest you need to go to disability services. She can't keep up with her own grading... This was the worst OSU class I have taken to date.

I really enjoyed the content of the class and consider it one of my favories so far, thought she was very fun and seemed generally interested in teaching the course, exams are not that hard if you put some time into them

for a GEC, she made the class more difficult than it should have been; I had calluses on my hands from the 8 pages of notes per lecture. the workload was pretty intense but the material itself was not hard. didn't seem very willing to help outside of class. You will need to spend a ton of time preparing for the tests as they are all essay
Uhm... she says 'uhm' and 'like' a lot. If you go to class and pay attention you should do well.

summary_comment: Professor Giblin is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and fairness in grading. Students appreciate her ability to foster critical thinking and provide clear expectations for exams and assignments. While some find her lectures engaging and her approachable demeanor beneficial, others report that the material can be challenging and the lectures sometimes confusing.
summary_comment_short: Professor Giblin is widely regarded as an effective and fair instructor who encourages critical thinking and global perspectives. Students appreciate her clear expectations for exams and assignments, her availability to answer questions, and her generally easy grading standards, though some found her lectures initially confusing.

Ratings.comment: Julia is an excellent teacher. She has real world knowledge even with being a younger professor. She cultivates active thinking and provokes better understanding. She causes you to think globally instead of locally. She is fair on grading and maintains an open class for offering ideas and different points of view.

Julia was a very good teacher.  She posted fill-in-the-blank notes on Carmen.  All you had to do was print them out, go to class, and fill in the words during lecture.  As long as you do that, you'll do fine on the midterm and final.

Julia is a genuinely nice professor and extremely interested in her field. Textbook use is minimal, a few papers to write but easy as hell, exams are relatively simple. I came to this class with no interest at all, but I walked away satisfied. Easy A! Take this class! She's cute as hell too!

Mrs. Giblin is a very good professor and will answer any questions that you have. The midterm and final are super easy. All the questions on the quizzes that you take will be on the midterm and final!!!!!! Great teacher easy GEC!!!
Amazing teacher. She is the bomb - diggity. Shes got long legs and a great nact for teaching. She's great and a beaut.

Overall a good teacher.  She is a very fair grader and if you put in just a little effort you should have no problem getting an A.  She frequently lets you out early and she doesn't expect an insane amount of work from you since it's just a GEC.  I highly recomend her to fill your GEC

New but good Teacher, still needs a little time to get the hang of things. But, she does let you know very clearly what will be on the tests and gives examples of "A" papers for the written assignments. Overall a good new teacher who should be great in the future. She's an easy grader and you don't need to buy the book if you actually attend class.

Unless you know you like anthropology I wouldn't take this class.  Julia was a really nice person, but I thought her lectures were confusing and unclear.  I was really surprised at how hard this class was.

summary_comment: Professor Justus is generally perceived as a friendly and approachable instructor with extensive research experience that enhances her lectures. Students find her classes manageable if they attend regularly and complete homework, though some criticize the use of scantrons and the clarity of exams. Overall, while many students appreciate her friendliness and the relevance of the material, there are concerns about exam clarity and the length of lectures.
summary_comment_short: Professor Justus is highly regarded for her professionalism and approachability, with extensive real-world experience that enriches her lectures. However, some students find her exams challenging and her teaching methods, particularly the use of scantrons and lengthy PowerPoint presentations, to be less than ideal.

Ratings.comment: Very professional and very approachable. Her research and work background provide excellent examples for illustrating points made in class. Highly recommended.
If you go to class and do the homework you'll get a good grade. she's pretty easy and very nice. Wonderful class.

She seems to be more impressed with her research and her own experiences than the actual class material. Additionally, she still uses scantrons for her exams, which SUCKS.  Seriously, who still uses those?  I'm pretty underwhelmed by her myself.  She isn't awful but I've def had better TA's.

Very friendly and laid-back. She has lots of experience in her field, especially for a TA (well she is a PhD student). The course has very interesting material. She teaches off powerpoints the whole time, so if you copy it all down, pay attention, and do all the required reading (as it's assigned!), you don't really have to do any extra studying.
I had Heidi during her first quarter of teaching, and she was clearly not acclimated to the OSU style.  She seems like a nice person, but the exams were unrealistically hard, in my opinion.

She's really sweet, but she comes unprepared to class when it's exam day. Her exams are unclear and wordy, and just the other day she noticed well over 4 different problems with the exam while we were taking it!
She is a great teacher with clear information.  Power point notes are a little long for each class, but exams are exactly what she covers in exam review.
Her test aren't too clear, and her notes/lectures were way too long, and often boring. Other than that, she was cool.

summary_comment: Professor Gregoricka is generally regarded as a knowledgeable and engaging teacher who helps students understand the material effectively. Her classes are described as manageable and fair, though some caution that the final exam can be challenging. While opinions vary, many students appreciate her clear teaching style and willingness to assist, though a few found the course difficult without consistent attendance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gregoricka is highly regarded for her teaching clarity and student engagement, though opinions vary regarding the difficulty level and the usefulness of the course for General Education credit. Students generally find her approachable and effective in helping them understand the material, with some noting that she provides useful information for tests and quizzes.

Ratings.comment: Lesley is very nice and very clear in her teaching. She requires you to be in class as part of participation, but the class is not hard at all. She will usually tell you what is on the tests and quizzes, and she really cares about helping you do well in the class. Easy GEC class with a very nice teacher.

This class went well and was fair all the way up to the final exam. She expects you to memorize a bunch of dates and classifications throughout evolution. I had a solid A in the class until this final. I wouldn't recommend this as a GEC. Take Bio, food science,  or something else!
Great teacher! I am pretty sure that she bumped up my grade a little to give me the A. Just got to class and pay attention. Don't buy the book. Very easy gec credit.

Lesley was a great teacher. She was interesting, didn't read directly from the slide, she definitely knew what she was talking about and was pretty easy. You don't have to read the textbook (I didn't even buy it) and the exams weren't two bad. Go to class and you will come out with at least a B.
horrible.
This is a GREAT teacher. She is wicked smart. do your homework
this class isn't hard unless you go to ohio state

Me fail anthro?  That's unpossible!  Lesley is a great teacher and I feel like I learned so much in her class.  Plus, she's one of the few profs who actually has a sense of humor!  Take her class if you can!

This class is one of the best classes ever! It's not that hard.. six pages of notes is not that demanding. I wish Lesley would challenge us even more! But I do agree-attendance is dumb. I also would like more daily jokes. Lesley, if you read this, more jokes please.
Super fun lady

Lesley is a great teacher and you can tell she is very enthusiastic about the material.  That definitely helps her get her points across.  Come to class, stay on top of the material, and you will get an A...but you have to work for it.  Also, in my opinion, Lesley has both a cute appearance and personality.

Go to class and take good notes, she doesn't post them on carmen so you must attend class. Exams are pretty straight forward as long as one stays on top of the material. She is pretty smart, funny and not to bad on the eyes either.

I agree with the rest of the comments- there is a lot of material. The class is very interesting though and Lesley is a great teacher. If you come to class every day and take decent notes you will do well.
Great class - lots of information, but manageable if you keep up with it.  Prof is very willing to meet outside of class if you need help.

Very hard for an intro class. Covers way to much information even for people who come everyday. Very hard and pretty strict about class rules. Goes through slides really fast, 2hrs of note taking, & doesn't put notes online. Not recommended if you are trying to learn without being overloaded.

Lesley is a great TA, helpful both in and outside of class.  She makes class very interesting.  A lot of material is covered (avg. of 6 pages of notes per class) and so a lot of material is covered on exams, making it pretty difficult for an intro class.

Class is very interesting and Lesley is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the material, and keeps things interesting, but sometimes she does not seem very approachable sometimes.  I think also that there is a lot of material covered and this is perhaps harder than an intro class should ever be.

summary_comment: Professor Klaus is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge and passion for teaching, often described as one of the best instructors in anthropology. Students appreciate his engaging lectures, clear explanations, and dedication to ensuring student understanding, though some note his physical attractiveness as a minor distraction. His classes are challenging yet rewarding, with a mix of discussions, readings, and substantial writing assignments, leading to significant learning outcomes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Klaus is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge and passion for teaching, often praised for making complex subjects engaging and ensuring students truly understand the material. His dedication to his students is evident through his extra efforts and clear communication, though some comments note his physical appeal as an additional positive aspect.

Ratings.comment: Klaus is right up there with Dr. Yells with how much knowledge and experience he has. I bet he'll change the face of anthropology. He is focused on teaching and runs the extra mile for his students.  The only distraction is how adorable he is. Thumbs up.
Fantastic instructor - engages students, makes the subject interesting, and most of all is interested in making sure the students learn. Sad to see him go!
He was such a great teacher. Clearly everyone loves him. Take his class if you can before he leaves! He will be missed.
My favorite teacher ever! Maybe got a better grade than I deserved, and participation in this class is big, but overall he's great.

haagen is awesome. this was the most interesting class i have taken. he is very clear and makes you want to be in class and learn. not too bad compared to other 597's. 3 one page response papers, easy reading quizzes (never read) and one final paper (8-10 pages) on a country. turn in draft, fix errors and prepare well for presentation. TAKE HAAGEN!

Haagen Klaus is a passionate teacher, who instructs with a well structured lecture, followed by involving the students in a discussion.  Put in the effort, participate and don't be lame and you'll gain a lot from him and his class.  Think outside of your box, even if you don't agree with the anthro-dogma on the material.
very interesting, smart, and totally hot

He got cuter and cuter as the quarter went on.By improving his rugged good looks with a hair cut and a nice beard trim the class became even more interesting!A very interesting person & takes the time to interact with you if you have questions or need clarification. Very intelligent and his teaching reflects that. Averages for tests were in the 80s
No Comments
really really cool guy

Very friendly guy, entertaining lecturer, and does his best to make the class and the material interesting.  Test (non-cumulative, even the final) were not difficult, with averages usually in the 80s.
great guy!
Awesome Prof!! Explained things very well, was interested in teaching and going to lengths to ensure that students understood material.
One of the coolest teachers that I have ever had.  Very passionate about bones and teeth.  Also, very willing to help.

summary_comment: Professor Cosgriff-Hernandez is highly regarded for her engaging and humorous teaching style, which transforms what could be a challenging subject into an enjoyable learning experience. Students praise her clear communication, helpfulness, and ability to make the class material accessible and interesting. Her laid-back approach and willingness to answer questions contribute to a positive classroom environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cosgriff-Hernandez is highly regarded for her engaging and humorous teaching style, which transforms what some students initially perceive as a challenging class into an enjoyable learning experience. Her approach is personable and down-to-earth, making complex material more manageable while fostering a supportive and open classroom environment.

Ratings.comment: I didn't think I would like her at first, but she turned out awesome. Beautiful, brilliant and very funny.

Loved her! She made class so interesting and the way she conducted class really helped me to learn the material. She made me want to come to class and she was hilarious. Her personality is great and she's so down to earth. I would take anything with her!!

This was 597.02.  It was interesting, lots of article reading (no textbook), and discussion based classes.  If you are into more traditional lectures than this class will not be fun.  No final, no midterm, just an 8 page final paper and presentation, with quizzes on everyones. Very nice and helpful teacher, she keeps it real.
I think she was amazing and would take her again in a heartbeat if i had the chance! If you try and keep it real with her she rewards you for hardwork, good work, and honesty.
Like one response from a ways back said its a good GEC class, she makes the class material bearable, and keeps it real.
She is totally awesome...great personality.  Clear. Easy.  Love her side stories...Funny!

Not much to say about the class, it was very straight forward, study and you'll do fine. LOVED this teacher...she's hilarious. I think she rubs some people the wrong way because she's pretty laid back about everything, but she will answer any question you have and is very fair. Nice GEC class, low stress.

Easy class if you take down all the notes. Exams a bit tricky, but if you have studied it at all, you are fine. Good TA who is willing to help when you need it, and she makes the subject matter bearable.
Good teacher but she isn't always the most clear
Very rude.  Does not seem to care for students and very short when answering questions in class.  Talks down to students.  A little politeness would go a long way for her.
Teacher didn't respond to e-mails well.  Flew through notes presented. Final was decieving.
Its a hard class. But, you learn alot.
exams hard, but she tells you what to do to get an a.
Grading policy was not very clear, and she missed the entired week before finals. Final exam looked nothing like other exams.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

She's nice. When first meeting her you're not sure what to expect. Her tests are difficult. Sometimes she seems to not care about the class or teaching, then other times she does. Hard to judge her. I'd put it to a coin flip if you're going to take her.
She sucked! She not helpful at all, she would tell the class one thing then expect another! DO NOT TAKE HER!
A great instructor. Always willing to help. Very fair with quizzes and assignments. Seems to enjoy teaching and has a sincere insterest in the material. Highly recommended!!!

summary_comment: Professor Pinto is known for her engaging and humorous teaching style, making the class enjoyable and interesting. However, she is perceived as challenging, particularly for students who struggle with independent learning or require more detailed explanations, due to her strict grading and tendency to cover a lot of information quickly. Students generally find the class manageable if they take thorough notes and attend lectures regularly, though some find her smile to be insincere and her teaching methods impersonal.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pinto is known for her engaging and humorous teaching style, making the class enjoyable and interesting. However, her grading can be strict, and she tends to cover a lot of information, which can be challenging for students who prefer a more structured approach or additional guidance.

Ratings.comment: Some kids did well, I didnt.  If you are ok reading the book and figuring things out on your own, then she might be for you.  If you have questions about the material, I would find another teacher.

Easy class if you take notes and pay attention. Her study guides were basically the tests, and she went over anything that she thought was difficult several times. She made the class fun and interesting.
Unusually strict with grading at times.

She is so funny and a great teacher! There is so much information in the class to be covered but she does a really good job. The exams are a little hard but Pinto is really helpful at explaining and answering questions if you ask her one on one. You don't need to get the textbook, we never used it. Get Pinto for your Anth 200 teacher, it will rock!
she throws alot of information at you and helps filter out the things you dont need to know
She was pretty good. The tests arent too bad, they were multiple choice, a little short anwser, and some matching. She gives out a study guide, which is great.

This class wasn't very hard as long as you get the notes.  Don't buy the book, you really don't need it. There were a few really short and easy homeworks in the first half, and a few short quizzes in the second half.  It consists mostly of a lot of memorization.
Hard to describe exactly why she's bad. She's not so hard, and she's pretty nice, but she's just bad. Her smile seems really fake. She'll smile at you while she tells you you're failing.

The book is useless.  Her study guides are awesome, thats all you really need.  The first half is a breeze, the second half is more like a hurricane.  The second half is all about monkey and junk... hard section

She was undoubtably the worst teacher I have had at Ohio State. She would always state on thing, then put it on the test as another answer. While she  seems really nice, she is a pain in the you know what. She likes screwing with students grades and gpas. Would NOT reccomend!

I seem to have had a different prof! I took pintos class in the summer, maybe that made the difference? Her questions were EXACTLY from her study guide; before the exams she let us out early and if we wanted help, she would give us all the answers and we would have a review Also, on the exam, the exact questions from the quiz were on there.
Very unclear.  Doesn't believe in instructions on assigments or preparing students for tests.  Avoid this one if you can.

She stumbles over her words a lot and during a lecture she seems to not know what she is talking about...just reading from the overhead. Her tests are HARD to study for...her study guids are pointless.
Deborah is really nice and makes the class pretty interesting. However, her tests are really hard to study for and she is not the most helpful.

summary_comment: Professor Sutton is known for her high-quality teaching, making complex topics accessible and engaging, particularly for students new to anthropology. She maintains a welcoming and relatable demeanor, fostering a positive learning environment. Her lectures are well-organized, relying on a standard textbook while enhancing it with relevant PowerPoint presentations, and she assigns a group project that is manageable in terms of time commitment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sutton is known for her relatable teaching style and ability to spark interest in anthropology, making complex topics accessible to students. Her classes are well-organized around a core textbook, with supplementary powerpoints that enhance understanding without requiring extensive reading.

Ratings.comment: Francis was very relatable and easy to talk to. This was my first anthropology class and she sparked my interest in the subject. The textbook was used for every lecture but she did base her powerpoints on it (so you didn't necessarily have to use it). At the end of the class we had a group project that wasn't very time-consuming.

summary_comment: Professor Jakubowska, known as Gabriela, is highly regarded for her engaging and humorous teaching style, which makes her classes enjoyable and memorable. Students appreciate her willingness to help and her quick responses to emails. While her classes require thorough note-taking, she ensures the material is covered in an entertaining manner, making the learning experience both effective and pleasant.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jakubowska, known as Gabriela, is highly regarded for her engaging and humorous teaching style, which keeps classes lively despite the extensive note-taking required. Students appreciate her availability, energy, and willingness to help, finding her tests manageable with proper preparation and her easy grading on assignments.

Ratings.comment: Very sweet. Attendance not required, pass/no pass
Although I just had Gabriela for Survey, she made waking up for a 8:00AM worth it. She is more than willing to answer any questions and replies to emails quickly! Just to add, she is hilarious.

Gabriela is a great professor.  You do take a lot of notes, but she breaks the monotony with jokes and never seems less than energetic.  She made exam reviews, and if you do a thorough study session a night or two before your test, you should be fine.  I would highly recommend her.
Favorite teacher so far at OSU. Makes class funny and interesting for once!
She's always energetic and cracks jokes throughout the whole class. Her tests are easy and theres not much hw. Easy grader on written assignments as well. Take her class
Great class.  I've been in two of her classes and have enjoyed them.  The tests are easy, lectures are interesting, and the homework is cake. You should totally take her class!

Gabriela is one of my favorite teachers at OSU. I enjoyed going to her classes. Although we took a lot of notes, she made the lectures fun and funny. She also does as much as she can to help her students. Her tests are not that hard if you really study. I recommend you take her class. :)

I agree, Gabriela is a great TA!  Take her if you can!  Tries to keeps things interesting and relevant with some funny YouTube videos to break up the monotony.  We take a LOT of notes though (like 7 pages per lecture) so the exams cover a lot of material and are kind of difficult for an intro class.  I think it's the class itself though.

Gabriela is the best TA ever!  I really enjoy the class and she tries to make some of the drier material funny/interesting.  The course itself is a little difficult, especially if science is not your strong suit.  Quizzes/exams difficult but not impossible, class is graded on a curve.

summary_comment: Professor Marklein is highly regarded by students as an excellent instructor, known for her engaging and supportive teaching style. Students praise her for being approachable, caring, and dedicated to helping them understand the material, though some note that exams can be challenging but are often curved generously. Overall, her classes are seen as both informative and manageable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Marklein is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching, described as both engaging and supportive, with students praising her willingness to help and her genuine care for her students' understanding. Her classes are noted for their fairness and generous grading curves, though some suggest her exams can be challenging.

Ratings.comment: This is the best professor.
She is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!! Just choose her class and you will fall in love with anthropology!!!!!!!!!!!!

I thought was a fantastic professor!  She was so funny, nice, and caring about the students.  There was never a time that I couldn't go to her for help, and she truly wanted us to know the material.  The tests were slightly challenging, but she curved them a lot.  She was  overall one of the best that I've ever had.

I found this class to be extremely easy, but maybe that's just because I have had experience with most of the course topics before. She really cares about her students and will spend extra time clarifying. The lab section of the course is pretty much a joke. Tests are fair, and there are always bonus questions.

Kathryn is a descent teacher. She only has 3 exams and no HW at all. Her exams are tough but very generous curve. First exam was lot tougher than it should have been. Other than that, labs are easy and interesting. She will become a better professor in future.

summary_comment: Professor Hernandez is highly regarded for her easy-going nature and willingness to assist students, consistently receiving praise for her supportive teaching approach.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hernandez is highly regarded for her easy-going nature and willingness to assist students, contributing to a positive learning environment. Her overall teaching quality is characterized by accessibility and supportiveness.

Ratings.comment: Very easy-going and nice. She is always willing to help.

summary_comment: Professor Nugent is an exceptionally effective instructor who keeps her lectures engaging and her office hours productive. Her classes are well-organized and the material is presented in an interesting manner, though students must put in significant effort, particularly by studying the provided slides thoroughly. While no textbook is required, attendance is mandatory for certain exam questions, and participation in the lab component is crucial for grading.
summary_comment_short: Professor Nugent is an exceptionally engaging and knowledgeable instructor who keeps her lectures dynamic and well-organized. She expects thorough preparation and active participation, particularly in attending mandatory classes for certain exam questions, to succeed in her course.

Ratings.comment: As another reviewer mentioned, she really is on fire.  Good teacher as well, and tests are not super easy but definitely not hard (just study the slides carefully before exams and go to class).   No textbook!

This professor is on fire in her lectures, totally on top of it in office hours, and she won't just give you her A without you going hard.  Class was well organized and structured, material was actually somewhat interesting.  Book not required.  Posted slides online but attendence mandatory for some exam questions.  Lab component graded on attendan

summary_comment: Professor Kyle is highly regarded for her enjoyable and engaging teaching style, which makes the class fun and interesting regardless of the subject matter. Students appreciate her fairness in grading and consider her to be an excellent instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kyle is highly regarded for her enjoyable and engaging teaching style, which makes the lectures fun and interesting. Students consistently praise her fairness and overall quality as a teacher.

Ratings.comment: She's very nice and a good teacher. Enjoyable, interesting lectures even though I didn't really care about the subject matter. Pretty as well.
super fun class! great teacher, fair grader, fun lectures.

summary_comment: Professor Gocha is highly passionate about anthropology, making the subject engaging and interesting for students. His classes are generally well-structured with manageable homework and quizzes, and he is known for his clear explanations and entertaining teaching style, including humorous elements like videos and comics. Students consistently praise his enthusiasm and approachability.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gocha is highly passionate about anthropology, making the subject engaging and interesting for students. He is known for his clear explanations, enthusiastic teaching style, and the use of humorous elements like videos and comics to keep classes lively.

Ratings.comment: It is apparent to anyone that Tim Gocha is truly passionate about the subject he teaches. With the way he talks about anthropology, you can't help but be interested in what he is saying. His tests (2 midterms, 1 final) are not all that bad, and you only have 2 quizzes and 2 homeworks overall. Plus, he is a good-looking guy! Take his class!

He has to be one of the most passionate people I have ever met. He's SO interested in what he teaches that it almost transfers to the rest of the class. I found myself laughing out loud and wanting to go to his class. Overall, if you have to take an easy GEC, take his class! Easy professor, great guy. Not hard to look at :)
This guy is awesome. Keeps things interesting and at times has some pretty funny videos or comments. Very passionate and knowledgeable about the material and it really shows. He's the man.
He made a potentially boring subject easy to understand and very interesting
Class is very interesting. Very cool guy and helps you if you need it. If you study the material you shouldn't have a problem. Very nice class.

Very engaging, passionate, and knowledgeable about anthropology. He gives online fill-in notes for lectures and has occasional videos during class. Only 2 homework assignments. He even puts a comic at the end of the lecture slideshow. He's a great guy.
Very clear and engaging. One of the most fun professors I've had. He even gives out fill in the blank notes on Carmen.
passionate about class..very clear in what is expected and proves that this class can be fun
Great teacher, very helpful, comes prepared. He'll bring your interest in the subject out if you really are passionate about it.

summary_comment: Professor Da Gloria is a dedicated and passionate educator who genuinely loves his work. However, his teaching style can be challenging, as some students find him hard to understand and tend to speed through slides without providing sufficient detail or support. Despite this, many appreciate his willingness to help during office hours and his overall positive demeanor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Da Gloria is an enthusiastic and dedicated educator who genuinely loves his subject matter, though his teaching style can be challenging for some students due to his sometimes difficult-to-follow explanations and rapid pace through slides. Despite these challenges, he is willing to assist students during office hours and values their engagement.

Ratings.comment: I really enjoyed Pedro's class. I don't agree that he was a bad teacher. He was hard to understand at times, but he always went out of his way to help me when I went to his office hours. Not only that, but he is a really nice guy and a dedicated worker. He really loves his work and is great at it. Don't hate just because he's foreign.
Unable to understand, speeds through slides, will not post notes online, if a student were to ask a question, he'll just start talking about something else and completely ignore the question.

summary_comment: Professor McCormick, now at the University of West Georgia, is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality. She offers a variety of assignments to support student learning and ensures fair grading, making her classes accessible and engaging. Students consistently praise her approachable and humorous teaching style, as well as her dedication to helping them succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor McCormick is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, which include a variety of assignments to support student learning and fair grading. Her classes are described as engaging, supportive, and manageable in workload, with students consistently praising her approachability and dedication to helping them succeed.

Ratings.comment: She's actually at the University of West Georgia now. She's a great teacher. She realizes that not everyone is a great test-taker, so she has lots of other assignments to supplement the tests. I highly recommend her!

Lara's class is great. Perfect for fulfilling extra Anthro major courses or regular GECs. One presentation, small quizzes to make sure you read, and 2-3 very short papers reviewing articles. Do the work, and you will DEFINITELY get an A. Lara is awesome, too!!

I took the women and development course, it is a lot of fun and very interesting material. Lara is a great teacher, very relatable and comical. Workload is not to bad, as long as you pay attention and fallow her guidelines you will get an A!
Best professor I have had at OSU.  Extremely nice and helpful.  Very interesting lectures! Grades very fairly, if you do the work you'll get a good grade.

I took Anthro 597.01, and this was a great class.  It was awesome to go to class everyday and have discussions.  The quizzes were cake...If you have to take this class, look for her.  If you just show up and do the work, you'll get an A.

No one can grade her enough. She is simply the BEST EVER. I LOVE LARA, all she wants is students to learn and ace the class. She is a wonderful professor. I loved her class so much that I fell in love with a classmate. I will definitely recommend her as the top of anyone's list.

I didn't really know what this class was going to be like when I enrolled but it was my favorite class last quarter, despite being at 8:30 in the morning and having to discuss articles that I barely had the time to read. I learned so much stuff about so many things that I hadn't even thought about before. She is super helpful and nice.

Professor Lara was great!  I thought her exams were easy, but I also studied a lot and never missed class.  She takes attendance every day, and she always posts her notes online before class, so you can follow her with the notes and add your own insight instead of writing all of the notes yourself.
Pretty easy class.  She takes attendance everyday, but posts the notes online.  Study guides for test will tell you exactly what you need to know for exams.
No Comments
No Comments
Professor Lara is the best !  She makes class fun and her door is always open. She's very understanding and will do anything to let you understand the material better.
Great Teacher
No Comments

McCormick is best professor I have had.  She posts every lecture ahead of class time so you are able to review and know what the lecture will be about - plus you don't need to take your own notes. This is a major plus because it is a hard class and she challenges her students. Her door is always ope
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Chan is a knowledgeable instructor who becomes increasingly supportive as the semester progresses, making her class much easier to manage. Her lectures are clear and comprehensive, though she expects students to take detailed notes from PowerPoint slides since the study guide alone is insufficient for exam preparation. Attendance is mandatory, and the class involves significant reading and pop quizzes, but overall, it is not a difficult course, with grades primarily based on a midterm and final exam.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chan is an effective instructor who initially emphasizes student-led learning in a flipped classroom model but becomes more engaging and supportive as the semester progresses, significantly enhancing the learning experience. Her lectures are clear and comprehensive, though she provides limited online resources, and students must rely heavily on in-class discussions, pop quizzes, and detailed note-taking to succeed.

Ratings.comment: Took the flipped class. At first it was a bit annoying since she wouldn't go over the material with us (we had to work with classmates instead) but as the semester progressed she became more involved and made her class 100x's easier.

Lectures non stop.  Power point is not online.  Will give study guide but guess what, some of the questions on the test will not be on there so if you'res just studying the guide, you're studying for a B at best......the study guide should be used with the notes.  She's very vague about what to study so it's intense.

There's a lot of reading for this class.  Attendance is definitely mandatory; the class is discussion based and there are 4 pop quizzes throughout the quarter.  But it wasn't really a hard class.  I would have gotten an A, but I missed one of the pop quizzes.  If you go to class and write decent papers you should get a good grade.

She knows what she's talking, very clear lectures. Attendance is mandatory for her class. Expect to write about 5-6 pages every lectures. I can survive without a textbook, as long as you copy down all the power point slides. Exams are not so difficult.
Great teacher, knows her material, loves what she does, basis of your grades are the midterm and final
Joyce is awesome! She is very clear and does not nit pick on exams.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Schubert is highly regarded for his passion and expertise in the subject matter, making his lectures engaging and informative. Students find his teaching style friendly and supportive, noting his helpfulness during office hours and his ability to make complex material more accessible. While the coursework can be challenging, particularly with the need for significant memorization, many students still highly recommend taking a class with him due to his enthusiasm and dedication.
summary_comment_short: Professor Schubert is highly regarded for his passion and expertise in the subject matter, making his lectures engaging and informative. Students consistently praise his helpfulness, both in and out of class, and note his commitment to their learning, despite the challenging material that requires significant memorization and study.

Ratings.comment: Rob was an amazing prof, he totally loves the topic, which comes through in his lectures. It was very refreshing to take a course that the professor was so passionate about. The tests are tough, definitely have to read and study, the information is very interesting so it's not so bad. If you are going to take the class, Rob is your guy.

He was fantastic! I had him at cscc for Into to Soc and it was a lot of fun. I don't think he likes primates as much anymore though- he was almost killed by them once! He was very helpful and his lectures were fun. I would take another class with him.
Rob was nice.  Primates were cute and interesting.  I enjoyed the historical info about Charles Darwin and others.
Very nice instructor.  Primates very interesting, and they are a main instructor of instructor.  Has good examples and PowerPoint illustrations.
Extremely helpful, material kinda complicated, lots of memorization; got a B in the class.  If you have to take it, take it with Rob.
No Comments

Rob is such a hottie and very helpful.  He is very passionate about his work and his studies and it shows through in his teaching.  He is very helpful in his office hours and is a very kind and interesting individual.

Difficult material, good teacher - very friendly and HOT, especially for a self proclaimed dork! His love for primates was adorable and made that section of the class very interesting. I highly recommend this TA...

awesome class. hard, but rob is a GTA passionate about the primates he studies, which makes this intro class so much better than if an uninterested full professor was teaching it. difficult subject matter, but schubert does a great job, willing to help.

summary_comment: Professor Zotova offers an engaging course on global cultures, though students note that she could benefit from speaking louder or using a microphone to ensure clarity, particularly for those in the back of the classroom. The course includes five random pop quizzes that are manageable if students stay attentive and read the required textbook, which is crucial for preparing for the final exam.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zotova offers an engaging course on global cultures but struggles with being heard without amplification; her lectures are clear despite her thin accent. The class includes five random pop quizzes that are manageable with attentive listening, and students are advised to read the textbook thoroughly for the final exam.

Ratings.comment: A very interesting class to learn about culture of the world, the biggest problem with Natalia is that she needs to speak louder or get a microphone. Her accent is thin and it is easy to understand her. There are 5 pop quizzes that are random that aren't too difficult if you pay attention, but you should read the book, especially for the final

summary_comment: Professor Maggiano is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which fosters a relaxed and intellectually stimulating environment. He is dedicated to helping students understand complex concepts and is willing to go above and beyond to assist them, though his tests can be challenging and require significant preparation. Students who put in the effort find his classes valuable and often perform well, but those looking for an easy ride may struggle.
summary_comment_short: Professor Maggiano is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which fosters a relaxed and intellectually stimulating environment. However, his exams are known to be challenging, and there is often uncertainty about the exact material to study.

Ratings.comment: Okay so he is an amazing guy.  Really funny and willing to work with you. He held study sessions with us all the time and would even push back his dinner and schedule for us.  BUT his tests are very hard and it's not clear what exactly to study.  He made us really learn though so that's good. Don't take unless you're an anthro major though.  EC tho

Not a science major or anything but this class was awesome and Corey was great. Give a well-rounded response to test and quiz questions and as long as it makes sense you'll receive credit. He definitely adds effort into grade but you will learn a lot and if you give effort you'll get an A.

Class is definitely intellectually stimulating. He has a laid back personality and is relatable. Sit in a circle and basically talk the entire class time. Quizzes are easy if you read, the articles are short compared to all other 597 courses. Final paper get to pick your own topic on genetics

Good teacher! Extremely talented and knowledge! But he is a harsh grader! You have to pay much attention to the class and to the reading. I got an A-. And he told me, he was very proud of me. The anthropology course is very helpful! I guarantee it will give you a new world view.

Corey was a GREAT professor.  His class wasn't extremely easy, but he had an infectious passion for the subject.  He was a funny guy, and definitely knowledgable about anthropology.  Paying attention in lecture and studying are mandatory if you want to pass, but he definitely is willing to help students better understand.

One of the best teachers I have ever had! He makes class interesting and fun. He cares about his students and is very willing to help if you do not understand something. As long as you go to class, take notes, and pay attention than you will do fine on the tests and quizzes.
Awesome prof!
His quizzes and midterms are worded haphazardly so that the answer that you thought was "the best" turns out to be the wrong one. Really didn't learn a whole lot but it is a GEC so I guess thats ok.

Professor brilliant and open to questions and subject surprisingly interesting, but class difficult. Challenging exams, some pop quizzes, a group project... overall, happy with my grade. But this class is not for those who just want an easy GEC credit.

summary_comment: Professor Morris is known for her comprehensive exam coverage but is widely regarded as frustrating due to her scattered lectures and occasional inaccuracies in definitions. Students find her classes exceptionally challenging and not recommended for those seeking an easy course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Morris is known for her challenging exams and coverage of material, but her lectures are often described as boring and confusing due to her tendency to be scattered and provide incorrect definitions, which she then has to correct. Students generally advise against taking her class if ease is a priority.

Ratings.comment: She is nice, but is the most annoyingly frustrating professor i think I've ever had.  Lecture is super boring, she is extremely scattered and will give you the wrong definition and then have to re explain herself.  Her exams cover the information, but random things we barely would go over. Do NOT take this if your looking for a simple easy class.

summary_comment: Professor Spence is highly regarded for her intellectual stimulation and ability to make complex topics accessible. Students find her approachable and supportive, with many praising her willingness to help and her quick response to emails. While the class can be challenging, particularly with the amount of material to memorize, her lectures are engaging and the material is often provided through her PowerPoint presentations, making it easier to keep up.
summary_comment_short: Professor Spence is highly regarded for her intellectual stimulation and willingness to help students, though her classes are challenging, particularly at the -200 level, with extensive memorization required. Despite the difficulty, she is described as very supportive and responsive, making her a strong and enjoyable instructor.

Ratings.comment: This class was impossibly hard for a -200 level. For one test you have to know about 200 terms. Needs to be split up or allow students to have a cheat sheet or something.

Class readings were very hard and full of medical terminology beyond the pre-requisites for the class. Prof. Spence was very helpful and very nice. There are a lot of writings but she will help you out in any way she can. Responds to emails quickly. Great professor, very nice.
Okay class, starts off easier then gets harder while you go. There's a lot of writing other than that exams are ok. I got a B and just slept and did sudoku's every class.

Intellectually stimulating class. Very interesting articles for assigned reading. Review your notes and you'll do fine on the tests. Alot to memorize, but she makes herself available for any questions you might have. Highly recommend her section. She does a great job, fun class!

Lectures are VERY interesting, i definitely learned alot from this professor and class. Exams are fairly easy, and reading/writing assignments are very educational and neccessary because they are on the exams. I would definitely reccomend this class to everyone.
She was a great teacher! The tests were somewhat difficult, but if you go to class and study they are okay. She is willing to help!!!

Her class was extremely interesting and intellectually stimulating.  The material was very easy and was provided in her powerpoint presentations.  I didn't even buy the textbook and had all the information I needed from class notes.  Strongly recommended!

I loved this class and professor!  Go to class, because she takes attendance for points, print slides out early and you wont have to write as much, she tells interesting stories is really helpful and nice.  the content is really interesting and the tests aren't hard if you go to lecture.A good way to fulfill a GEC i recommend it to anyone!!
Very interesting material but a lot of terms to memorize.  Professor Spence is fun and very helpful - she seems new at this but I really enjoyed the class.

summary_comment: Professor Hubbard is highly regarded for her kindness and helpfulness, consistently providing additional resources and making herself available for extra support without judgment. Her teaching style is effective, ensuring students are well-prepared for exams with clear and comprehensive coverage of necessary material. However, some find the course content dry and the material challenging, suggesting alternatives for those who can.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hubbard is highly regarded for her kindness and helpfulness, consistently providing detailed notes and extra support through email. Her teaching style ensures students are well-prepared for exams, though some find the material dry.

Ratings.comment: She is so kind and helpful - always sending notes and helpful ideas through email. Meeting with her outside of class is super easy and she doesn't make you feel dumb if you don't understand something. She goes over exactly what you need to know in class so there are no surprises on the exam. Show up to class and you're golden.

Don't take this class unless you have to! The material is so boring and hard to study. If you have to take this class make sure you get the text book AND read it even if she tells you several times you dont need it... thats the mistake I made. Amy seems like a nice person just not the best instructor for this course I would suggest anyone but her.
awesome

Seeing someone passionate about something that puts you to sleep helps a bit, but I still hated this class.  With that being said, Amy was cool but some stuff she had us do was stupid.  Group work online?  The exams were stupid and her notes don't help that much.  I'd recommend someone else...

Nice, lighthearted, and good sense of humor. Attendance mandatory, but she'll email you the notes.  Exams/quizzes very straightforward.  One paper to write, also very reasonable.  Book isn't required at all.  Material itself is quite dry (IMO), but that's the subject matter, not the lecturer.  No excuse at all for not doing well in this class.
Easy GEC, if you go to class she emails you the notes so you dont even have to take notes.  East exams, interesting class.
She is amazing. She keeps the class interesting even if you're not interested. It's an easy class especially if you need a GEC. Don't bother buying the book, we didn't touch it.
she is the best.
I found the material to be very interesting and I really enjoyed her lectures. You almost always get out of class early, and she is very willing to help students.

If you are going to take anthropology 200, switcht teachers. She has no clue what she is talking about. Not a hard class but soooooo boring. One bonus is that she always lets the class out about an hour early...maybe because she can't think of anything else to say
Easy, easy class. Prof very nice and helpful. Hardly gives homework. Just show up to class and get the notes and you will be fine.
She is very helpful and knowledgable.  she is also very cute.

summary_comment: Professor Shaffer, known as Marnie or Marian, is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate teaching style. Students appreciate her interesting course content, her ability to inspire enthusiasm for the subject, and her willingness to help. While her tests are challenging, her classes are generally considered enjoyable and informative.
summary_comment_short: Professor Shaffer, known as Marnie or Marian, is highly regarded for her engaging teaching style and passionate approach to her subject matter. Students find her classes easy and enjoyable, with many praising her willingness to help and her interesting personal anecdotes that enhance the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Easy Class. Nice teacher. Interesting course subject. Absolutely take this class.
I loved Marnie she really re-sparked my passion in my major and helped me to understand why I was studying what I am!

One of the nicest and most interesting professors I have had at OSU.  She is very well traveled, and talks a lot about her research and upcoming trip to South Africa.  Tests are not too difficult and class is relatively painless.
Marnie was very interested in teaching and willing to help.  She was one of my favorite teachers.

Marnie, also goes by Marian, was really fun. We watched alot of youtube videos and she talked alot about her travels to Scotland, Africa, etc. Her tests are hard but she's really into her subject material.

summary_comment: Professor Thompson is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, with students consistently praising his thorough coverage of course material and the practicality of his assessments. His classes require attentive note-taking and engagement with both lectures and readings, but students find the tests straightforward and based primarily on these materials.
summary_comment_short: Professor Thompson is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and comprehensive coverage of course material. Students consistently recommend attending office hours, taking thorough notes, and reading all assigned materials, as his exams are based on these sources and are generally found to be straightforward and fair.

Ratings.comment: My first class w/ him was 401. Aced the first two tests and didn't have to take the final. I've taken two other courses with him since then and find his teaching style to be excellent. Visit him in office hours! Also make sure to take good notes and read the textbooks and other readings because tests are based on all of those (especially notes).

Very interesting class.  I probably learned the most from this class than any other (and I'm a junior!) Tests are very simple (we even helped make them).  The hardest part was a 4 pg book review on "The Fall of the Ancient Maya".  Just show up, pay attention, and take notes.  Cool guy.

Dr. Thompson is a fair teacher.  His lectures are somewhat boring because this was a methods class and he goes into lots of detail, but pay attention, take notes, and read the book and you will do fine.  The exams were based on notes and the book.  They were pretty easy, but you get to drop one, too.  I learned a lot in this class and enjoyed it.

summary_comment: Professor Chambers is highly regarded for her comprehensive yet accessible teaching style, making complex material approachable and engaging. Students appreciate her knowledge, enthusiasm, and encouragement to think critically. Her classes are well-organized, though some note that they can be fast-paced, and success hinges on active participation and thorough note-taking.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chambers is highly regarded for her knowledgeable and engaging teaching style, effectively presenting complex information in an accessible manner. Students appreciate her enthusiasm, clear explanations, and ability to inspire critical thinking, though some note that lectures can be lengthy and detailed notes are crucial for success on exams.

Ratings.comment: There is a lot of information to learn in this class, but she presents it in a manner that is not overwhelming. She is extremely knowledgable on the material, really urges you to think outside the box, and has a great energy about her. I absolutely recommend her!!!
Great teacher! She knees the material and teaches it well. I had no interest in Anthropology but her class made me love it. I highly recommend her!

I don't remember a lot from this class honestly, I took it with a slew of GEC's. I remember that I got an A, and that the exams followed the power points to a T, which was super helpful when you are a non-major and ready to graduate! Sometimes she talks fast ha. But shes really upbeat and enthusiastic. Shows up with a smile on her face.

she published slides, but purposefully leaves things out. go to class and fill in the notes, sit toward the front, ask a question every once in a while, you'll be fine. tests and quizzes are pretty much all based on definitions and stuff, not much depth.
I went to class and studied her test prep questions and got an A-.  Losing even a few point will knock you out of a solid A, but she was young and friendly so it was ok.  I recommend her.

Great young teacher, who really cares about her students understanding the material. Uses powerpoint slides in class and tries to throw in a little dry humor every now and then to make the class more exciting, also very attractive.
She's great!

Very clear explanations, gives plenty of examples. There is a lot of material to cover, so lectures can be long. Exams are fair, but you must take detailed notes in class to do well. No curve. Spices up lectures with quirky humor and videos, overall very good professor.
easy if you memorize the powerpoints. thats all the exams are. she tries to ass humor to boring material, makes it a little better. very attractive. definitely recommend highly
No Comments

One of the best professors I've had at Ohio State so far.  She is very willing to stay after to help you understand anything that may be unclear.  Some of the Anthro material can get boring, but she has a way of spicing it up with her sense of humor. Young teacher who can relate to students very easily.  Definitely try to get her for this GEC.
She is really attractive, incredibly smart, and seems very nice. The class isn't to bad either.

summary_comment: Professor Schlect's lectures are engaging and he presents material clearly. However, his availability for additional support outside of class is limited, with delayed and unhelpful email responses. Additionally, his experience as a professor for large classes is questionable given his background as a graduate student.
summary_comment_short: Professor Schlect excelled in making his class engaging and ensuring clarity in his teachings. However, he fell short in providing timely and helpful support outside of class, with delayed and unresponsive email communication. Additionally, his experience as a graduate student leading a large class of 80 suggests he may not be well-suited for this role.

Ratings.comment: The class was very interesting and the professor was nice and clear while teaching.  Although, if you need any help outside of class..this guy won't help. Email response is late and not helpful. He is also the perfect example of why graduate students should NOT be professors for a class of 80 people.
No Comments
